	<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">Albania</h1>
	
	<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
		<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
		<div id="contentSub"></div>
		
		
		
		<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">Jump to navigation</a>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#p-search">Jump to search</a>
		<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">This article is about the country. For other uses, see <a href="/wiki/Albania_(disambiguation)" class="mw-disambig" title="Albania (disambiguation)">Albania (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">
</p>
<div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">country in Southeast Europe</div>
<table class="infobox geography vcard" style="width:22em;font-size:88%;"><tbody><tr><th colspan="2" class="adr" style="text-align:center;font-size:125%;font-weight:bold;padding:0.25em 0.33em 0.33em;line-height:1.2em;font-size:1.25em;"><div style="display:inline" class="fn org country-name">Republic of Albania</div><br /><div style="padding-top:0.25em; font-weight:normal;"><span style="font-size:85%;"><i lang="sq" title="Albanian language text">Republika e Shqipërisë</i></span></div></th></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;text-align:center;padding:0.5em 0;"><div style="display:table; width:100%;">

</div></th><td>February 1272</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;<a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Albania_(medieval)" title="Principality of Albania (medieval)">Princedom of Albania</a> </div></th><td>1368</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;<a href="/wiki/League_of_Lezh%C3%AB" title="League of Lezhë">League of Lezhë</a> </div></th><td>2 March 1444</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;Proclamation of independence from <span class="nowrap">the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a></span> </div></th><td>28 November 1912</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;<a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Albania" title="Principality of Albania">Principality of Albania</a> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Recognised)</span> </div></th><td>29 July 1913</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;<a href="/wiki/Albanian_Republic" title="Albanian Republic">1st Republic of Albania</a> </div></th><td>31 January 1925</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;<a href="/wiki/Albanian_Kingdom_(1928%E2%80%9339)" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Kingdom (1928–39)">Kingdom of Albania</a> </div></th><td>1 September 1928</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;<a href="/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="People&#39;s Republic of Albania">2nd Republic of Albania</a> </div></th><td>11 January 1946</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;<a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_the_People%27s_Socialist_Republic_of_Albania" title="Constitution of the People&#39;s Socialist Republic of Albania">3rd Republic of Albania</a> </div></th><td>28 December 1976</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;4th Republic of Albania<br /><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Albania" title="Constitution of Albania">Current constitution</a></span> </div></th><td>29 April 1991<br /><br />28 November 1998</td></tr><tr style="display:none"><td colspan="2">
</td></tr><tr class="mergedtoprow"><th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Albania" title="Geography of Albania">Area </a></th></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;Total</div></th><td>28,748&#160;km<sup>2</sup> (11,100&#160;sq&#160;mi)&#32;(<a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area" title="List of countries and dependencies by area">140th</a>)</td></tr><tr class="mergedbottomrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;Water&#160;(%)</div></th><td>4.7</td></tr><tr class="mergedtoprow"><th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Albania" title="Demographics of Albania">Population</a></th></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;January 2017 estimate</div></th><td><img alt="Increase" data-file-width="300" data-file-height="300" /> 2,876,591<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1">&#91;1&#93;</a></sup></td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div capita</div></th><td>$13,330<sup id="cite_ref-imf2_3-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-imf2-3">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup></td></tr><tr class="mergedtoprow"><th scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Gross_domestic_product" title="Gross domestic product">GDP</a>&#160;<span style="font-weight:normal;">(nominal)</span></th><td>2018&#160;estimate</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;Total</div></th><td>$15.121&#160;billion<sup id="cite_ref-imf2_3-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-imf2-3">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup></td></tr><tr class="mergedbottomrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;Per capita</div></th><td>$5,261<sup id="cite_ref-imf2_3-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-imf2-3">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup></td></tr><tr><th scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Gini_coefficient" title="Gini coefficient">Gini</a>&#160;<span style="font-weight:normal;">(2013)</span></th><td>34.5<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">&#91;4&#93;</a></sup><br /><span style="white-space:nowrap;"><span style="color:orange">medium</span></span></td></tr><tr><th scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Human_Development_Index" title="Human Development Index">HDI</a>&#160;<span style="font-weight:normal;">(2018)</span></th><td><img alt="Increase" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Increase2.svg/11px-Increase2.svg.png" decoding="async" title="Increase" href="#cite_note-HDI-5">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup><br /><span style="white-space:nowrap;"><span style="color:forestgreen">high</span></span>&#160;·&#160;<a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_Human_Development_Index" title="List of countries by Human Development Index">68th</a></td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Currency</th><td><a href="/wiki/Albanian_lek" href="/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time" title="Coordinated Universal Time">UTC</a>+1</span> (<a href="/wiki/Central_European_Time" title="Central European Time">CET</a>)</td></tr><tr class="mergedbottomrow"><th scope="row"><div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">•&#160;Summer&#160;(<a href="/wiki/Daylight_saving_time" title="Daylight saving time">DST</a>)</div></th><td><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time" title="Coordinated Universal Time">UTC</a>+2</span> (<a href="/wiki/Central_European_Summer_Time" title="Central European Summer Time">CEST</a>)</td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Date format</th><td>dd/mm/yyyy</td></tr><tr><th scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Left-_and_right-hand_traffic" title="Left- and right-hand traffic">Driving side</a></th><td>right</td></tr><tr><th scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_Albania" title="Telephone numbers in Albania">Calling code</a></th><td><a href="/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_Albania" title="Telephone numbers in Albania">+355</a></td></tr><tr><th scope="row"><a href="/wiki/ISO_3166" title="ISO 3166">ISO 3166 code</a></th><td><a href="/wiki/ISO_3166-2:AL" title="ISO 3166-2:AL">AL</a></td></tr><tr><th scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Country_code_top-level_domain" title="Country code top-level domain">Internet TLD</a></th><td><a href="/wiki/.al" title=".al">.al</a></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Albania</b> (<span class="nowrap"><span class="IPA nopopups noexcerpt"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/English" title="Help:IPA/English">/<span style="border-bottom:1px dotted"><span title="/æ/: &#39;a&#39; in &#39;bad&#39;">æ</span><span title="&#39;l&#39; in &#39;lie&#39;">l</span><span title="/ˈ/: primary stress follows">ˈ</span><span title="&#39;b&#39; in &#39;buy&#39;">b</span><span title="/eɪ/: &#39;a&#39; in &#39;face&#39;">eɪ</span><span title="&#39;n&#39; in &#39;nigh&#39;">n</span><span title="/i/: &#39;y&#39; in &#39;happy&#39;">i</span><span title="/ə/: &#39;a&#39; in &#39;about&#39;">ə</span></span>, <wbr /><span style="border-bottom:1px dotted"><span title="/ɔː/: &#39;au&#39; in &#39;fraud&#39;">ɔː</span><span title="&#39;l&#39; in &#39;lie&#39;">l</span></span>-/</a></span>&#32;<span class="nowrap" style="font-size:85%">(<span class="unicode haudio"><span class="fn"><span style="white-space:nowrap;margin-right:.25em;"><a href="/wiki/File:En-us-Albania.ogg" title="About this sound"><img alt="About this sound" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png" decoding="async" width="11" height="11" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/17px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/22px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="20" data-file-height="20" /></a></span><a href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/b3/En-us-Albania.ogg" class="internal" title="En-us-Albania.ogg">listen</a></span></span>)</span></span> <a href="/wiki/Help:Pronunciation_respelling_key" title="Help:Pronunciation respelling key"><i title="English pronunciation respelling">a(w)l-<span style="font-size:90%">BAY</span>-nee-ə</i></a>; <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a>: <i lang="sq">Shqipëri or Shqipëria</i>; <a href="/wiki/Gheg_Albanian_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Gheg Albanian language">Gheg Albanian</a>: <i lang="aln">Shqipni or Shqipnia also Shqypni or Shqypnia</i>),<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup> officially the <b>Republic of Albania</b> (<a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a>: <i lang="sq">Republika e Shqipërisë</i>, <small>pronounced&#160;</small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Albanian" title="Help:IPA/Albanian">[ɾɛpuˈblika ɛ ʃcipəˈɾiːsə]</a></span>), is a country in <a href="/wiki/Southeast_Europe" title="Southeast Europe">Southeast Europe</a> on the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ionian_Sea" title="Ionian Sea">Ionian Sea</a> within the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a>. It shares <a href="/wiki/Land_border" class="mw-redirect" title="Land border">land borders</a> with <a href="/wiki/Montenegro" title="Montenegro">Montenegro</a> to the northwest, <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a><span style="font-size:85%;"><sup id="cite_ref-status_7-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-status-7">&#91;a&#93;</a></sup></span> to the northeast, <a href="/wiki/North_Macedonia" title="North Macedonia">North Macedonia</a> to the east, <a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greece</a> to the south and <a href="/wiki/Maritime_border" class="mw-redirect" title="Maritime border">maritime borders</a> with Greece, Montenegro and <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a> to the west.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Albania" title="Geography of Albania">Geographically</a>, the country displays varied <a href="/wiki/Climatic" class="mw-redirect" title="Climatic">climatic</a>, <a href="/wiki/Geological" class="mw-redirect" title="Geological">geological</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hydrological" class="mw-redirect" title="Hydrological">hydrological</a> and <a href="/wiki/Geomorphological" class="mw-redirect" title="Geomorphological">morphological</a> conditions, defined in an area of 28,748&#160;km<sup>2</sup> (11,100&#160;sq&#160;mi). It possesses remarkable diversity with the <a href="/wiki/Landscape" title="Landscape">landscape</a> ranging from the snow-capped mountains in the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a> as well as the <a href="/wiki/Korab" title="Korab">Korab</a>, <a href="/wiki/Central_Mountain_Range,_Albania#Skanderbeg_Mountains" class="mw-redirect" title="Central Mountain Range, Albania">Skanderbeg</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pindus_Mountains" class="mw-redirect" title="Pindus Mountains">Pindus</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ceraunian_Mountains" title="Ceraunian Mountains">Ceraunian Mountains</a> to the hot and sunny coasts of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Albanian Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ionian_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Ionian Sea Coast">Ionian Sea</a> along the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Basin" title="Mediterranean Basin">Mediterranean Sea</a>.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/History_of_Albania" title="History of Albania">Historically</a>, the country has been inhabited by numerous civilisations such as the <a href="/wiki/Illyrians" title="Illyrians">Illyrians</a>, <a href="/wiki/Thracians" title="Thracians">Thracians</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ancient_Greek" title="Ancient Greek">Ancient Greeks</a>, <a href="/wiki/Roman_Empire" title="Roman Empire">Romans</a>, <a href="/wiki/Byzantine_Empire" title="Byzantine Empire">Byzantines</a>, <a href="/wiki/Venetian_Empire" class="mw-redirect" title="Venetian Empire">Venetians</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottomans</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> established the autonomous <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Arb%C3%ABr" class="mw-redirect" title="Principality of Arbër">Principality of Arbër</a> in the 12th century. The <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Albania_(medieval)" title="Kingdom of Albania (medieval)">Kingdom of Albania</a> and <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Albania_(medieval)" title="Principality of Albania (medieval)">Principality of Albania</a> has been formed between the 13th and 14th centuries. Prior to the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Ottoman Albania">Ottoman conquest of Albania</a> in the 15th century, the <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg#Rebellion_against_the_Ottomans" title="Skanderbeg">Albanian resistance</a> to Ottoman expansion into Europe led by <a href="/wiki/Gjergj_Kastrioti_Skanderbeg" class="mw-redirect" title="Gjergj Kastrioti Skanderbeg">Gjergj Kastrioti Skanderbeg</a> won them acclaim all over most of Europe.
</p><p>Between the 18th and 19th centuries, Albanians gathered both spiritual and intellectual strength which conclusively led to the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Renaissance" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Renaissance">Albanian Renaissance</a>. After the defeat of the Ottomans in the <a href="/wiki/Balkan_Wars" title="Balkan Wars">Balkan Wars</a>, the modern <a href="/wiki/Nation_state" title="Nation state">nation state</a> of Albania <a href="/wiki/Declaration_of_independence_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Declaration of independence of Albania">emerged</a> in 1912.<sup id="cite_ref-cia_8-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cia-8">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup> In the 20th century, the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Albania_(1928%E2%80%9339)" class="mw-redirect" title="Kingdom of Albania (1928–39)">Kingdom of Albania</a> was invaded by <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Italy" title="Kingdom of Italy">Italy</a> which formed <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Kingdom_(1939%E2%80%9343)" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Kingdom (1939–43)">Greater Albania</a> before becoming a <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Kingdom_(1943%E2%80%9344)" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Kingdom (1943–44)">protectorate</a> of <a href="/wiki/Nazi_Germany" title="Nazi Germany">Nazi Germany</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">&#91;8&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Enver_Hoxha" title="Enver Hoxha">Enver Hoxha</a> formed <a href="/wiki/People%27s_Socialist_Republic_of_Albania" title="People&#39;s Socialist Republic of Albania">Communist Albania</a> after the <a href="/wiki/Second_World_War" class="mw-redirect" title="Second World War">Second World War</a> and launched the Albanians on a path of oppression and decades of isolation. The <a href="/wiki/Revolutions_of_1989" title="Revolutions of 1989">Revolutions of 1991</a> concluded the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">fall of communism in Albania</a> and eventually the establishment of the current Republic of Albania.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Politics_of_Albania" title="Politics of Albania">Politically</a>, the country is a <a href="/wiki/Unitary_state" title="Unitary state">unitary</a> <a href="/wiki/Parliamentary_system" title="Parliamentary system">parliamentary</a> <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_republic" class="mw-redirect" title="Constitutional republic">constitutional republic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Developing_country" title="Developing country">developing country</a> with an upper-middle income <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Albania" title="Economy of Albania">economy</a> dominated by the service sector, followed by manufacturing.<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">&#91;9&#93;</a></sup> It went through a process of transition, following the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">end of communism</a> in 1990, from <a href="/wiki/Centralized_planning" class="mw-redirect" title="Centralized planning">centralized planning</a> to a <a href="/wiki/Market-based_economy" class="mw-redirect" title="Market-based economy">market-based economy</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">&#91;11&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-13">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup> Albania provides <a href="/wiki/Universal_health_care" title="Universal health care">universal health care</a> and free primary and secondary <a href="/wiki/Education_in_Albania" title="Education in Albania">education</a> to its citizens.<sup id="cite_ref-HDI_5-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HDI-5">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The country is a member of the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a>, <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" title="World Bank">World Bank</a>, <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a>, <a href="/wiki/NATO" title="NATO">NATO</a>, <a href="/wiki/World_Trade_Organization" title="World Trade Organization">WTO</a>, <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Europe" title="Council of Europe">COE</a>, <a href="/wiki/Organization_for_Security_and_Co-operation_in_Europe" title="Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe">OSCE</a> and <a href="/wiki/Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation" title="Organisation of Islamic Cooperation">OIC</a>. It is an <a href="/wiki/Accession_of_Albania_to_the_European_Union" title="Accession of Albania to the European Union">official candidate</a> for membership in the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup> It is one of the founding members of the <a href="/wiki/Energy_Community" title="Energy Community">Energy Community</a>, including the <a href="/wiki/Organization_of_the_Black_Sea_Economic_Cooperation" title="Organization of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation">Organization of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation</a>  and <a href="/wiki/Union_for_the_Mediterranean" title="Union for the Mediterranean">Union for the Mediterranean</a>.
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886046785">.mw-parser-output .toclimit-2 .toclevel-1 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-3 .toclevel-2 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-4 .toclevel-3 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-5 .toclevel-4 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-6 .toclevel-5 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-7 .toclevel-6 ul{display:none}</style><div class="toclimit-3"><div id="toc" class="toc"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none" /><div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><h2>Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1"><a href="#Etymology"><span class="tocnumber">1</span> <span class="toctext">Etymology</span></a></li>

<ul>

<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-4"><a href="#Middle_Ages"><span class="tocnumber">2.2</span> <span class="toctext">Middle Ages</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-5"><a href="#Albania_under_the_Ottoman_Empire"><span class="tocnumber">2.2.1</span> <span class="toctext">Albania under the Ottoman Empire</span></a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-6"><a href="#Rilindja"><span class="tocnumber">2.3</span> <span class="toctext">Rilindja</span></a>
<ul>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Etymology">Etymology</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Names_of_the_Albanians_and_Albania" title="Names of the Albanians and Albania">Etymology of Albania</a></div>
<p>The term Albania is the <a href="/wiki/Medieval_Latin" title="Medieval Latin">medieval Latin</a> name of the country. It may be derived from the <a href="/wiki/Illyrian_tribe" class="mw-redirect" title="Illyrian tribe">Illyrian tribe</a> of <a href="/wiki/Albani_(Illyrian_tribe)" class="mw-redirect" title="Albani (Illyrian tribe)">Albani</a> (<a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a>: <i lang="sq">Albanët</i>) recorded by <a href="/wiki/Ptolemy" title="Ptolemy">Ptolemy</a>, the geographer and astronomer from <a href="/wiki/Alexandria" title="Alexandria">Alexandria</a>, who drafted a map in 150&#160;AD, which shows the city of <a href="/wiki/Albanopolis" title="Albanopolis">Albanopolis</a> located northeast of the city of <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-15">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">&#91;15&#93;</a></sup> The term may have a continuation in the name of a medieval settlement called <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Arbanon" title="Principality of Arbanon">Albanon</a> or Arbanon, although it is not certain that this was the same place.<sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-17">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup> 
In his history written in the 10th century, the <a href="/wiki/Byzantine" class="mw-redirect" title="Byzantine">Byzantine</a> historian <a href="/wiki/Michael_Attaliates" class="mw-redirect" title="Michael Attaliates">Michael Attaliates</a> was the first to refer to <a href="/wiki/Albanoi" title="Albanoi">Albanoi</a> as having taken part in a revolt against <a href="/wiki/Constantinople" title="Constantinople">Constantinople</a> in 1043 and to the Arbanitai as subjects of the Duke of <a href="/wiki/Dyrrachium" class="mw-redirect" title="Dyrrachium">Dyrrachium</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-18">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup> During the <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">Middle Ages</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> called their country <i><i lang="sq" title="Albanian language text">Arbëri or Arbëni</i></i> and referred to themselves as <i><i lang="sq" title="Albanian language text"><a href="/wiki/Arb%C3%ABresh%C3%AB_people" title="Arbëreshë people">Arbëreshë</a> or Arbëneshë</i></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">&#91;19&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Nowadays, <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> call their country <i><i lang="sq" title="Albanian language text">Shqipëri or Shqipëria</i></i>. The words <i>Shqipëri</i> and <i>Shqiptar</i> are attested from 14th century onward,<sup id="cite_ref-Matasović_21-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matasović-21">&#91;20&#93;</a></sup> but it was only at the end of 17th and beginning of the early 18th centuries that the placename <i>Shqipëria</i> and the ethnic demonym <i>Shqiptarë</i> gradually replaced <i>Arbëria</i> and <i>Arbëreshë</i> amongst <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a> speakers.<sup id="cite_ref-Lloshi_22-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lloshi-22">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Matasović_21-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matasović-21">&#91;20&#93;</a></sup> The two terms are popularly interpreted as "Land of the Eagles" and "Children of the Eagles".<sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-23">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24">&#91;23&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/History_of_Albania" title="History of Albania">History of Albania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_Albanian_history" title="Timeline of Albanian history">Timeline of Albanian history</a></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_history">Early history</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Prehistoric_Albania" title="Prehistoric Albania">Prehistory of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Parku_Arkeologjik_i_Apollonis%C3%AB_04.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/39/Parku_Arkeologjik_i_Apollonis%C3%AB_04.jpg/220px-Parku_Arkeologjik_i_Apollonis%C3%AB_04.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="150" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/39/Parku_Arkeologjik_i_Apollonis%C3%AB_04.jpg/330px-Parku_Arkeologjik_i_Apollonis%C3%AB_04.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/39/Parku_Arkeologjik_i_Apollonis%C3%AB_04.jpg/440px-Parku_Arkeologjik_i_Apollonis%C3%AB_04.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4016" data-file-height="2745" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Parku_Arkeologjik_i_Apollonis%C3%AB_04.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Apollonia_(Illyria)" title="Apollonia (Illyria)">Apollonia</a> was an important <a href="/wiki/Colonies_in_antiquity#Greek_colonies" title="Colonies in antiquity">Greek colony</a> on the <a href="/wiki/Illyria" title="Illyria">Illyrian</a> coast along the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> and one of the western points of the <a href="/wiki/Via_Egnatia" title="Via Egnatia">Via Egnatia</a> route, that connected <a href="/wiki/Rome" title="Rome">Rome</a> and <a href="/wiki/Constantinople" title="Constantinople">Constantinople</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The first traces of human presence in Albania, dating to the <a href="/wiki/Middle_Paleolithic" title="Middle Paleolithic">Middle Paleolithic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Upper_Paleolithic" title="Upper Paleolithic">Upper Paleolithic</a> eras, were found in the village of Xarrë close to <a href="/wiki/Sarand%C3%AB" title="Sarandë">Sarandë</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dajti" title="Dajti">Dajti</a> near <a href="/wiki/Tiran%C3%AB" class="mw-redirect" title="Tiranë">Tiranë</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Prendi_25-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Prendi-25">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup> The objects found in a cave near Xarrë include flint and jasper objects and fossilized animal bones, while those found at Mount Dajt comprise bone and stone tools similar to those of the <a href="/wiki/Aurignacian_culture" class="mw-redirect" title="Aurignacian culture">Aurignacian culture</a>. The Paleolithic finds of Albania show great similarities with objects of the same era found at Crvena Stijena in Montenegro and north-western Greece.<sup id="cite_ref-Prendi_25-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Prendi-25">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Several <a href="/wiki/Bronze_Age" title="Bronze Age">Bronze Age</a> artefacts from <a href="/wiki/Tumulus" title="Tumulus">tumulus</a> burials have been unearthed in central and southern Albania that show close connection with sites in south-western <a href="/wiki/Macedonia_(region)" title="Macedonia (region)">Macedonia</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lefkada" title="Lefkada">Lefkada</a>, Greece. Archaeologists have come to the conclusion that these regions were inhabited from the middle of the third millennium BC by <a href="/wiki/Indo-European_migrations" title="Indo-European migrations">Indo-European</a> people who spoke a <a href="/wiki/Proto-Greek_language" title="Proto-Greek language">Proto-Greek language</a>. A part of this population later moved to <a href="/wiki/Mycenae" title="Mycenae">Mycenae</a> around 1600 BC and founded the <a href="/wiki/Mycenaean_Greece" title="Mycenaean Greece">Mycenaean civilisation</a> there.<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">&#91;26&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Hammond1993_28-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hammond1993-28">&#91;27&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In ancient times, the territory of modern Albania was mainly inhabited by a number of <a href="/wiki/Illyrians" title="Illyrians">Illyrian</a> tribes. There is no evidence that Illyrian tribes ever used any collective nomenclature for themselves and it is considered to be "unlikely" that they had a common endonym.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29">&#91;28&#93;</a></sup> The name Illyrians seems to be the name applied to a specific Illyrian tribe, which was the first to come in contact with the ancient Greeks during the Bronze Age, causing the name Illyrians to be applied <i><a href="/wiki/Pars_pro_toto" title="Pars pro toto">pars pro toto</a></i> to all people of similar language and customs.<sup id="cite_ref-Boardman629_30-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Boardman629-30">&#91;29&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-31">&#91;30&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Butrint_-_Ancient_amphitheatre_(by_Pudelek).JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Butrint_-_Ancient_amphitheatre_%28by_Pudelek%29.JPG/220px-Butrint_-_Ancient_amphitheatre_%28by_Pudelek%29.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="106" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Butrint_-_Ancient_amphitheatre_%28by_Pudelek%29.JPG/330px-Butrint_-_Ancient_amphitheatre_%28by_Pudelek%29.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Butrint_-_Ancient_amphitheatre_%28by_Pudelek%29.JPG/440px-Butrint_-_Ancient_amphitheatre_%28by_Pudelek%29.JPG 2x" data-file-width="4224" data-file-height="2042" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Butrint_-_Ancient_amphitheatre_(by_Pudelek).JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The remains of the ancient amphitheatre in <a href="/wiki/Butrint" title="Butrint">Butrint</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The territory known as <a href="/wiki/Illyria" title="Illyria">Illyria</a> corresponded roughly to the area east of the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic sea</a>, extending in the south to the mouth of the <a href="/wiki/Vjos%C3%AB" class="mw-redirect" title="Vjosë">Vjosë</a> river.<sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32">&#91;31&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33">&#91;32&#93;</a></sup> The first account of the Illyrian groups comes from <i><a href="/wiki/Periplus_of_the_Euxine_Sea" title="Periplus of the Euxine Sea">Periplus of the Euxine Sea</a></i>, an ancient Greek text written in the middle of the 4th century BC.<sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup> The south was inhabited by the Greek tribe of the <a href="/wiki/Chaonians" title="Chaonians">Chaonians</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-35">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup> whose capital was at <a href="/wiki/Phoenice" title="Phoenice">Phoenice</a>, while numerous colonies, such as <a href="/wiki/Apollonia_(Illyria)" title="Apollonia (Illyria)">Apollonia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Epidamnos" title="Epidamnos">Epidamnos</a> and <a href="/wiki/Amantia" title="Amantia">Amantia</a>, were established by Greek city-states on the coast by the 7th century BC.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup> The west was inhabited by the Thracian tribe of the <a href="/wiki/Bryges" title="Bryges">Bryges</a>.
</p><p>The Illyrian tribe of the <a href="/wiki/Ardiaei" title="Ardiaei">Ardiaei</a> centered in Montenegro ruled over much of nowadays Albania. The <a href="/wiki/Ardiaean_Kingdom" class="mw-redirect" title="Ardiaean Kingdom">Ardiaean Kingdom</a> reached its greatest extent under  <a href="/wiki/Agron_of_Illyria" class="mw-redirect" title="Agron of Illyria">Agron</a>, son of <a href="/wiki/Pleuratus_II" title="Pleuratus II">Pleuratus II</a>. Agron extended his rule over other neighboring tribes as well.<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37">&#91;36&#93;</a></sup> After Agron's death in 230 BC, his wife <a href="/wiki/Teuta" title="Teuta">Teuta</a> inherited the&#160;Ardiaean kingdom. Teuta's forces extended their operations further southward into the&#160;<a href="/wiki/Ionian_Sea" title="Ionian Sea">Ionian Sea</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-38">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup> In 229 BC, Rome declared war<sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39">&#91;38&#93;</a></sup> on the kingdom for extensively plundering Roman ships. The war ended in Illyrian defeat in 227&#160;BC. Teuta was eventually succeeded by&#160;<a href="/wiki/Gentius" title="Gentius">Gentius</a>&#160;in 181&#160;BC.<sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-40">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup> Gentius clashed with the Romans in 168&#160;BC, initiating the <a href="/wiki/Third_Illyrian_War" class="mw-redirect" title="Third Illyrian War">Third Illyrian War</a>. The conflict resulted in Roman conquest of the region by 167&#160;BC. After that the Roman split the region into three administrative divisions.<sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-41">&#91;40&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Middle_Ages">Middle Ages</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Albania_in_the_Middle_Ages" title="Albania in the Middle Ages">Albania in the Middle Ages</a></div> 
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Arb%C3%ABresh%C3%AB_people" title="Arbëreshë people">Arbëreshë people</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Kruj%C3%AB-KrujaAlbania_2016.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/43/Kruj%C3%AB-KrujaAlbania_2016.jpg/220px-Kruj%C3%AB-KrujaAlbania_2016.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/43/Kruj%C3%AB-KrujaAlbania_2016.jpg/330px-Kruj%C3%AB-KrujaAlbania_2016.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/43/Kruj%C3%AB-KrujaAlbania_2016.jpg/440px-Kruj%C3%AB-KrujaAlbania_2016.jpg 2x" data-file-width="6000" data-file-height="4000" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Kruj%C3%AB-KrujaAlbania_2016.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The city of <a href="/wiki/Kruj%C3%AB" title="Krujë">Krujë</a> was the capital of the <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Arbanon" title="Principality of Arbanon">Principality of Arbanon</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>After the Roman Empire was divided into East and West in the 4th century, the territory of Albania remained within the <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Roman_Empire" class="mw-redirect" title="Eastern Roman Empire">Eastern Roman Empire</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-BideleuxJeffries2007_42-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BideleuxJeffries2007-42">&#91;41&#93;</a></sup> In the centuries that followed, the Balkan Peninsula suffered from the <a href="/wiki/Barbarian_invasions" class="mw-redirect" title="Barbarian invasions">Barbarian invasions</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Illyrians" title="Illyrians">Illyrians</a> are mentioned for the last time in a text from the 7th century.<sup id="cite_ref-Schaefer2008_43-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Schaefer2008-43">&#91;42&#93;</a></sup> 
Towards the end of the 12th and beginning of the 13th centuries, <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Serbia_(medieval)" title="Kingdom of Serbia (medieval)">Serbs</a> and <a href="/wiki/Venetian_Empire" class="mw-redirect" title="Venetian Empire">Venetians</a> started to take possession over the territory.<sup id="cite_ref-Barbarian_Invasions_44-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Barbarian_Invasions-44">&#91;43&#93;</a></sup> 
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Ethnogenesis" title="Ethnogenesis">ethnogenesis</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> is uncertain however the first undisputed mention of Albanians dates back in historical records from 1079 or 1080 in a work by <a href="/wiki/Michael_Attaliates" class="mw-redirect" title="Michael Attaliates">Michael Attaliates</a>, who referred to the <a href="/wiki/Albanoi" title="Albanoi">Albanoi</a> as having taken part in a revolt against <a href="/wiki/Constantinople" title="Constantinople">Constantinople</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-45" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-45">&#91;44&#93;</a></sup> At this point the Albanians were fully <a href="/wiki/Christianized" class="mw-redirect" title="Christianized">christianized</a>.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Venezia_-_Ex_Scola_degli_albanesi_(sec._XV)_-_Foto_Giovanni_Dall%27Orto,_12-Aug-2007_-_11_-_Maometto_II_assedia_Scutari.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d1/Venezia_-_Ex_Scola_degli_albanesi_%28sec._XV%29_-_Foto_Giovanni_Dall%27Orto%2C_12-Aug-2007_-_11_-_Maometto_II_assedia_Scutari.jpg/220px-Venezia_-_Ex_Scola_degli_albanesi_%28sec._XV%29_-_Foto_Giovanni_Dall%27Orto%2C_12-Aug-2007_-_11_-_Maometto_II_assedia_Scutari.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d1/Venezia_-_Ex_Scola_degli_albanesi_%28sec._XV%29_-_Foto_Giovanni_Dall%27Orto%2C_12-Aug-2007_-_11_-_Maometto_II_assedia_Scutari.jpg/330px-Venezia_-_Ex_Scola_degli_albanesi_%28sec._XV%29_-_Foto_Giovanni_Dall%27Orto%2C_12-Aug-2007_-_11_-_Maometto_II_assedia_Scutari.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d1/Venezia_-_Ex_Scola_degli_albanesi_%28sec._XV%29_-_Foto_Giovanni_Dall%27Orto%2C_12-Aug-2007_-_11_-_Maometto_II_assedia_Scutari.jpg/440px-Venezia_-_Ex_Scola_degli_albanesi_%28sec._XV%29_-_Foto_Giovanni_Dall%27Orto%2C_12-Aug-2007_-_11_-_Maometto_II_assedia_Scutari.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2592" data-file-height="1944" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Venezia_-_Ex_Scola_degli_albanesi_(sec._XV)_-_Foto_Giovanni_Dall%27Orto,_12-Aug-2007_-_11_-_Maometto_II_assedia_Scutari.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>A relief of the <a href="/wiki/Scuola_degli_Albanesi" title="Scuola degli Albanesi">Scuola degli Albanesi</a> commemorating the <a href="/wiki/Siege_of_Shkodra" title="Siege of Shkodra">Siege of Shkodra</a>. It illustrates <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Sultan" class="mw-redirect" title="Ottoman Sultan">Sultan</a> <a href="/wiki/Mehmet_II" class="mw-redirect" title="Mehmet II">Mehmet II</a> laying siege to the Albanian town of Scutari then part of <a href="/wiki/Venetian_Empire" class="mw-redirect" title="Venetian Empire">Venetian Empire</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The first <a href="/wiki/Semi-autonomous" class="mw-redirect" title="Semi-autonomous">semi-autonomous</a> Albanian polity was formed in 1190, when <a href="/wiki/Archon" title="Archon">archon</a> <a href="/wiki/Progon_of_Kruja" class="mw-redirect" title="Progon of Kruja">Progon of Kruja</a> established the <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Arbanon" title="Principality of Arbanon">Principality of Arbanon</a> with the capital in <a href="/wiki/Kruj%C3%AB" title="Krujë">Krujë</a> within the Byzantine Empire. Progon, was succeeded by his sons <a href="/wiki/Gjin_Progoni" title="Gjin Progoni">Gjin</a> and Dhimitri, the latter which attained the height of the realm. Following the death of Dhimiter, the last member of the <a href="/wiki/Progon_family" title="Progon family">Progon family</a>, the principality came under the Albanian-Greek <a href="/wiki/Gregory_Kamonas" title="Gregory Kamonas">Gregory Kamonas</a> and later <a href="/wiki/Golem_of_Kruja" title="Golem of Kruja">Golem of Kruja</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46">&#91;45&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Abulafia_47-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Abulafia-47">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Genealogist_48-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Genealogist-48">&#91;47&#93;</a></sup> In the 13th century, the principality was dissolved.<sup id="cite_ref-Clements31_49-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clements31-49">&#91;48&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-PickardÇeliku2008_50-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PickardÇeliku2008-50">&#91;49&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Norris1993_51-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Norris1993-51">&#91;50&#93;</a></sup> Arbanon is considered to be the first sketch of an Albanian state, that retained a <a href="/wiki/Semi-autonomous" class="mw-redirect" title="Semi-autonomous">semi-autonomous</a> status as the western extremity of the Byzantine Empire, under the Byzantine <a href="/wiki/Doukas" title="Doukas">Doukai</a> of <a href="/wiki/Despotate_of_Epirus" title="Despotate of Epirus">Epirus</a> or <a href="/wiki/Laskaris" title="Laskaris">Laskarids</a> of <a href="/wiki/Empire_of_Nicaea" title="Empire of Nicaea">Nicaea</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-52">&#91;51&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Few years after the dissolution of Arbanon, <a href="/wiki/Charles_I_of_Naples" class="mw-redirect" title="Charles I of Naples">Charles of Anjou</a> concluded an agreement with the Albanian rulers, promising to protect them and their ancient liberties. In 1272, he established the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Albania_(medieval)" title="Kingdom of Albania (medieval)">Kingdom of Albania</a> and conquered regions back from the <a href="/wiki/Despotate_of_Epirus" title="Despotate of Epirus">Despotate of Epirus</a>. The kingdom claimed all of central Albania territory from <a href="/wiki/Dyrrhachium" class="mw-redirect" title="Dyrrhachium">Dyrrhachium</a> along the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> coast down to <a href="/wiki/Butrint" title="Butrint">Butrint</a>. A catholic political structure was a basis for the papal plans of spreading <a href="/wiki/Catholicism" class="mw-redirect" title="Catholicism">Catholicism</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Balkan_Peninsula" class="mw-redirect" title="Balkan Peninsula">Balkan Peninsula</a>. This plan found also the support of <a href="/wiki/Helen_of_Anjou" title="Helen of Anjou">Helen of Anjou</a>, a cousin of <a href="/wiki/Charles_I_of_Naples" class="mw-redirect" title="Charles I of Naples">Charles of Anjou</a>, who was at that time ruling territories in North Albania. Around 30 Catholic churches and monasteries were built during her rule mainly in Northern Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-53">&#91;52&#93;</a></sup> Internal power struggles within the Byzantine Empire in the fourteenth century, enabled Serbs' most powerful medieval ruler, <a href="/wiki/Stefan_Dusan" class="mw-redirect" title="Stefan Dusan">Stefan Dusan</a>, to establish a short-lived <a href="/wiki/Serbian_Empire" title="Serbian Empire">empire</a> that included all of Albania except Durrës.<sup id="cite_ref-Barbarian_Invasions_44-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Barbarian_Invasions-44">&#91;43&#93;</a></sup> In 1367, various Albanian rulers established the <a href="/wiki/Despotate_of_Arta" title="Despotate of Arta">Despotate of Arta</a>. During that time, several <a href="/wiki/Albanian_principalities" title="Albanian principalities">Albanian principalities</a> were created, most notable amongst them the <a href="/wiki/Balsha" class="mw-redirect" title="Balsha">Balsha</a>, <a href="/wiki/Thopia_family" title="Thopia family">Thopia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kastrioti_Principality" class="mw-redirect" title="Kastrioti Principality">Kastrioti</a>, <a href="/wiki/Muzaka_family" title="Muzaka family">Muzaka</a> and <a href="/wiki/Arianiti_family" title="Arianiti family">Arianiti</a>. In the first half of the 14th century, the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> invaded most of Albania and the <a href="/wiki/League_of_Lezh%C3%AB" title="League of Lezhë">League of Lezhë</a> was held under <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg" title="Skanderbeg">Skanderbeg</a> as a ruler, who became the national hero of the Albanian medieval history.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Albania_under_the_Ottoman_Empire">Albania under the Ottoman Empire</span></h4>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Ottoman Albania">Ottoman Albania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/League_of_Lezh%C3%AB" title="League of Lezhë">League of Lezhë</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Islamization_of_Albania" title="Islamization of Albania">Islamization of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Gjergj_Kastrioti.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Gjergj_Kastrioti.jpg/170px-Gjergj_Kastrioti.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="208" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Gjergj_Kastrioti.jpg/255px-Gjergj_Kastrioti.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/df/Gjergj_Kastrioti.jpg 2x" data-file-width="285" data-file-height="349" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Gjergj_Kastrioti.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>After serving the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> for nearly 20 years, <a href="/wiki/Gjergj_Kastrioti_Skanderbeg" class="mw-redirect" title="Gjergj Kastrioti Skanderbeg">Gjergj Kastrioti Skanderbeg</a> deserted and began a <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg%27s_rebellion" title="Skanderbeg&#39;s rebellion">rebellion against the empire</a> that halted Ottoman advance into Europe for 25 years.</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman invasion</a> of the territory of Albania marked a new era in its history and introduced enormous changes in the political and cultural environment of the area. The <a href="/wiki/Ottomans" class="mw-redirect" title="Ottomans">Ottomans</a> erected their garrisons across the south of Albania in 1415 and occupied the majority in 1431 although they reached Albanian coast for first time at 1385.<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-54">&#91;53&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Hupchich110_55-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hupchich110-55">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup> Upon their arrival, <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_Albania" title="Islam in Albania">Islam</a> was introduced in the country as a second religion resulting a massive <a href="/wiki/Albanian_diaspora" title="Albanian diaspora">emigration</a> of Christian Albanians to other Christian European countries such as the <a href="/wiki/Arb%C3%ABresh%C3%AB_people" title="Arbëreshë people">Arbëreshë</a> to Italy while Muslim Albanians gradually settled to <a href="/wiki/Turkey" title="Turkey">Turkey</a> and other part of the Ottoman Empire such as <a href="/wiki/Algeria" title="Algeria">Algeria</a>, <a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">Egypt</a> and <a href="/wiki/Iraq" title="Iraq">Iraq</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-56">&#91;55&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-57" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-57">&#91;56&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In 1443, a great and longstanding <a href="/wiki/History_of_the_Albanian-Turkish_Wars" class="mw-redirect" title="History of the Albanian-Turkish Wars">revolt</a> broke out under the lead of <a href="/wiki/Gjergj_Kastrioti_Skanderbeg" class="mw-redirect" title="Gjergj Kastrioti Skanderbeg">Gjergj Kastrioti Skanderbeg</a> that lasted until 1479, many times defeating major Ottoman armies led by <a href="/wiki/Murad_II" title="Murad II">Murad II</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mehmed_II" class="mw-redirect" title="Mehmed II">Mehmed II</a>. Skanderbeg united initially the princes of Albania and later on established a centralized authority over most of the non-conquered territories becoming the ruling <i>Lord of Albania</i>.
</p><p>Skanderbeg pursued relentlessly but rather unsuccessfully to create a European coalition against the Ottomans. He thwarted every attempt by the Ottomans to regain Albania which they envisioned as a springboard for the invasion of <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a> and Western <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a>. His unequal fight against the mightiest power of the time, won the esteem of Europe as well as some financial and military aid from <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Naples" title="Kingdom of Naples">Naples</a>, <a href="/wiki/Republic_of_Venice" title="Republic of Venice">Venice</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ragusa,_Sicily" title="Ragusa, Sicily">Sicily</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Papacy" class="mw-redirect" title="Papacy">Papacy</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-58" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-58">&#91;57&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>When the Ottomans were gaining a firm foothold in the region, Albanian towns were organised into four principal <a href="/wiki/Sanjaks" class="mw-redirect" title="Sanjaks">sanjaks</a>. The government fostered trade by settling a sizeable Jewish colony of refugees fleeing persecution in <a href="/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a>. The city of <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB" title="Vlorë">Vlorë</a> saw passing through its ports imported merchandise from Europe such as velvets, cotton goods, mohairs, carpets, spices and leather from <a href="/wiki/Bursa" title="Bursa">Bursa</a> and <a href="/wiki/Constantinople" title="Constantinople">Constantinople</a>. Some citizens of Vlorë even had business associates throughout <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Arnawutlu_59-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Arnawutlu-59">&#91;58&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>As Muslims, some Albanians attained important political and military positions within the empire and culturally contributed to the wider <a href="/wiki/Muslim_world" title="Muslim world">Muslim world</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-referenceworks.brillonline_60-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-referenceworks.brillonline-60">&#91;59&#93;</a></sup>
Enjoying this privileged position, Muslim Albanians held various high administrative positions with over two dozen Albanian <a href="/wiki/Grand_Viziers" class="mw-redirect" title="Grand Viziers">Grand Viziers</a> among others <a href="/wiki/K%C3%B6pr%C3%BCl%C3%BC_Mehmed_Pasha" title="Köprülü Mehmed Pasha">Köprülü Mehmed Pasha</a>, <a href="/wiki/K%C3%B6pr%C3%BCl%C3%BC_Faz%C4%B1l_Ahmed" class="mw-redirect" title="Köprülü Fazıl Ahmed">Köprülü Fazıl Ahmed</a> and <a href="/wiki/Muhammad_Ali_Pasha" class="mw-redirect" title="Muhammad Ali Pasha">Muhammad Ali Pasha</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Arnawutlu_59-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Arnawutlu-59">&#91;58&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The most significant impact on the <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> was the gradual Islamisation process of a large majority of the population, although it became widespread only in the 17th century.<sup id="cite_ref-referenceworks.brillonline_60-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-referenceworks.brillonline-60">&#91;59&#93;</a></sup> The process was an incremental one, commencing from the arrival of the Ottomans. 
<a href="/wiki/Timar" title="Timar">Timar</a> holders, the bedrock of early Ottoman control in Southeast Europe, were not necessarily converts to Islam, and occasionally rebelled, with the most famous of these being <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg" title="Skanderbeg">Skanderbeg</a>.
</p><p>Mainly <a href="/wiki/Catholic_Church" title="Catholic Church">Catholic</a> Albanians converted in the 17th century, while the <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox_Church" title="Eastern Orthodox Church">Orthodox</a> Albanians followed suit mainly in the following century. Initially confined to the main city centres of <a href="/wiki/Elbasan" title="Elbasan">Elbasan</a> and <a href="/wiki/Shkod%C3%ABr" title="Shkodër">Shkodër</a>, by this period the countryside was also embracing the new religion. The motives for conversion according to some scholars were diverse, depending on the context. The lack of source material does not help when investigating such issues.<sup id="cite_ref-referenceworks.brillonline_60-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-referenceworks.brillonline-60">&#91;59&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Rilindja">Rilindja</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Renaissance" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Renaissance">Albanian Renaissance</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/League_of_Prizren" title="League of Prizren">League of Prizren</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg/170px-NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="239" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg/255px-NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg/340px-NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="689" data-file-height="967" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Naum_Veqilharxhi" title="Naum Veqilharxhi">Naum Veqilharxhi</a> was among the most important figures of the early <a href="/wiki/Albanian_National_Awakening" title="Albanian National Awakening">National Renaissance</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The origins of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Renaissance" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Renaissance">Albanian Renaissance</a> can be traced back to around the 19th century that was a very difficult period for Albania. During the period, the modern culture of Albania flourished especially in <a href="/wiki/Literature" title="Literature">literature</a> and <a href="/wiki/Art" title="Art">art</a> as well inspired by <a href="/wiki/Romanticism" title="Romanticism">romanticism</a> and <a href="/wiki/Age_of_Enlightenment" title="Age of Enlightenment">enlightenment</a>.
</p><p>The victory of <a href="/wiki/Russia" title="Russia">Russia</a> over the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> following the <a href="/wiki/Russian-Ottoman_War" class="mw-redirect" title="Russian-Ottoman War">Russian-Ottoman War</a> resulted the execution of the <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_San_Stefano" title="Treaty of San Stefano">Treaty of San Stefano</a> that overlooked to assign Albanian-populated regions to the Slavic neighbors. The <a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom_of_Great_Britain_and_Ireland" title="United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland">United Kingdom</a> as well as <a href="/wiki/Austria-Hungary" title="Austria-Hungary">Austria-Hungary</a> consequently, blocked the arrangement and caused the <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_Berlin_(1878)" title="Treaty of Berlin (1878)">Treaty of Berlin</a>. At this point, Albanians started to organize themselves with the aim to protect and unite the Albanian-populated regions into a unitary nation. This led to the formation of the <a href="/wiki/League_of_Prizren" title="League of Prizren">League of Prizren</a> in the old town of <a href="/wiki/Prizren" title="Prizren">Prizren</a>.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Dora_d%27Istria.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/12/Dora_d%27Istria.jpg/170px-Dora_d%27Istria.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="264" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/12/Dora_d%27Istria.jpg/255px-Dora_d%27Istria.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/12/Dora_d%27Istria.jpg/340px-Dora_d%27Istria.jpg 2x" data-file-width="855" data-file-height="1328" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Dora_d%27Istria.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Albanians_of_Romania" title="Albanians of Romania">Albanian-Romanian</a> feminist, <a href="/wiki/Dora_d%27Istria" title="Dora d&#39;Istria">Dora d'Istria</a>, was the main advocate in <a href="/wiki/Western_Europe" title="Western Europe">Europe</a> for the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Renaissance" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Renaissance">Albanian cause</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-61">&#91;60&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>At first the Ottoman authorities supported the League, whose initial position was based on the religious solidarity of Muslim <a href="/wiki/Landlords" class="mw-redirect" title="Landlords">landlords</a> and people connected with the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Porte" class="mw-redirect" title="Ottoman Porte">Ottoman administration</a>. The Ottomans favoured and protected the Muslim solidarity and called for defense of Muslim lands, including present-day <a href="/wiki/Bosnia_and_Herzegovina" title="Bosnia and Herzegovina">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>. This was the reason for naming the league <i>The Committee of the Real Muslims</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-62">&#91;61&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The league issued a decree known as <a href="/wiki/Kararname_(League_of_Prizren)" title="Kararname (League of Prizren)">Kararname</a> that contained a proclamation that the people from northern Albania, Epirus and Bosnia are willing to defend the territorial integrity of the Ottoman Empire by all possible means against the troops of the kingdoms of <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Bulgaria" title="Kingdom of Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Serbia" title="Kingdom of Serbia">Serbia</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Montenegro" title="Kingdom of Montenegro">Montenegro</a>. However, it was signed by 47 Muslim deputies of the league on 18 June 1878.<sup id="cite_ref-albanianhistory.net_63-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-albanianhistory.net-63">&#91;62&#93;</a></sup> Approximately 300 Muslims participated in the assembly, including delegates from Bosnia and <a href="/wiki/Sanjakbey" class="mw-redirect" title="Sanjakbey">mutasarrif</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Sanjak_of_Prizren" title="Sanjak of Prizren">Sanjak of Prizren</a> as representatives of the central authorities and no delegates from <a href="/wiki/Vilayet_of_Scutari" class="mw-redirect" title="Vilayet of Scutari">Vilayet of Scutari</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-64">&#91;63&#93;</a></sup>
<sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style#Punctuation" title="Wikipedia:Manual of Style"><span title="Quotation marks may be incomplete, unbalanced or improperly applied.">check quotation syntax</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> 
The Ottomans cancelled their support when the league, under the influence of <a href="/wiki/Abdyl_Frash%C3%ABri" title="Abdyl Frashëri">Abdyl Bey Frashëri</a>, became focused on working toward the Albanian autonomy and requested merging of four <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_vilayet" class="mw-redirect" title="Ottoman vilayet">Ottoman vilayets</a>, which included <a href="/wiki/Kosovo_Vilayet" title="Kosovo Vilayet">Kosovo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scutari_Vilayet" title="Scutari Vilayet">Scutari</a>, <a href="/wiki/Monastir_Vilayet" class="mw-redirect" title="Monastir Vilayet">Monastir</a> and <a href="/wiki/Janina_Vilayet" title="Janina Vilayet">Ioannina</a> into a new <a href="/wiki/Vilayet" title="Vilayet">vilayet</a> within the empire, the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Vilayet" title="Albanian Vilayet">Albanian Vilayet</a>. The league used military force to prevent the annexing areas of <a href="/wiki/Plav_Municipality" title="Plav Municipality">Plav</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gusinje" title="Gusinje">Gusinje</a> assigned to Montenegro by the <a href="/wiki/Congress_of_Berlin" title="Congress of Berlin">Congress of Berlin</a>. After several successful battles with Montenegrin troops such as in <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Nov%C5%A1i%C4%87e" title="Battle of Novšiće">Novsice</a>, under the pressure of the <a href="/wiki/Great_powers" class="mw-redirect" title="Great powers">great powers</a>, the league was forced to retreat from their contested regions of Plav and Gusinje and later on, the league was defeated by the Ottoman army sent by the Sultan.<sup id="cite_ref-League_of_Prizren_65-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-League_of_Prizren-65">&#91;64&#93;</a></sup> 
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Independence">Independence</span></h4>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Declaration_of_Independence" title="Albanian Declaration of Independence">Albanian Declaration of Independence</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Independent_Albania" title="Independent Albania">Independent Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_Albanian_Provisional_Government_(1912-1914).svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a2/Flag_of_Albanian_Provisional_Government_%281912-1914%29.svg/220px-Flag_of_Albanian_Provisional_Government_%281912-1914%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="142" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a2/Flag_of_Albanian_Provisional_Government_%281912-1914%29.svg/330px-Flag_of_Albanian_Provisional_Government_%281912-1914%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a2/Flag_of_Albanian_Provisional_Government_%281912-1914%29.svg/440px-Flag_of_Albanian_Provisional_Government_%281912-1914%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="516" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_Albanian_Provisional_Government_(1912-1914).svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The official flag of <a href="/wiki/Independent_Albania" title="Independent Albania">Independent Albania</a> from 1912 to 1914.</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Declaration_of_Independence" title="Albanian Declaration of Independence">independence of Albania</a> from the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> was proclaimed on 28 November 1912 by <a href="/wiki/Ismail_Qemali" title="Ismail Qemali">Ismail Qemali</a> in <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB" title="Vlorë">Vlorë</a>. Immediately after, the leaders of the <a href="/wiki/Assembly_of_Vlor%C3%AB" title="Assembly of Vlorë">Assembly of Vlorë</a> established the <a href="/wiki/Senate_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Senate of Albania">senate</a> as well as the first <a href="/wiki/Provisional_Government_of_Albania" title="Provisional Government of Albania">government</a> of the country on 4 December 1912 that consisted of only ten members.<sup id="cite_ref-66" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-66">&#91;65&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-67" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-67">&#91;66&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-68">&#91;67&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-69">&#91;68&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The country's independence was recognized by the <a href="/wiki/London_Conference_of_1912%E2%80%931913" class="mw-redirect" title="London Conference of 1912–1913">Conference of London</a> on 29 July 1913.<sup id="cite_ref-70" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-70">&#91;69&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_London_(1913)" title="Treaty of London (1913)">treaty</a> delineated the borders of the country and its neighbors leaving many ethnic <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> outside Albania. This population was largely divided between <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Montenegro" title="Albanians in Montenegro">Montenegro</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Serbia" title="Albanians in Serbia">Serbia</a> in the north and east and <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Greece" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanians in Greece">Greece</a> in the south.
</p><p>Headquartered in Vlorë, the <a href="/wiki/International_Commission_of_Control" class="mw-redirect" title="International Commission of Control">International Commission of Control</a> was established on 15 October 1913 to take care of the administration of newly established Albania, until its own political institutions were in order.<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-71">&#91;70&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-72">&#91;71&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/International_Gendarmerie" title="International Gendarmerie">International Gendarmerie</a> was established as the first <a href="/wiki/Law_enforcement_agency" title="Law enforcement agency">law enforcement agency</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Albania" title="Principality of Albania">Principality of Albania</a>. In November, the first gendarmerie members arrived in the country. Prince of Albania <a href="/wiki/Wilhelm_of_Wied" class="mw-redirect" title="Wilhelm of Wied">Wilhelm of Wied</a> <i>(Princ Vilhelm Vidi)</i> was selected as the first prince of the principality.<sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-73">&#91;72&#93;</a></sup> On 7 March, he arrived in the provisional capital of <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a> and started to organise his government, appointing <a href="/wiki/Turhan_Pasha_P%C3%ABrmeti" title="Turhan Pasha Përmeti">Turhan Pasha Përmeti</a> to form the first Albanian cabinet.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_Koritsa.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Flag_of_Koritsa.svg/220px-Flag_of_Koritsa.svg.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="157" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Flag_of_Koritsa.svg/330px-Flag_of_Koritsa.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Flag_of_Koritsa.svg/440px-Flag_of_Koritsa.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="700" data-file-height="500" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_Koritsa.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The official flag of the autonomous Albanian <a href="/wiki/Autonomous_Albanian_Republic_of_Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="Autonomous Albanian Republic of Korçë">Republic of Korçë</a> that was supported by <a href="/wiki/French_people" title="French people">French</a> forces.</div></div></div>
<p>In November 1913, the Albanian pro-Ottoman forces had offered the throne of Albania to the Ottoman war Minister of Albanian origin, <a href="/wiki/Ahmed_Izzet_Pasha" title="Ahmed Izzet Pasha">Ahmed Izzet Pasha</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-74" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-74">&#91;73&#93;</a></sup> The pro-Ottoman peasants believed that, the new regime of the <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Albania" title="Principality of Albania">Principality of Albania</a> was a tool of the six Christian <a href="/wiki/Great_Power" class="mw-redirect" title="Great Power">Great Powers</a> and local landowners, that owned half of the arable land.<sup id="cite_ref-75" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-75">&#91;74&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In February 1914, the <a href="/wiki/Autonomous_Republic_of_Northern_Epirus" title="Autonomous Republic of Northern Epirus">Autonomous Republic of Northern Epirus</a> was proclaimed in <a href="/wiki/Gjirokast%C3%ABr" title="Gjirokastër">Gjirokastër</a> by the local <a href="/wiki/Greeks_in_Albania" title="Greeks in Albania">Greek population</a> against incorporation to Albania. This initiative was short lived and in 1921, the southern provinces were finally incorporated to the <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Albania" title="Principality of Albania">Albanian Principality</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-76" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-76">&#91;75&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77">&#91;76&#93;</a></sup> Meanwhile, the <a href="/wiki/Peasant_Revolt_in_Albania" title="Peasant Revolt in Albania">revolt of Albanian peasants</a> against the new Albanian regime erupted under the leadership of the group of Muslim clerics gathered around <a href="/wiki/Essad_Pasha_Toptani" title="Essad Pasha Toptani">Essad Pasha Toptani</a>, who proclaimed himself the savior of Albania and Islam.<sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-78">&#91;77&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-79" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-79">&#91;78&#93;</a></sup> In order to gain support of the <a href="/wiki/Mirdita" title="Mirdita">Mirdita</a> Catholic volunteers from the northern part of Albania, Prince <a href="/wiki/Wilhelm_of_Wied" class="mw-redirect" title="Wilhelm of Wied">Wied</a> appointed their leader, <a href="/wiki/Pr%C3%AAnk_Bib%C3%AB_Doda" class="mw-redirect" title="Prênk Bibë Doda">Prênk Bibë Doda</a>, to be the foreign minister of the <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Albania" title="Principality of Albania">Principality of Albania</a>. In May and June 1914, the <a href="/wiki/International_Gendarmerie" title="International Gendarmerie">International Gendarmerie</a> was joined by <a href="/wiki/Isa_Boletini" title="Isa Boletini">Isa Boletini</a> and his men, mostly from <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-80" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-80">&#91;79&#93;</a></sup> and northern <a href="/wiki/Mirdita" title="Mirdita">Mirdita</a> Catholics, were defeated by the rebels who captured most of Central Albania by the end of August 1914.<sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-81">&#91;80&#93;</a></sup> The regime of Prince <a href="/wiki/Wilhelm_of_Wied" class="mw-redirect" title="Wilhelm of Wied">Wied</a> collapsed and later he left the country on 3 September 1914.<sup id="cite_ref-82" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-82">&#91;81&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="First_Republic">First Republic</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Republic" title="Albanian Republic">First Republic of Albania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/World_War_II_in_Albania" title="World War II in Albania">World War II in Albania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/The_Holocaust_in_Albania" title="The Holocaust in Albania">The Holocaust in Albania</a> and <a href="/wiki/List_of_Albanian_Righteous_Among_the_Nations" class="mw-redirect" title="List of Albanian Righteous Among the Nations">Albanian Righteous Among the Nations</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Galeazzo-Ciano.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Galeazzo-Ciano.jpg/220px-Galeazzo-Ciano.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="148" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Galeazzo-Ciano.jpg/330px-Galeazzo-Ciano.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Galeazzo-Ciano.jpg/440px-Galeazzo-Ciano.jpg 2x" data-file-width="620" data-file-height="417" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Galeazzo-Ciano.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Zog_I_of_Albania" title="Zog I of Albania">Zog I of Albania</a> with Italian <a href="/wiki/Italian_Minister_of_Foreign_Affairs" title="Italian Minister of Foreign Affairs">Foreign Minister</a>, <a href="/wiki/Galeazzo_Ciano" title="Galeazzo Ciano">Galeazzo Ciano</a> in 1937.</div></div></div>
<p>Following the end of the government of <a href="/wiki/Fan_Noli" title="Fan Noli">Fan Noli</a>, the parliament adopted a new constitution and proclaimed the country as a parliamentary republic in which <a href="/wiki/Zog_I_of_Albania" title="Zog I of Albania">Zog I of Albania</a> served as the <a href="/wiki/Head_of_state" title="Head of state">head of state</a> for a seven years term. Immediately after, <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> was endorsed officially as the country's permanent capital.<sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-83">&#91;82&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The politics of Zogu was authoritarian and conservative with the primary aim of which was the maintenance of stability and order. He was forced to adopt a policy of cooperation with Italy where a pact had been signed between both countries, whereby Italy gained a monopoly on shipping and trade concessions.<sup id="cite_ref-Vickers_84-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Vickers-84">&#91;83&#93;</a></sup> In 1928, the country was eventually replaced by another <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Albania_(1928%E2%80%931939)" class="mw-redirect" title="Kingdom of Albania (1928–1939)">monarchy</a> with a strong support by the <a href="/wiki/Italian_Fascism" title="Italian Fascism">fascist regime</a> of Italy however, both maintained close relations until the <a href="/wiki/Italian_invasion_of_Albania" title="Italian invasion of Albania">Italian invasion</a> of the country. Zogu remained a conservative  but initiated reforms and placed great emphasis on the development of infrastructure.
</p><p>In an attempt at social modernization, the custom of adding one's region to one's name was dropped. He also made donations of land to international organisations for the building of schools and hospitals. The armed forces were trained and supervised by instructors from Italy, as a counterweight, he kept British officers in the <a href="/wiki/Gendarmerie" title="Gendarmerie">Gendarmerie</a> despite strong Italian pressure to remove them.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Jewish_Families_Kavaj%C3%AB.png" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Jewish_Families_Kavaj%C3%AB.png/220px-Jewish_Families_Kavaj%C3%AB.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Jewish_Families_Kavaj%C3%AB.png/330px-Jewish_Families_Kavaj%C3%AB.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Jewish_Families_Kavaj%C3%AB.png/440px-Jewish_Families_Kavaj%C3%AB.png 2x" data-file-width="1154" data-file-height="769" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Jewish_Families_Kavaj%C3%AB.png" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Portrait of a <a href="/wiki/Jewish" class="mw-redirect" title="Jewish">Jewish</a> family in <a href="/wiki/Kavaj%C3%AB" title="Kavajë">Kavajë</a>. During the <a href="/wiki/Holocaust" class="mw-redirect" title="Holocaust">Holocaust</a>, predominantly Muslim Albanians saved almost 2000 Jews from deportation to the <a href="/wiki/Concentration_camp" class="mw-redirect" title="Concentration camp">concentration camps</a> during <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">World War II</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-85" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-85">&#91;84&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>After being <a href="/wiki/Italian_invasion_of_Albania" title="Italian invasion of Albania">militarily occupied by Italy</a> from 1939 until 1943, the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Kingdom_(1939%E2%80%9343)" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Kingdom (1939–43)">Kingdom of Albania</a> was a <a href="/wiki/Protectorate" title="Protectorate">protectorate</a> and a <a href="/wiki/Dependent_territory" title="Dependent territory">dependency</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Italy" title="Kingdom of Italy">Kingdom of Italy</a> governed by <a href="/wiki/Victor_Emmanuel_III_of_Italy" title="Victor Emmanuel III of Italy">Victor Emmanuel III</a> and his government. In October 1940, Albania served as a staging ground for an unsuccessful Italian <a href="/wiki/Greco-Italian_War" title="Greco-Italian War">invasion of Greece</a>. A counterattack resulted in a sizable portion of southern Albania coming under Greek military control until April 1941 when Greece capitulated during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Greece" title="Battle of Greece">German invasion</a>. In April 1941, territories of Yugoslavia with substantial Albanian population were annexed to Albania inclusively western Macedonia, a strip of eastern Montenegro, the town of <a href="/wiki/Tutin,_Serbia" title="Tutin, Serbia">Tutin</a> in central Serbia and most of Kosovo<span style="font-size:85%;"><sup id="cite_ref-status_7-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-status-7">&#91;a&#93;</a></sup></span>.<sup id="cite_ref-BogdaniLoughlin2007_86-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BogdaniLoughlin2007-86">&#91;85&#93;</a></sup>
