</p><p>Germans started to occupy the country in September 1943 subsequently announced that they would recognize the independence of a neutral Albania and set about organizing a new government, military and law enforcement. <a href="/wiki/Balli_Komb%C3%ABtar" title="Balli Kombëtar">Balli Kombëtar</a>, which had fought against Italy, formed a neutral government and side by side with the Germans fought against the communist-led <a href="/wiki/National_Liberation_Movement_(Albania)" title="National Liberation Movement (Albania)">National Liberation Movement</a> of Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-Morrock2010_87-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Morrock2010-87">&#91;86&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During the last years of the war, the country fell into a civil war-like state between the communists and nationalists. The communist however defeated the last anti-communist forces in the south in 1944. Before the end of November, the main German troops had withdrawn from Tirana, and the communists took control by attacking it. The partisans entirely liberated the country from German occupation on 29 November 1944. A provisional government, which the communists had formed at&#160;Berat&#160;in October, administered Albania with <a href="/wiki/Enver_Hoxha" title="Enver Hoxha">Enver Hoxha</a> as the <a href="/wiki/Head_of_government" title="Head of government">head of government</a>.
</p><p>By the end of the <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">Second World War</a>, the main military and political force of the nation, the Communist party sent forces to northern Albania against the nationalists to eliminate its rivals. They faced open resistance in <a href="/wiki/Nikaj-M%C3%ABrtur" title="Nikaj-Mërtur">Nikaj-Mërtur</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dukagjin_highlands" title="Dukagjin highlands">Dukagjin</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kelmendi_(tribe)" title="Kelmendi (tribe)">Kelmend</a> led by <a href="/wiki/Prek_Cali" title="Prek Cali">Prek Cali</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-88">&#91;87&#93;</a></sup> On 15 January 1945, a clash took place between partisans of the first Brigade and nationalist forces at the Tamara Bridge, resulting in the defeat of the nationalist forces. About 150 <a href="/wiki/Kelmendi_(tribe)" title="Kelmendi (tribe)">Kelmendi</a><sup id="cite_ref-89" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89">&#91;88&#93;</a></sup><sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citing_sources" title="Wikipedia:Citing sources"><span title="This citation requires a reference to the specific page or range of pages in which the material appears. (November 2017)">page&#160;needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> people were killed or tortured. This event was the starting point of many other issues which took place during <a href="/wiki/Enver_Hoxha" title="Enver Hoxha">Enver Hoxha</a>'s dictatorship. <a href="/wiki/Class_conflict" title="Class conflict">Class struggle</a> was strictly applied, human freedom and <a href="/wiki/Human_rights" title="Human rights">human rights</a> were denied.<sup id="cite_ref-Albanian_Nationalism_90-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Albanian_Nationalism-90">&#91;89&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Kelmend_(municipality)" title="Kelmend (municipality)">Kelmend</a> region was almost isolated by both the border and by a lack of roads for another 20 years, the institution of <a href="/wiki/Agricultural_cooperative" title="Agricultural cooperative">agricultural cooperatives</a> brought about economic decline. Many Kelmendi people fled, some were executed trying to cross the border.<sup id="cite_ref-Albanian_Nationalism_90-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Albanian_Nationalism-90">&#91;89&#93;</a></sup> 
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Communism">Communism</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Communism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Communism in Albania">Communism in Albania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Bunkers_in_Albania" title="Bunkers in Albania">Bunkers in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:HOD%C5%BDA_druh%C3%A1_m%C3%ADza_crop.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/HOD%C5%BDA_druh%C3%A1_m%C3%ADza_crop.jpg/170px-HOD%C5%BDA_druh%C3%A1_m%C3%ADza_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="229" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/HOD%C5%BDA_druh%C3%A1_m%C3%ADza_crop.jpg/255px-HOD%C5%BDA_druh%C3%A1_m%C3%ADza_crop.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/fa/HOD%C5%BDA_druh%C3%A1_m%C3%ADza_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="305" data-file-height="410" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:HOD%C5%BDA_druh%C3%A1_m%C3%ADza_crop.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Enver_Hoxha" title="Enver Hoxha">Enver Hoxha</a> served as <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Albania" title="Prime Minister of Albania">Prime Minister</a> and <a href="/wiki/Secretary_(title)#Secretary-General" title="Secretary (title)">First Secretary</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Party_of_Labour_of_Albania" title="Party of Labour of Albania">Party of Labour</a> of Albania.</div></div></div>
<p>In the aftermath of <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">World War II</a> and the defeat of <a href="/wiki/Nazi_Germany" title="Nazi Germany">Nazi Germany</a>, the country became initially a <a href="/wiki/Soviet_satellite" class="mw-redirect" title="Soviet satellite">satellite state</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Soviet_Union" title="Soviet Union">Soviet Union</a> and <a href="/wiki/Enver_Hoxha" title="Enver Hoxha">Enver Hoxha</a> emerged consequently as the leader of the newly established <a href="/wiki/People%27s_Socialist_Republic_of_Albania" title="People&#39;s Socialist Republic of Albania">People's Republic of Albania</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91">&#91;90&#93;</a></sup> Soviet-Albanian relations began to <a href="/wiki/Soviet%E2%80%93Albanian_split" title="Soviet–Albanian split">deteriorate</a> after Stalin's death in 1953. At this point, the country started to develop foreign relations with other communist countries among others with the <a href="/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_China" class="mw-redirect" title="People&#39;s Republic of China">People's Republic of China</a>.
</p><p>During this period, the country experienced an increasing <a href="/wiki/Industrialisation" title="Industrialisation">industrialisation</a> and <a href="/wiki/Urbanization" title="Urbanization">urbanization</a>, a rapid <a href="/wiki/Collectivisation" class="mw-redirect" title="Collectivisation">collectivisation</a> and <a href="/wiki/Economic_growth" title="Economic growth">economic growth</a> which led to a higher standard of living.<sup id="cite_ref-Albanian_Nationalism_90-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Albanian_Nationalism-90">&#91;89&#93;</a></sup> The government called for the development of <a href="/wiki/Infrastructure" title="Infrastructure">infrastructure</a> and most notably the introduction of a <a href="/wiki/Hekurudha_Shqiptare" title="Hekurudha Shqiptare">railway system</a> that completely revamped transportation.
</p><p>The new land reform laws were passed granting ownership of the land to the workers and peasants who tilled it. Agriculture became <a href="/wiki/Worker_cooperative" title="Worker cooperative">cooperative</a> and production increased significantly, leading to the country's becoming agriculturally self-sufficient. In the field of education, illiteracy was eliminated among the country's adult population.<sup id="cite_ref-92" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-92">&#91;91&#93;</a></sup> The government also oversaw the emancipation of women and the expansion of healthcare and education throughout the country.<sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-93">&#91;92&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The average annual increase in the country's national income was 29% and 56% higher than the world and European average, respectively.<sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-94">&#91;93&#93;</a></sup><sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability" title="Wikipedia:Verifiability"><span title="The material near this tag failed verification of its source citation(s). (November 2016)">failed verification</span></a></i>&#93;</sup>. The nation incurred large debts initially with Yugoslavia until 1948, then the Soviet Union until 1961 and China from the middle of the 1950s.<sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95">&#91;94&#93;</a></sup> The constitution of the communist regime did not allow taxes on individuals, instead, taxes were imposed on cooperatives and other organizations, with much the same effect.<sup id="cite_ref-96" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-96">&#91;95&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Bunker_in_Albanian_Alps.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Bunker_in_Albanian_Alps.jpg/220px-Bunker_in_Albanian_Alps.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="176" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Bunker_in_Albanian_Alps.jpg/330px-Bunker_in_Albanian_Alps.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Bunker_in_Albanian_Alps.jpg/440px-Bunker_in_Albanian_Alps.jpg 2x" data-file-width="984" data-file-height="786" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Bunker_in_Albanian_Alps.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>A <a href="/wiki/Bunkers_in_Albania" title="Bunkers in Albania">bunker</a> overlooking the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a>. By 1983, approximately 173,371 concrete bunkers were counted across the country.<sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-97">&#91;96&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>Today a <a href="/wiki/Secular_state" title="Secular state">secular state</a> without any <a href="/wiki/Official_religion" class="mw-redirect" title="Official religion">official religion</a>, <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_religion_in_Albania" title="Freedom of religion in Albania">religious freedoms</a> and practices were severely curtailed during the communist era with all forms of worship being outlawed. In 1945, the Agrarian Reform Law meant that large swaths of property owned by religious groups were nationalized, mostly the <a href="/wiki/Waqfs" class="mw-redirect" title="Waqfs">waqfs</a> along with the estates of <a href="/wiki/Mosque" title="Mosque">mosques</a>, <a href="/wiki/Khanqah" title="Khanqah">tekkes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Monasteries" class="mw-redirect" title="Monasteries">monasteries</a> and <a href="/wiki/Diocese" title="Diocese">dioceses</a>. Many believers, along with the <a href="/wiki/Ulema" class="mw-redirect" title="Ulema">ulema</a> and many <a href="/wiki/Priests" class="mw-redirect" title="Priests">priests</a>, were arrested and executed. In 1949, a new Decree on Religious Communities required that all their activities be sanctioned by the state alone.<sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-98">&#91;97&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>After hundreds of mosques and dozens of Islamic libraries, containing priceless manuscripts were destroyed, Hoxha proclaimed Albania the world's first <a href="/wiki/State_atheism" title="State atheism">atheist state</a> in 1967.<sup id="cite_ref-99" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-99">&#91;98&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Elsie_p27_100-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Elsie_p27-100">&#91;99&#93;</a></sup> The churches had not been spared either, and many were converted into cultural centers for young people. A 1967 law banned all fascist, religious, warmongerish, antisocialist activity and propaganda. Preaching religion carried a three to ten-year prison sentence.
</p><p>Nonetheless, many Albanians continued to practice their beliefs secretly. The anti-religious policy of Hoxha attained its most fundamental legal and political expression a decade later: "The state recognizes no religion", states the 1976 constitution, "and supports and carries out atheistic propaganda in order to implant a scientific materialistic world outlook in people".<sup id="cite_ref-Elsie_p27_100-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Elsie_p27-100">&#91;99&#93;</a></sup> 
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Fourth_Republic">Fourth Republic</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">Fall of communism in Albania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Pyramid_schemes_in_Albania" title="Pyramid schemes in Albania">Pyramid schemes</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_civil_war_of_1997" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian civil war of 1997">civil war of 1997</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Tirana_Square_1988.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Tirana_Square_1988.jpg/220px-Tirana_Square_1988.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="143" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Tirana_Square_1988.jpg/330px-Tirana_Square_1988.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Tirana_Square_1988.jpg/440px-Tirana_Square_1988.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1581" data-file-height="1025" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Tirana_Square_1988.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>In 1988, the first foreigners were allowed to walk into the car-free <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg_Square" title="Skanderbeg Square">Skanderbeg Square</a> in <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>After forty years of <a href="/wiki/Communism" title="Communism">communism</a> and <a href="/wiki/Isolationism" title="Isolationism">isolation</a> as well as the <a href="/wiki/Revolutions_of_1989" title="Revolutions of 1989">revolutions of 1989</a>, people and most notably students started to become politically active and consequently to campaign against the government that led to the transformation of the existing order. Following the popular support in the first <a href="/wiki/Multi-party_elections" class="mw-redirect" title="Multi-party elections">multi-party elections</a> of <a href="/wiki/Albanian_parliamentary_election,_1991" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian parliamentary election, 1991">1991</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-101">&#91;100&#93;</a></sup> the communists retained a stronghold in the <a href="/wiki/Parliament_of_Albania" title="Parliament of Albania">parliament</a> until the victory in the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_parliamentary_election,_1992" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian parliamentary election, 1992">general elections</a> of 1992 led by the <a href="/wiki/Democratic_Party_of_Albania" title="Democratic Party of Albania">Democratic Party</a>.
</p><p>Considerable economic and financial resources have been devoted to the <a href="/wiki/Ponzi_scheme" title="Ponzi scheme">Ponzi</a> <a href="/wiki/Pyramid_schemes_in_Albania" title="Pyramid schemes in Albania">pyramid schemes</a> that were widely supported by the government. The schemes swept up somewhere between one sixth and one third of the population of the country.<sup id="cite_ref-102" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-102">&#91;101&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-103" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-103">&#91;102&#93;</a></sup> Despite the warnings of the <a href="/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund" title="International Monetary Fund">International Monetary Fund</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sali_Berisha" title="Sali Berisha">Sali Berisha</a> defended the schemes as large investment firms, leading more people to redirect their remittances and sell their homes and cattle for cash to deposit in the schemes.<sup id="cite_ref-104" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-104">&#91;103&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The schemes began to collapse in late 1996, leading many of the investors to join initially peaceful protests against the government, requesting their money back. The protests turned violent in February 1997 as government forces responded with fire. In March, the Police and Republican Guard deserted, leaving their armories open. These were promptly emptied by militias and criminal gangs. The <a href="/wiki/1997_rebellion_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="1997 rebellion in Albania">resulting crisis</a> caused a wave of evacuations of foreign nationals and refugees.<sup id="cite_ref-105" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-105">&#91;104&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The crisis led both <a href="/wiki/Aleksand%C3%ABr_Meksi" title="Aleksandër Meksi">Aleksandër Meksi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Sali_Berisha" title="Sali Berisha">Sali Berisha</a> to resign from office in the wake of the general election. In April 1997, <a href="/wiki/Operation_Alba" title="Operation Alba">Operation Alba</a>, a <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">UN</a> peacekeeping force led by <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>, entered the country with two goals exclusively to assist with the evacuation of expatriates and to secure the ground for international organizations. The main international organization, that was involved, was the <a href="/wiki/Western_European_Union" title="Western European Union">Western European Union</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Albanian_civil_war_of_1997#International_intervention" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian civil war of 1997">multinational</a> <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Police" title="Albanian Police">Albanian Police</a> element, which worked with the government to restructure the <a href="/wiki/Judicial_system_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Judicial system of Albania">judicial system</a> and simultaneously the Albanian Police.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Contemporary">Contemporary</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Accession_of_Albania_to_the_European_Union" title="Accession of Albania to the European Union">Accession of Albania to the EU</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albania%E2%80%93NATO_relations" title="Albania–NATO relations">NATO</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Mimi_Kodheli_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Mimi_Kodheli_%28cropped%29.jpg/170px-Mimi_Kodheli_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="244" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Mimi_Kodheli_%28cropped%29.jpg/255px-Mimi_Kodheli_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Mimi_Kodheli_%28cropped%29.jpg/340px-Mimi_Kodheli_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1217" data-file-height="1748" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Mimi_Kodheli_(cropped).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Mimi_Kodheli" title="Mimi Kodheli">Mimi Kodheli</a> was the first woman to serve as the <a href="/wiki/Minister_of_Defence_(Albania)" class="mw-redirect" title="Minister of Defence (Albania)">Defence Minister</a> of Albania.</div></div></div>
<p>When the communist system collapsed in 1990, Albania rediscovered foreign policy after decades of isolationism and began to develop closer ties considerably with other countries of <a href="/wiki/Western_Europe" title="Western Europe">Western Europe</a> and the <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a>. At this point, its top foreign policy ambition was achieving integration into modern economic and security organizations.
</p><p>Previously a member of the <a href="/wiki/Warsaw_Pact" title="Warsaw Pact">Warsaw Pact</a>, the newly established democratic country broadly pursued an integrationist agenda in becoming a member of the NATO.<sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-106">&#91;105&#93;</a></sup> The organisation invited Albania and <a href="/wiki/Croatia" title="Croatia">Croatia</a> to join the alliance at the <a href="/wiki/2008_Bucharest_summit" title="2008 Bucharest summit">2008 Bucharest summit</a>. In April 2014, it became a full member of the organisation and was among the first Southeast European countries to join the partnership for peace programme.
</p><p>Albania <a href="/wiki/Accession_of_Albania_to_the_European_Union" title="Accession of Albania to the European Union">applied</a> to join the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>, becoming an official candidate for accession to the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> in June 2014. Although Albania received candidate status for the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> membership in 2014 (based on its 2009 application), the European Union has twice rejected full membership.<sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-107">&#91;106&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/European_Parliament" title="European Parliament">European Parliament</a> warned the <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Government of Albania">Government leaders</a> in early 2017 that the 2017 <a href="/wiki/Albanian_parliamentary_election,_2017" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian parliamentary election, 2017">parliamentary elections</a> in June must be free and fair before negotiations could begin to admit the country into the union.<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108">&#91;107&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-109" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-109">&#91;108&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 23 June 2013, the eighth <a href="/wiki/Albanian_parliamentary_election,_2013" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian parliamentary election, 2013">parliamentary elections</a> took place, won by <a href="/wiki/Edi_Rama" title="Edi Rama">Edi Rama</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Socialist_Party_of_Albania" title="Socialist Party of Albania">Socialist Party</a>. During his tenure as <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Albania" title="Prime Minister of Albania">Prime Minister</a>, Albania has implemented numerous reforms focused on the <a href="/wiki/Modernism" title="Modernism">modernizing</a> the <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Albania" title="Economy of Albania">economy</a> and democratizing of <a href="/w/index.php?title=State_institution&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="State institution (page does not exist)">state institutions</a> inclusively the <a href="/wiki/Judiciary_of_Albania" title="Judiciary of Albania">judiciary</a> and <a href="/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_Albania" title="Law enforcement in Albania">law enforcement</a> of the country. <a href="/wiki/Unemployment" title="Unemployment">Unemployment</a> has been steadily reduced ranking 4th in terms of lowest <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_unemployment_rate" title="List of countries by unemployment rate">unemployment rate</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Balkans" title="Balkans">Balkans</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110">&#91;109&#93;</a></sup> Rama has placed <a href="/wiki/Gender_equality" title="Gender equality">gender equality</a> at the center of its agenda, since 2017 almost 50% of the ministers are female, making it the largest number of women serving in the country's history.<sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111">&#91;110&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Geography">Geography</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Albania" title="Geography of Albania">Geography of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Valbona_nga_Kukaj.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Valbona_nga_Kukaj.jpg/300px-Valbona_nga_Kukaj.jpg" decoding="async" width="300" height="110" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Valbona_nga_Kukaj.jpg/450px-Valbona_nga_Kukaj.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Valbona_nga_Kukaj.jpg/600px-Valbona_nga_Kukaj.jpg 2x" data-file-width="6460" data-file-height="2377" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Valbona_nga_Kukaj.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a> are an extension of the <a href="/wiki/Dinaric_Alps" title="Dinaric Alps">Dinaric Alps</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Albania is defined in an area of 28,748 square kilometres (11,100 square miles) and located on the <a href="/wiki/Balkan_Peninsula" class="mw-redirect" title="Balkan Peninsula">Balkan Peninsula</a> in <a href="/wiki/Southern_Europe" title="Southern Europe">South</a> and <a href="/wiki/Southeast_Europe" title="Southeast Europe">Southeast Europe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Albania_pdf_112-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Albania_pdf-112">&#91;111&#93;</a></sup> Its coastline faces the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> to the northwest and the <a href="/wiki/Ionian_Sea" title="Ionian Sea">Ionian Sea</a> to the southwest along the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a>.
</p><p>The country of Albania lies mostly between latitudes <a href="/wiki/42nd_parallel_north" title="42nd parallel north">42°</a> and <a href="/wiki/39th_parallel_north" title="39th parallel north">39° N</a>, and longitudes <a href="/wiki/21st_meridian_east" title="21st meridian east">21°</a> and <a href="/wiki/19th_meridian_east" title="19th meridian east">19° E</a>. Its northernmost point is <a href="/wiki/V%C3%ABrmosh" class="mw-redirect" title="Vërmosh">Vërmosh</a> at 42° 35' 34" northern latitude; the southernmost is <a href="/wiki/Konispol" title="Konispol">Konispol</a> at 39° 40' 0" northern latitude; the westernmost point is <a href="/wiki/Sazan_Island" title="Sazan Island">Sazan</a> at 19° 16' 50" eastern longitude; and the easternmost point is <a href="/wiki/V%C3%ABrnik" class="mw-redirect" title="Vërnik">Vërnik</a> at 21° 1' 26" eastern longitude.<sup id="cite_ref-113" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-113">&#91;112&#93;</a></sup> The highest point of Albania is <a href="/wiki/Mount_Korab" class="mw-redirect" title="Mount Korab">Mount Korab</a> at 2,764 metres (9,068.24&#160;ft) <a href="/wiki/Metres_above_the_Adriatic" title="Metres above the Adriatic">above the Adriatic</a>; the lowest point is the Adriatic and Ionian Sea at 0 metres (0.00&#160;ft). The distance from the east to west is only 148 kilometres (92&#160;mi), while from the north to south about 340 kilometres (211&#160;mi).
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Gjipe_beach,_Albania.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/11/Gjipe_beach%2C_Albania.JPG/220px-Gjipe_beach%2C_Albania.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/11/Gjipe_beach%2C_Albania.JPG/330px-Gjipe_beach%2C_Albania.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/11/Gjipe_beach%2C_Albania.JPG/440px-Gjipe_beach%2C_Albania.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2304" data-file-height="1536" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Gjipe_beach,_Albania.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Gjipe_Canyon" class="mw-redirect" title="Gjipe Canyon">Gjipe</a> is located on the confluence of the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ionian_Sea" title="Ionian Sea">Ionian Sea</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>For a small country, much of Albania rises into <a href="/wiki/Mountain" title="Mountain">mountains</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hill" title="Hill">hills</a> that run in different directions across the length and breadth of the country. The most extensive mountain ranges are the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a> in the north, the <a href="/wiki/Korab" title="Korab">Korab Mountains</a> in the east, the <a href="/wiki/Pindus_Mountains" class="mw-redirect" title="Pindus Mountains">Pindus Mountains</a> in the southeast, the <a href="/wiki/Ceraunian_Mountains" title="Ceraunian Mountains">Ceraunian Mountains</a> in the southwest and the <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg_Mountains" title="Skanderbeg Mountains">Skanderbeg Mountains</a> in the center.
</p><p>Among the most remarkable features about the country is the presence of numerous important lakes. The <a href="/wiki/Lake_of_Shkod%C3%ABr" class="mw-redirect" title="Lake of Shkodër">Lake of Shkodër</a> is the largest lake in <a href="/wiki/List_of_largest_lakes_of_Europe" title="List of largest lakes of Europe">Southern Europe</a> and located in northwest.<sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-114">&#91;113&#93;</a></sup> In the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ohrid_Lake_Coast" title="Albanian Ohrid Lake Coast">southeast</a> rises the <a href="/wiki/Lake_of_Ohrid" class="mw-redirect" title="Lake of Ohrid">Lake of Ohrid</a> that is one of the oldest continuously existing lakes in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-115">&#91;114&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-116" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-116">&#91;115&#93;</a></sup> Farther south extends the <a href="/wiki/Prespa_Lake" class="mw-redirect" title="Prespa Lake">Large</a> and <a href="/wiki/Small_Prespa_Lake" title="Small Prespa Lake">Small Lake of Prespa</a>, which are among the highest positioned lakes in the <a href="/wiki/Balkans" title="Balkans">Balkans</a>.
</p><p>Rivers rise mostly in the east of Albania and discharge into the Adriatic Sea but as well as into the Ionian Sea to a lesser extent. The longest river in the country, measured from its mouth to its source, is the <a href="/wiki/Drin_River" title="Drin River">Drin</a> that starts at the confluence of its two headwaters, the <a href="/wiki/Black_Drin" title="Black Drin">Black</a> and <a href="/wiki/White_Drin" title="White Drin">White Drin</a>. Though of particular concern is the <a href="/wiki/Vjos%C3%AB" class="mw-redirect" title="Vjosë">Vjosë</a> which represents one of the last intact large river systems in Europe.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Climate">Climate</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Climate_of_Albania" title="Climate of Albania">Climate of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ksamill-1.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Ksamill-1.jpg/220px-Ksamill-1.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Ksamill-1.jpg/330px-Ksamill-1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Ksamill-1.jpg/440px-Ksamill-1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1113" data-file-height="742" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Ksamill-1.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Ksamil" title="Ksamil">Albanian Riviera</a> in the south has a <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_climate" title="Mediterranean climate">mediterranean climate</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Climate_of_Albania" title="Climate of Albania">climate</a> in the country is extremely variable and diverse owing to the differences in latitude, longitude and altitude.<sup id="cite_ref-climate_117-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-climate-117">&#91;116&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-climate2_118-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-climate2-118">&#91;117&#93;</a></sup> Albania experiences predominantly a <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_climate" title="Mediterranean climate">mediterranean</a> and <a href="/wiki/Continental_climate" title="Continental climate">continental climate</a>, with four distinct <a href="/wiki/Season" title="Season">seasons</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-climate1_119-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-climate1-119">&#91;118&#93;</a></sup> Defined by the <a href="/wiki/K%C3%B6ppen_climate_classification" title="Köppen climate classification">Köppen classification</a>, it accommodates five major climatic types ranging from mediterranean and <a href="/wiki/Humid_subtropical_climate" title="Humid subtropical climate">subtropical</a> in the western half to <a href="/wiki/Oceanic_climate" title="Oceanic climate">oceanic</a>, <a href="/wiki/Humid_continental_climate" title="Humid continental climate">continental</a> and <a href="/wiki/Subarctic_climate" title="Subarctic climate">subarctic</a> in the eastern half of Albania.
</p><p>The warmest areas of the country are immediately placed along the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ionian_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Ionian Sea Coast">Ionian Sea Coasts</a>. On the contrary, the coldest areas are positioned within the <a href="/wiki/Northern_Mountain_Range_(Albania)" title="Northern Mountain Range (Albania)">northern</a> and <a href="/wiki/Central_Mountain_Range_(Albania)" title="Central Mountain Range (Albania)">eastern highlands</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-climate3_120-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-climate3-120">&#91;119&#93;</a></sup> The mean monthly <a href="/wiki/Temperature" title="Temperature">temperature</a> ranges between −1&#160;<a href="/wiki/Celsius" title="Celsius">°C</a> (30&#160;<a href="/wiki/Fahrenheit" title="Fahrenheit">°F</a>) in winter to 21.8&#160;°C (71.2&#160;°F) in summer. The highest temperature of 43.9&#160;°C (111.0&#160;°F) was recorded in <a href="/wiki/Ku%C3%A7ov%C3%AB" title="Kuçovë">Kuçovë</a> on 18 July 1973. The lowest temperature of −29&#160;°C (−20&#160;°F) was registered in the village of Shtyllë, <a href="/wiki/Librazhd" title="Librazhd">Librazhd</a> on 9 January 2017.<sup id="cite_ref-121" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-121">&#91;120&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-122" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-122">&#91;121&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Maja_e_That%C3%AB_(2406_m)_in_the_Albanian_Alps.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/81/Maja_e_That%C3%AB_%282406_m%29_in_the_Albanian_Alps.jpg/220px-Maja_e_That%C3%AB_%282406_m%29_in_the_Albanian_Alps.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="159" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/81/Maja_e_That%C3%AB_%282406_m%29_in_the_Albanian_Alps.jpg/330px-Maja_e_That%C3%AB_%282406_m%29_in_the_Albanian_Alps.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/81/Maja_e_That%C3%AB_%282406_m%29_in_the_Albanian_Alps.jpg/440px-Maja_e_That%C3%AB_%282406_m%29_in_the_Albanian_Alps.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3262" data-file-height="2356" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Maja_e_That%C3%AB_(2406_m)_in_the_Albanian_Alps.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a> in the north enjoy a <a href="/wiki/Subarctic_climate" title="Subarctic climate">subarctic climate</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Rainfall naturally varies from season to season and from year to year. The country receives most of the <a href="/wiki/Precipitation_(meteorology)" class="mw-redirect" title="Precipitation (meteorology)">precipitation</a> in winter months and less in summer months.<sup id="cite_ref-climate2_118-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-climate2-118">&#91;117&#93;</a></sup> The average precipitation is about 1,485 millimetres (58.5 inches).<sup id="cite_ref-climate3_120-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-climate3-120">&#91;119&#93;</a></sup> The mean annual precipitation ranges between 600 millimetres (24 inches) and 3,000 millimetres (120 inches) depending on geographical location.<sup id="cite_ref-climate1_119-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-climate1-119">&#91;118&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Northern_Mountain_Range_(Albania)" title="Northern Mountain Range (Albania)">northwestern</a> and <a href="/wiki/Southern_Mountain_Range_(Albania)" title="Southern Mountain Range (Albania)">southeastern highlands</a> receive the intenser amount of precipitation, whilst the <a href="/wiki/Northern_Mountain_Range_(Albania)" title="Northern Mountain Range (Albania)">northeastern</a> and <a href="/wiki/Southern_Mountain_Range_(Albania)" title="Southern Mountain Range (Albania)">southwestern highlands</a> as well as the <a href="/wiki/Western_Lowlands" title="Western Lowlands">western lowlands</a> the more limited amount.<sup id="cite_ref-climate3_120-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-climate3-120">&#91;119&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a> in the far north of the country are considered to be among the most humid regions of <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a>, receiving at least 3,100&#160;mm (122.0&#160;in) of rain annually.<sup id="cite_ref-climate3_120-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-climate3-120">&#91;119&#93;</a></sup> An expedition from the <a href="/wiki/University_of_Colorado" title="University of Colorado">University of Colorado</a> discovered four <a href="/wiki/Glacier" title="Glacier">glaciers</a> within these mountains at a relatively low altitude of 2,000 metres (6,600&#160;ft), which is almost virtually for such a southerly latitude.<sup id="cite_ref-123" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-123">&#91;122&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Snowfall occurs frequently in winter in the highlands of the country, particularly on the mountains in the north and east, including the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a> and <a href="/wiki/Korab" title="Korab">Korab Mountains</a>. Snow also falls on the coastal areas in the southwest almost every winter such as in the <a href="/wiki/Ceraunian_Mountains" title="Ceraunian Mountains">Ceraunian Mountains</a>, where it can lie even beyond March.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Biodiversity">Biodiversity</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Biodiversity_of_Albania" title="Biodiversity of Albania">Biodiversity of Albania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_ecoregions_in_Albania" title="List of ecoregions in Albania">Ecoregions in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Golden_eagle_(13434882845).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Golden_eagle_%2813434882845%29.jpg/220px-Golden_eagle_%2813434882845%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Golden_eagle_%2813434882845%29.jpg/330px-Golden_eagle_%2813434882845%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Golden_eagle_%2813434882845%29.jpg/440px-Golden_eagle_%2813434882845%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4928" data-file-height="3280" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Golden_eagle_(13434882845).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Golden_eagle" title="Golden eagle">golden eagle</a> is the national symbol and animal of Albania.</div></div></div>
<p>A <a href="/wiki/Biodiversity_hotspot" title="Biodiversity hotspot">biodiversity hotspot</a>, Albania possesses an exceptionally rich and contrasting <a href="/wiki/Biodiversity" title="Biodiversity">biodiversity</a> thanks to its geographical location at the center of the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a> and the great diversity in its <a href="/wiki/Climatic" class="mw-redirect" title="Climatic">climatic</a>, <a href="/wiki/Geological" class="mw-redirect" title="Geological">geological</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hydrological" class="mw-redirect" title="Hydrological">hydrological</a> conditions.<sup id="cite_ref-124" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-124">&#91;123&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-125" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-125">&#91;124&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Due to remoteness, the mountains and hills are endowed with <a href="/wiki/Forest" title="Forest">forests</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tree" title="Tree">trees</a> and <a href="/wiki/Grass" class="mw-redirect" title="Grass">grasses</a> that are essential to the lives for a wide variety of <a href="/wiki/Animal" title="Animal">animals</a> among other for two of the most iconic <a href="/wiki/Endangered_species" title="Endangered species">endangered species</a> of the country, the <a href="/wiki/Balkan_lynx" title="Balkan lynx">lynx</a> and <a href="/wiki/Brown_bear" title="Brown bear">brown bear</a>, as well as the <a href="/wiki/Wildcat" title="Wildcat">wildcat</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gray_wolf" class="mw-redirect" title="Gray wolf">gray wolf</a>, <a href="/wiki/Red_fox" title="Red fox">red fox</a>, <a href="/wiki/Golden_jackal" title="Golden jackal">golden jackal</a> and last but not least for the <a href="/wiki/Egyptian_vulture" title="Egyptian vulture">egyptian vulture</a> and <a href="/wiki/Golden_eagle" title="Golden eagle">golden eagle</a>, the national animal of the country.<sup id="cite_ref-126" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-126">&#91;125&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-127" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-127">&#91;126&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-128" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-128">&#91;127&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-129" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-129">&#91;128&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The estuaries, wetlands and lakes are extraordinarily important for the <a href="/wiki/Greater_flamingo" title="Greater flamingo">greater flamingo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pygmy_cormorant" title="Pygmy cormorant">pygmy cormorant</a> and the extremely rare and perhaps the most iconic bird of the country, the <a href="/wiki/Dalmatian_pelican" title="Dalmatian pelican">dalmatian pelican</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-130" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-130">&#91;129&#93;</a></sup> Of particular importance are the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_monk_seal" title="Mediterranean monk seal">mediterranean monk seal</a>, <a href="/wiki/Loggerhead_sea_turtle" title="Loggerhead sea turtle">loggerhead sea turtle</a> and <a href="/wiki/Green_sea_turtle" title="Green sea turtle">green sea turtle</a> that use to nest on the country's coastal waters and shores.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Delfinees.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/Delfinees.jpg/220px-Delfinees.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="139" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/Delfinees.jpg/330px-Delfinees.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/Delfinees.jpg/440px-Delfinees.jpg 2x" data-file-width="760" data-file-height="480" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Delfinees.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Common_bottlenose_dolphin" title="Common bottlenose dolphin">common bottlenose dolphin</a> is a frequent visitor to the waters of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Albanian Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ionian_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Ionian Sea Coast">Ionian Sea Coasts</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>In terms of <a href="/wiki/Phytogeography" title="Phytogeography">phytogeography</a>, Albania is part of the <a href="/wiki/Boreal_Kingdom" title="Boreal Kingdom">Boreal Kingdom</a> and stretches specifically within the <a href="/wiki/Illyria" title="Illyria">Illyrian</a> province of the <a href="/wiki/Circumboreal_Region" title="Circumboreal Region">Circumboreal</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Basin" title="Mediterranean Basin">Mediterranean Region</a>. Its territory can be conventionally subdivided into four terrestrial <a href="/wiki/Ecoregion" title="Ecoregion">ecoregions</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Palearctic_ecozone" class="mw-redirect" title="Palearctic ecozone">Palearctic ecozone</a> inclusively the <a href="/wiki/Illyrian_deciduous_forests" title="Illyrian deciduous forests">Illyrian deciduous forests</a>, <a href="/wiki/Balkan_mixed_forests" title="Balkan mixed forests">Balkan mixed forests</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pindus_Mountains_mixed_forests" title="Pindus Mountains mixed forests">Pindus Mountains mixed forests</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dinaric_Mountains_mixed_forests" title="Dinaric Mountains mixed forests">Dinaric Mountains mixed forests</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-131" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-131">&#91;130&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-132" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-132">&#91;131&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Approximately 3,500 different species of <a href="/wiki/Plant" title="Plant">plants</a> can be found in Albania which refers principally to a <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean" class="mw-redirect" title="Mediterranean">Mediterranean</a> and <a href="/wiki/Eurasia" title="Eurasia">Eurasian</a> character. The country maintains a vibrant tradition of <a href="/wiki/Herb" title="Herb">herbal</a> and <a href="/wiki/Medicinal_Purposes" title="Medicinal Purposes">medicinal practices</a>. At the minimum 300 plants growing locally are used in the preparation of herbs and medicines.<sup id="cite_ref-133" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-133">&#91;132&#93;</a></sup> The trees within the forests are primarily made up of <a href="/wiki/Fir" title="Fir">fir</a>, <a href="/wiki/Oak" title="Oak">oak</a>, <a href="/wiki/Beech" title="Beech">beech</a> and <a href="/wiki/Pine" title="Pine">pine</a>.
</p><p>In the 2010 <a href="/wiki/Environmental_Performance_Index" title="Environmental Performance Index">Environmental Performance Index</a>, Albania was ranked 23rd out of 163 countries in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-134" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-134">&#91;133&#93;</a></sup> In 2012, the country advanced from 23rd to 15th, whereas it had the highest ranking in <a href="/wiki/Southern_Europe" title="Southern Europe">South</a> and <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Europe" title="Eastern Europe">Eastern Europe</a> and <a href="/wiki/Central_Asia" title="Central Asia">Central Asia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-135" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-135">&#91;134&#93;</a></sup> The country was the 24th greenest country in the world according to the 2005 <a href="/wiki/Environmental_Sustainability_Index" class="mw-redirect" title="Environmental Sustainability Index">Environmental Sustainability Index</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-136" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-136">&#91;135&#93;</a></sup> Nevertheless, for 2016, the country was ranked the 13th best performing country on the <a href="/wiki/Happy_Planet_Index" title="Happy Planet Index">Happy Planet Index</a> by the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HPI2017_137-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HPI2017-137">&#91;136&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Protected_areas">Protected areas</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Protected_areas_of_Albania" title="Protected areas of Albania">Protected areas of Albania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/National_parks_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="National parks of Albania">National parks of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lake_Skadar,_Shkoder_Albania_2016.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Lake_Skadar%2C_Shkoder_Albania_2016.jpg/300px-Lake_Skadar%2C_Shkoder_Albania_2016.jpg" decoding="async" width="300" height="92" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Lake_Skadar%2C_Shkoder_Albania_2016.jpg/450px-Lake_Skadar%2C_Shkoder_Albania_2016.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Lake_Skadar%2C_Shkoder_Albania_2016.jpg/600px-Lake_Skadar%2C_Shkoder_Albania_2016.jpg 2x" data-file-width="11068" data-file-height="3397" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Lake_Skadar,_Shkoder_Albania_2016.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Panoramic view above the <a href="/wiki/Lake_of_Shkod%C3%ABr" class="mw-redirect" title="Lake of Shkodër">Lake of Shkodër</a> towards the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a>. Being the largest lake in <a href="/wiki/Southern_Europe" title="Southern Europe">Southern Europe</a>, it is designated as a <a href="/wiki/Lake_Shkod%C3%ABr_Nature_Reserve" title="Lake Shkodër Nature Reserve">Nature Reserve</a> as well as a <a href="/wiki/List_of_Ramsar_sites_in_Albania" title="List of Ramsar sites in Albania">Ramsar Site</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-138" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-138">&#91;137&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-139" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-139">&#91;138&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Protected_areas_of_Albania" title="Protected areas of Albania">protected areas of Albania</a> are the system through the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_government" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian government">Albanian government</a> protects, maintains and displays some of the country's most impressive and treasured <a href="/wiki/Natural_environment" title="Natural environment">environments</a>. There are 15 <a href="/wiki/National_park" title="National park">national parks</a>, 4 <a href="/wiki/Ramsar_site" title="Ramsar site">ramsar sites</a>, 1 <a href="/wiki/Biosphere_reserve" class="mw-redirect" title="Biosphere reserve">biosphere reserve</a> and 786 other types of conservation reserves across Albania all of them depicting a huge variety of natural sceneries ranging from imposing <a href="/wiki/Mountain" title="Mountain">mountains</a> to picturesque <a href="/wiki/Coast" title="Coast">coasts</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-140" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-140">&#91;139&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Albania has fifteen officially designated <a href="/wiki/National_parks_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="National parks of Albania">national parks</a> scattered across the country's territory.<sup id="cite_ref-141" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-141">&#91;140&#93;</a></sup> Encircled by numerous <a href="/wiki/Two-thousander" title="Two-thousander">two-thousanders</a>, <a href="/wiki/Valbon%C3%AB_Valley_National_Park" title="Valbonë Valley National Park">Valbonë Valley National Park</a> and <a href="/wiki/Theth_National_Park" title="Theth National Park">Theth National Park</a> cover a combined territory of 106.3 square kilometres (41.0&#160;sq&#160;mi) within the rugged <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a> in northern Albania. <a href="/wiki/Shebenik-Jabllanic%C3%AB_National_Park" title="Shebenik-Jabllanicë National Park">Shebenik-Jabllanicë National Park</a> and <a href="/wiki/Prespa_National_Park" title="Prespa National Park">Prespa National Park</a> protect the spectacular mountainous scenery of eastern Albania as well as the country's sections of the <a href="/wiki/Prespa_Lake" class="mw-redirect" title="Prespa Lake">Great</a> and <a href="/wiki/Small_Prespa_Lake" title="Small Prespa Lake">Small Lakes of Prespa</a>.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Divjak%C3%AB-Karavasta_National_Park" title="Divjakë-Karavasta National Park">Divjakë-Karavasta National Park</a> extends along the central <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast</a> and possesses one of the largest lagoons in the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Lagoon_of_Karavasta" title="Lagoon of Karavasta">Lagoon of Karavasta</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Ceraunian_Mountains" title="Ceraunian Mountains">Ceraunian Mountains</a> in southern Albania, rising immediately along the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ionian_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Ionian Sea Coast">Albanian Ionian Sea Coast</a>, characterises the topographical picture of <a href="/wiki/Llogara_National_Park" title="Llogara National Park">Llogara National Park</a> and continue on the <a href="/wiki/Karaburun_Peninsula_(Albania)" title="Karaburun Peninsula (Albania)">Peninsula of Karaburun</a> within the <a href="/wiki/Karaburun-Sazan_Marine_Park" title="Karaburun-Sazan Marine Park">Karaburun-Sazan Marine Park</a>. Further south sprawls the <a href="/wiki/Butrint_National_Park" title="Butrint National Park">Butrint National Park</a> on a peninsula that is surrounded by the <a href="/wiki/Lake_Butrint" title="Lake Butrint">Lake of Butrint</a> and <a href="/wiki/Vivari_Channel" class="mw-redirect" title="Vivari Channel">Channel of Vivari</a> on the eastern half of the <a href="/wiki/Straits_of_Corfu" title="Straits of Corfu">Straits of Corfu</a>.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Administrative_divisions">Administrative divisions</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Counties_of_Albania" title="Counties of Albania">Counties</a> and <a href="/wiki/Municipalities_of_Albania" title="Municipalities of Albania">Municipalities of Albania</a></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Sovereign_state" title="Sovereign state">sovereign state</a> of Albania is a <a href="/wiki/Unitary_state" title="Unitary state">unitary state</a> defined in a total area of 28,748 square kilometres (11,100 square miles). It is apportioned into 12 <a href="/wiki/Counties_of_Albania" title="Counties of Albania">counties</a> each with their own council and administration.<sup id="cite_ref-142" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-142">&#91;141&#93;</a></sup> The counties are the country's primary <a href="/wiki/Administrative_divisions_of_Albania" title="Administrative divisions of Albania">administrative divisions</a> and further subdivided into 61 <a href="/wiki/Municipalities_of_Albania" title="Municipalities of Albania">municipalities</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-143" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-143">&#91;142&#93;</a></sup> They are responsible for geographical, economic, social and cultural purposes inside the counties.
</p><p>The counties were created on 31 July 2000 to replace the 36 former districts.<sup id="cite_ref-144" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-144">&#91;143&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-terref_145-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-terref-145">&#91;144&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Government of Albania">government</a> introduced the new administrative divisions to be implemented in 2015, whereby municipalities were reduced to 61, while the rurals were abolished. The defunct municipalities are known as neighborhoods or villages.<sup id="cite_ref-146" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-146">&#91;145&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-147" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-147">&#91;146&#93;</a></sup> There are overall 2980 villages or communities in the entire country, formerly known as localities. The municipalities are the first level of local governance, responsible for local needs and <a href="/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_Albania" title="Law enforcement in Albania">law enforcement</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-148" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-148">&#91;147&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-149" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-149">&#91;148&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-150" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-150">&#91;149&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The largest county in Albania, by population, is <a href="/wiki/Tirana_County" title="Tirana County">Tirana County</a> with over 800,000 people followed by <a href="/wiki/Fier_County" title="Fier County">Fier County</a> with over 300,000 people. The smallest county, by population, is <a href="/wiki/Gjirokast%C3%ABr_County" title="Gjirokastër County">Gjirokastër County</a> with over 70,000 people. The largest in the county, by area, is <a href="/wiki/Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB_County" title="Korçë County">Korçë County</a> encompassing 3,711 square kilometres (1,433&#160;sq&#160;mi) of the southeast of Albania followed by <a href="/wiki/Shkod%C3%ABr_County" title="Shkodër County">Shkodër County</a> with 3,562 square kilometres (1,375&#160;sq&#160;mi) in the northwest of Albania. The smallest county, by area, is <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_County" title="Durrës County">Durrës County</a> with an area of 766 square kilometres (296&#160;sq&#160;mi) in the west of Albania.
</p>
<table style="margin:auto;" cellpadding="10">

<tbody><tr>
<td><div class="floatright"><a href="/wiki/File:Harta_Administrative_e_Shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB.svg" class="image"><img alt="Harta Administrative e Shqipërisë.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cc/Harta_Administrative_e_Shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB.svg/146px-Harta_Administrative_e_Shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB.svg.png" decoding="async" width="146" height="318" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cc/Harta_Administrative_e_Shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB.svg/219px-Harta_Administrative_e_Shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cc/Harta_Administrative_e_Shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB.svg/292px-Harta_Administrative_e_Shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="299" data-file-height="652" /></a></div>

</div>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Politics">Politics</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_Albania" title="Politics of Albania">Politics of Albania</a></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Government">Government</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Government of Albania">Government of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Tirana,_consiglio_dei_ministri,_02.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4f/Tirana%2C_consiglio_dei_ministri%2C_02.JPG/220px-Tirana%2C_consiglio_dei_ministri%2C_02.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="139" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4f/Tirana%2C_consiglio_dei_ministri%2C_02.JPG/330px-Tirana%2C_consiglio_dei_ministri%2C_02.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4f/Tirana%2C_consiglio_dei_ministri%2C_02.JPG/440px-Tirana%2C_consiglio_dei_ministri%2C_02.JPG 2x" data-file-width="3456" data-file-height="2176" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Tirana,_consiglio_dei_ministri,_02.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister%27s_Office_(Albania)" title="Prime Minister&#39;s Office (Albania)">Kryeministria</a>, the official workplace of the <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Albania" title="Prime Minister of Albania">Prime Minister of Albania</a> located in <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Albania is a <a href="/wiki/Parliamentary_republic" title="Parliamentary republic">parliamentary</a> <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_republic" class="mw-redirect" title="Constitutional republic">constitutional republic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Sovereign_state" title="Sovereign state">sovereign state</a> whose <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_Albania" title="Politics of Albania">politics</a> operate under a framework laid out in the <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Albania" title="Constitution of Albania">constitution</a> wherein the <a href="/wiki/President_of_Albania" title="President of Albania">president</a> functions as the <a href="/wiki/Head_of_state" title="Head of state">head of state</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Albania" title="Prime Minister of Albania">prime minister</a> as the <a href="/wiki/Head_of_government" title="Head of government">head of government</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-kushtetuta_151-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kushtetuta-151">&#91;150&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Sovereignty" title="Sovereignty">sovereignty</a> is vested in the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian people">Albanian people</a> and exercised by the Albanian people through their representatives or directly.<sup id="cite_ref-kushtetuta_151-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kushtetuta-151">&#91;150&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Government of Albania">government</a> is based on the separation and balancing of powers among the <a href="/wiki/Legislative" class="mw-redirect" title="Legislative">legislative</a>, <a href="/wiki/Judiciary" title="Judiciary">judiciary</a> and <a href="/wiki/Executive_(government)" title="Executive (government)">executive</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-kushtetuta_151-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kushtetuta-151">&#91;150&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Legislative_power" class="mw-redirect" title="Legislative power">legislative power</a> is held by the <a href="/wiki/Parliament_of_Albania" title="Parliament of Albania">parliament</a> and is elected every four years by a system of <a href="/wiki/Party-list_proportional_representation" title="Party-list proportional representation">party-list proportional representation</a> by the Albanian people on the basis of free, equal, universal and periodic <a href="/wiki/Suffrage" title="Suffrage">suffrage</a> by <a href="/wiki/Secret_ballot" title="Secret ballot">secret ballot</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-kushtetuta_151-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kushtetuta-151">&#91;150&#93;</a></sup> 
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Civil_law_(legal_system)" title="Civil law (legal system)">civil law</a>, codified and based on the <a href="/wiki/Napoleonic_Code" title="Napoleonic Code">Napoleonic Code</a>, is divided between <a href="/wiki/Court" title="Court">courts</a> with regular civil and criminal jurisdiction and administrative courts. The <a href="/wiki/Judicial_power" class="mw-redirect" title="Judicial power">judicial power</a> is vested in the <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Albania" title="Supreme Court of Albania">supreme court</a>, <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_Court_of_Albania" title="Constitutional Court of Albania">constitutional court</a>, <a href="/wiki/Appeals_courts_of_Albania" title="Appeals courts of Albania">appeal court</a> and <a href="/wiki/Administrative_Courts_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Administrative Courts in Albania">administrative court</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-152" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-152">&#91;151&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Law_enforcement" title="Law enforcement">Law enforcement</a> in the country is primarily the responsibility of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Police" title="Albanian Police">Albanian Police</a>, the main and largest state law enforcement agency. It carries out nearly all general police duties including criminal investigation, patrol activity, traffic policing and border control.
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Executive_power" class="mw-redirect" title="Executive power">executive power</a> is exercised by the president and prime minister whereby the power of the president is very limited. The president is the <a href="/wiki/Commander-in-chief" title="Commander-in-chief">commander-in-chief</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Armed_Forces" title="Albanian Armed Forces">military</a> and the representative of the unity of the Albanian people.<sup id="cite_ref-president_153-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-president-153">&#91;152&#93;</a></sup> The tenure of the president depends on the <a href="/wiki/Confidence_and_supply" title="Confidence and supply">confidence</a> of the parliament and is <a href="/wiki/Election" title="Election">elected</a> for a five-year <a href="/wiki/Term_of_office" title="Term of office">term</a> by the parliament by a majority of three-fifths of all its members. The prime minister, appointed by the president and approved by the parliament, is authorized to constitute the <a href="/wiki/Cabinet_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Cabinet of Albania">cabinet</a>. The cabinet is composed primarily of the prime minister inclusively its deputies and ministers.<sup id="cite_ref-prime_minister_154-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-prime_minister-154">&#91;153&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Foreign_relations">Foreign relations</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Albania" title="Foreign relations of Albania">Foreign relations of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Artigianato_Arberesh.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/36/Artigianato_Arberesh.jpg/220px-Artigianato_Arberesh.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="172" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/36/Artigianato_Arberesh.jpg/330px-Artigianato_Arberesh.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/36/Artigianato_Arberesh.jpg/440px-Artigianato_Arberesh.jpg 2x" data-file-width="474" data-file-height="371" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Artigianato_Arberesh.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Assisted by the governments of <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a> and Albania, an official application for the inclusion of the <a href="/wiki/Arb%C3%ABresh%C3%AB_people" title="Arbëreshë people">Arbëreshës</a> in the list of <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> <a href="/wiki/UNESCO_Intangible_Cultural_Heritage_Lists" title="UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists">Intangible Cultural Heritage</a> is being prepared.<sup id="cite_ref-155" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-155">&#91;154&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>In the time since the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">end of communism</a> and <a href="/wiki/Isolationism" title="Isolationism">isolationism</a>, Albania has extended its responsibilities and position in continental and international affairs, developing and establishing friendly <a href="/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Albania" title="Foreign relations of Albania">relations</a> with other countries around the world. Its main objectives are the <a href="/wiki/Accession_of_Albania_to_the_European_Union" title="Accession of Albania to the European Union">accession</a> into the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>, the <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">international recognition</a> of <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Expulsion_of_Cham_Albanians" title="Expulsion of Cham Albanians">expulsion</a> of <a href="/wiki/Cham_Albanians" title="Cham Albanians">Cham Albanians</a> as well as helping and protecting the rights of the <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> in <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Kosovo" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanians in Kosovo">Kosovo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Montenegro" title="Albanians in Montenegro">Montenegro</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Macedonia" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanians in Macedonia">North Macedonia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_greece" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanians in greece">Greece</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_south_Serbia" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanians in south Serbia">Serbia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Arb%C3%ABresh%C3%AB_people" title="Arbëreshë people">Italy</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_diaspora" title="Albanian diaspora">Diaspora</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-156" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-156">&#91;155&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Albania-NATO_relations" class="mw-redirect" title="Albania-NATO relations">admission</a> of Albania into the <a href="/wiki/North_Atlantic_Treaty_Organization_(NATO)" class="mw-redirect" title="North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO)">North Atlantic Treaty Organization</a> was considered by Albanian politicians as a primary ambition for the country. The country has been extensively engaged with the organization and has maintained its position as a stability factor and a strong ally of the United States and European Union in the troubled and divided region of the <a href="/wiki/Balkans" title="Balkans">Balkans</a>.
</p><p>Albania and <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a> are culturally, socially and economically very closely rooted due to the Albanian majority population in Kosovo. In 1998, the country contributed in supporting allied efforts to end the <a href="/wiki/Kosovo_War" title="Kosovo War">humanitarian tragedy in Kosovo</a> and secure the peace after the <a href="/wiki/NATO_bombing_of_Yugoslavia" title="NATO bombing of Yugoslavia">NATO bombing of Yugoslavia</a>.
</p><p>Albania enjoys friendly and close <a href="/wiki/Albanian_American_relations" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian American relations">ties</a> with the <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a> ever after it supported the country's independence and its democracy.<sup id="cite_ref-157" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-157">&#91;156&#93;</a></sup> In present day, the two countries have maintained close economic and defense relations and have signed a number of agreements and <a href="/wiki/Treaties" class="mw-redirect" title="Treaties">treaties</a>. In 2007, Albania welcomed <a href="/wiki/George_W._Bush" title="George W. Bush">George W. Bush</a> who became the first <a href="/wiki/President_of_the_United_States" title="President of the United States">President of the United States</a> ever to visit the country.
</p><p>Albania has been an active member of the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a> since 1955. They country took on membership for the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Economic_and_Social_Council" title="United Nations Economic and Social Council">United Nations Economic and Social Council</a> from 2005 to 2007 as well as in 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-ECOSOC_158-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ECOSOC-158">&#91;157&#93;</a></sup> It served as vice president of the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Economic_and_Social_Council" title="United Nations Economic and Social Council">ECOSOC</a> in 2006 and 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-ECOSOC_158-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ECOSOC-158">&#91;157&#93;</a></sup> In 2014, it also joined the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Human_Rights_Council" title="United Nations Human Rights Council">United Nations Human Rights Council</a> from 2015 to 2017 and was elected vice president in 2015.<sup id="cite_ref-159" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-159">&#91;158&#93;</a></sup> Albania is a full member of numerous international organizations inclusively the <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Europe" title="Council of Europe">Council of Europe</a>, <a href="/wiki/International_Organization_for_Migration" title="International Organization for Migration">International Organization for Migration</a>, <a href="/wiki/World_Health_Organization" title="World Health Organization">World Health Organization</a>, <a href="/wiki/Union_for_the_Mediterranean" title="Union for the Mediterranean">Union for the Mediterranean</a>, <a href="/wiki/Organisation_of_Islamic_Cooperation" title="Organisation of Islamic Cooperation">Organisation of Islamic Cooperation</a>, <a href="/wiki/Organization_for_Security_and_Cooperation_in_Europe" class="mw-redirect" title="Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe">Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe</a>, <a href="/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund" title="International Monetary Fund">International Monetary Fund</a>, <a href="/wiki/World_Trade_Organization" title="World Trade Organization">World Trade Organization</a> and <a href="/wiki/La_Francophonie" class="mw-redirect" title="La Francophonie">La Francophonie</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Military">Military</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Armed Forces of Albania">Armed Forces of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Albanian_special_operations_forces,_provide_security_as_Afghan_Border_Police_(ABP)_break_ground_on_a_new_checkpoint_in_the_district_of_Spin_Boldak,_Kandahar_province,_Afghanistan,_March_25,_2013_130325-A-MX357-127.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Albanian_special_operations_forces%2C_provide_security_as_Afghan_Border_Police_%28ABP%29_break_ground_on_a_new_checkpoint_in_the_district_of_Spin_Boldak%2C_Kandahar_province%2C_Afghanistan%2C_March_25%2C_2013_130325-A-MX357-127.jpg/220px-thumbnail.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="164" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Albanian_special_operations_forces%2C_provide_security_as_Afghan_Border_Police_%28ABP%29_break_ground_on_a_new_checkpoint_in_the_district_of_Spin_Boldak%2C_Kandahar_province%2C_Afghanistan%2C_March_25%2C_2013_130325-A-MX357-127.jpg/330px-thumbnail.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Albanian_special_operations_forces%2C_provide_security_as_Afghan_Border_Police_%28ABP%29_break_ground_on_a_new_checkpoint_in_the_district_of_Spin_Boldak%2C_Kandahar_province%2C_Afghanistan%2C_March_25%2C_2013_130325-A-MX357-127.jpg/440px-thumbnail.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3332" data-file-height="2480" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Albanian_special_operations_forces,_provide_security_as_Afghan_Border_Police_(ABP)_break_ground_on_a_new_checkpoint_in_the_district_of_Spin_Boldak,_Kandahar_province,_Afghanistan,_March_25,_2013_130325-A-MX357-127.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Albanian_Land_Force" title="Albanian Land Force">Albanian soldiers</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Kandahar_Province" title="Kandahar Province">Province of Kandahar</a>, <a href="/wiki/Afghanistan" title="Afghanistan">Afghanistan</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Armed_Forces" title="Albanian Armed Forces">Albanian Armed Forces</a> consist of <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Land_Force" title="Albanian Land Force">Land</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Air_Force" title="Albanian Air Force">Air</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Naval_Force" title="Albanian Naval Force">Naval Forces</a> and constitute the military and paramilitary forces of the country. They are led by a <a href="/wiki/Commander-in-chief" title="Commander-in-chief">commander-in-chief</a> under the supervision of the <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Albania)" title="Ministry of Defence (Albania)">Ministry of Defense</a> and by the <a href="/wiki/President_of_Albania" title="President of Albania">President</a> as the supreme commander during wartime however, in times of peace its powers are executed through the <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Albania" title="Prime Minister of Albania">Prime Minister</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Albania)" title="Ministry of Defence (Albania)">Defence Minister</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-constitution_160-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-constitution-160">&#91;159&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The chief purpose of the armed forces of Albania is the defence of the <a href="/wiki/Independence" title="Independence">independence</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Sovereignty" title="Sovereignty">sovereignty</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Territorial_integrity" title="Territorial integrity">territorial integrity</a> of the country, as well as the participation in humanitarian, combat, non-combat and peace support operations.<sup id="cite_ref-constitution_160-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-constitution-160">&#91;159&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Military_service" title="Military service">Military service</a> is voluntary since 2010 with the age of 19 being the legal minimum age for the duty.<sup id="cite_ref-161" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-161">&#91;160&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-162" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-162">&#91;161&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Albania has committed to increase the participations in multinational operations.<sup id="cite_ref-163" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-163">&#91;162&#93;</a></sup> Since the fall of communism, the country has participated in six international missions but participated in only one <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a> mission in <a href="/wiki/UNOMIG" class="mw-redirect" title="UNOMIG">Georgia</a> sending of 3 military observers. Since February 2008, Albania has participated officially in NATO's <a href="/wiki/Operation_Active_Endeavor" class="mw-redirect" title="Operation Active Endeavor">Operation Active Endeavor</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-164" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-164">&#91;163&#93;</a></sup> It was invited to join NATO on 3 April 2008, and it became a full member on 2 April 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-165" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-165">&#91;164&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Albania reduced the number of active troops from 65,000 in 1988 to 14,500 in 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-166" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-166">&#91;165&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-167" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-167">&#91;166&#93;</a></sup> The military now consists mainly of a small fleet of aircraft and sea vessels. In the 1990s, the country scrapped enormous amounts of obsolete hardware from China, such as tanks and <a href="/wiki/Surface-to-air_missile" title="Surface-to-air missile">SAM systems</a>. Increasing the military budget was one of the most important conditions for <a href="/wiki/NATO" title="NATO">NATO</a> integration. Military spending has generally been low.
