As of 1996 military spending was an estimated 1.5% of the country's <a href="/wiki/GDP" class="mw-redirect" title="GDP">GDP</a>, only to peak in 2009 at 2% and fall again to 1.5%.<sup id="cite_ref-168" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-168">&#91;167&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Economy">Economy</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Albania" title="Economy of Albania">Economy of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/35/Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg/220px-Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/35/Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg/330px-Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/35/Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg/440px-Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5871" data-file-height="3914" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Toptani_Shopping_Mall_Tirana_2016.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> is the economic hub of the country. It is home to major domestic and foreign companies operating in the country.</div></div></div>
<p>The transition from a socialist <a href="/wiki/Planned_economy" title="Planned economy">planned economy</a> to a capitalist <a href="/wiki/Mixed_economy" title="Mixed economy">mixed economy</a> in Albania has been largely successful.<sup id="cite_ref-worlddiplomacy_169-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-worlddiplomacy-169">&#91;168&#93;</a></sup> The country has a <a href="/wiki/Developing_country" title="Developing country">developing</a> mixed economy classified by the <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" title="World Bank">World Bank</a> as an <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GNI_(nominal,_Atlas_method)_per_capita#Upper-middle-income_group" class="mw-redirect" title="List of countries by GNI (nominal, Atlas method) per capita">upper-middle income economy</a>. In 2016, it had the 4th lowest <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_unemployment_rate" title="List of countries by unemployment rate">unemployment rate</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Balkans" title="Balkans">Balkans</a> with an estimated value of 14.7%. Its largest trading partners are Italy, Greece, China, Spain, Kosovo and the United States. The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_lek" title="Albanian lek">lek</a> (ALL) is the country's currency and is <a href="/wiki/Fixed_exchange_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="Fixed exchange rate">pegged</a> at approximately 132,51 lek per euro.
</p><p>The cities of <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a> constitute the economic and financial heart of Albania due to their high population, modern infrastructure and strategic geographical location. The country's most important infrastructure facilities take course through both of the cities, connecting the north to the south as well as the west to the east. Among the largest <a href="/wiki/List_of_companies_of_Albania" title="List of companies of Albania">companies</a> are the petroleum <a href="/wiki/Ta%C3%A7i_Oil" title="Taçi Oil">Taçi Oil</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albpetrol" title="Albpetrol">Albpetrol</a>, <a href="/wiki/ARMO_oil_refiner" title="ARMO oil refiner">ARMO</a> and Kastrati, the mineral <a href="/wiki/AlbChrome" title="AlbChrome">AlbChrome</a>, the cement <a href="/wiki/Antea_Cement" title="Antea Cement">Antea</a>, the investment <a href="/wiki/Samir_Mane" title="Samir Mane">BALFIN Group</a> and the technology <a href="/wiki/Albtelecom" title="Albtelecom">Albtelecom</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vodafone_Albania" title="Vodafone Albania">Vodafone</a>, <a href="/wiki/Telekom_Albania" title="Telekom Albania">Telekom Albania</a> and others.
</p><p>In 2012, Albania's <a href="/wiki/GDP_per_capita" class="mw-redirect" title="GDP per capita">GDP per capita</a> stood at 30% of the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> average, while <a href="/wiki/GDP_(PPP)_per_capita" class="mw-redirect" title="GDP (PPP) per capita">GDP (PPP) per capita</a> was 35%.<sup id="cite_ref-170" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-170">&#91;169&#93;</a></sup> Albania were one of three countries in <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a> to record an <a href="/wiki/Economic_growth" title="Economic growth">economic growth</a> in the first quarter of 2010 after the <a href="/wiki/Global_financial_crisis" class="mw-redirect" title="Global financial crisis">global financial crisis</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-171" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-171">&#91;170&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-172" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-172">&#91;171&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund" title="International Monetary Fund">International Monetary Fund</a> predicted 2.6% growth for Albania in 2010 and 3.2% in 2011.<sup id="cite_ref-173" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-173">&#91;172&#93;</a></sup> According to the <a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a> as of December&#160;2016<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Albania&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup>, the <a href="/wiki/Gross_Domestic_Product_(GDP)" class="mw-redirect" title="Gross Domestic Product (GDP)">Gross Domestic Product (GDP)</a> was growing at 2.8%. The country had a <a href="/wiki/Trade_balance" class="mw-redirect" title="Trade balance">trade balance</a> of −9.7% and <a href="/wiki/Unemployment_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="Unemployment rate">unemployment rate</a> of 14.7%.<sup id="cite_ref-174" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-174">&#91;173&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Foreign_direct_investment" title="Foreign direct investment">Foreign direct investment</a> has increased significantly in recent years as the government has embarked on an ambitious program to improve the business climate through fiscal and legislative reforms. The economy is expected to expand in the near term, driven by a recovery in consumption and robust investments. Growth is projected to be 3.2% in 2016, 3.5% in 2017, and 3.8% in 2018.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Primary_sector">Primary sector</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Agriculture_in_Albania" title="Agriculture in Albania">Agriculture in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg/220px-Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg/330px-Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg/440px-Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="1200" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Berat_kale_-_panoramio.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Grapes in <a href="/wiki/Berat" title="Berat">Berat</a>. Due to the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_climate" title="Mediterranean climate">mediterranean climate</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albanian_wine" title="Albanian wine">wine</a>, <a href="/wiki/Olive" title="Olive">olives</a> and <a href="/wiki/Citrus_fruit" class="mw-redirect" title="Citrus fruit">citrus fruits</a> are mostly produced in Southern Albania.</div></div></div>
<p>Agriculture in the country is based on small to medium-sized family-owned dispersed units. It remains a significant sector of the <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Albania" title="Economy of Albania">economy of Albania</a>. It employs 41%<sup id="cite_ref-175" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-175">&#91;174&#93;</a></sup> of the population, and about 24.31% of the land is used for agricultural purposes. One of the earliest farming sites in <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a> has been found in the southeast of the country.<sup id="cite_ref-176" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-176">&#91;175&#93;</a></sup> As part of the pre-accession process of Albania to the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>, farmers are being aided through IPA funds to improve Albanian agriculture standards.<sup id="cite_ref-177" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-177">&#91;176&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Albania produces significant amounts of <a href="/wiki/Fruit" title="Fruit">fruits</a> (<a href="/wiki/Apple" title="Apple">apples</a>, <a href="/wiki/Olive" title="Olive">olives</a>, <a href="/wiki/Grape" title="Grape">grapes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Orange_(fruit)" title="Orange (fruit)">oranges</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lemon" title="Lemon">lemons</a>, <a href="/wiki/Apricot" title="Apricot">apricots</a>, <a href="/wiki/Peach" title="Peach">peaches</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cherry" title="Cherry">cherries</a>, <a href="/wiki/Figs" class="mw-redirect" title="Figs">figs</a>, <a href="/wiki/Prunus_cerasus" title="Prunus cerasus">sour cherries</a>, <a href="/wiki/Plum" title="Plum">plums</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Strawberry" title="Strawberry">strawberries</a>), <a href="/wiki/Vegetable_oil" title="Vegetable oil">vegetables</a> (<a href="/wiki/Potato" title="Potato">potatoes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tomato" title="Tomato">tomatoes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Maize" title="Maize">maize</a>, <a href="/wiki/Onion" title="Onion">onions</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Wheat" title="Wheat">wheat</a>), <a href="/wiki/Sugar_beet" title="Sugar beet">sugar beets</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tobacco" title="Tobacco">tobacco</a>, <a href="/wiki/Meat" title="Meat">meat</a>, <a href="/wiki/Honey" title="Honey">honey</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dairy_product" title="Dairy product">dairy products</a>, traditional medicine and <a href="/wiki/Essential_oil" title="Essential oil">aromatic plants</a>. Further, the country is a worldwide significant producer of <a href="/wiki/Salvia" title="Salvia">salvia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rosemary" title="Rosemary">rosemary</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gentiana_lutea" title="Gentiana lutea">yellow gentian</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-178" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-178">&#91;177&#93;</a></sup> The country's proximity to the <a href="/wiki/Ionian_Sea" title="Ionian Sea">Ionian Sea</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> give the underdeveloped <a href="/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">fishing</a> industry great potential. The <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" title="World Bank">World Bank</a> and <a href="/wiki/European_Community" class="mw-redirect" title="European Community">European Community</a> economists report that, Albania's fishing industry has good potential to generate export earnings because prices in the nearby Greek and Italian markets are many times higher than those in the Albanian market. The fish available off the coasts of the country are <a href="/wiki/Carp" title="Carp">carp</a>, <a href="/wiki/Trout" title="Trout">trout</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sea_bream" class="mw-redirect" title="Sea bream">sea bream</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mussel" title="Mussel">mussels</a> and <a href="/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">crustaceans</a>.
</p><p>Albania has one of Europe's longest histories of <a href="/wiki/Viticulture" title="Viticulture">viticulture</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-winealbania1_179-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-winealbania1-179">&#91;178&#93;</a></sup> The today's region was one of the few places where vine was naturally grown during the ice age. The oldest found seeds in the region are 4,000 to 6,000 years old.<sup id="cite_ref-Stevenson2011_180-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Stevenson2011-180">&#91;179&#93;</a></sup> In 2009, the nation produced an estimated 17,500 tonnes of <a href="/wiki/Wine" title="Wine">wine</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-181" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-181">&#91;180&#93;</a></sup> During the communist era, the production area expanded to some 20,000 hectares (49,000 acres).<sup id="cite_ref-182" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-182">&#91;181&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Secondary_sector">Secondary sector</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Category:Mines_in_Albania" title="Category:Mines in Albania">Category:Mines in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB,_Albania_(10759257413).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg/220px-Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg/330px-Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg/440px-Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB%2C_Albania_%2810759257413%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5616" data-file-height="3744" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cement_factory_in_Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB,_Albania_(10759257413).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Antea_Cement" title="Antea Cement">Antea</a> factory in <a href="/wiki/Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB" title="Fushë-Krujë">Fushë-Krujë</a></div></div></div>
<p>The secondary sector of Albania have undergone many changes and diversification, since the collapse of the communist regime in the country. It is very diversified, from <a href="/wiki/Electronics_industry" title="Electronics industry">electronics</a>, <a href="/wiki/Manufacturing_industries" class="mw-redirect" title="Manufacturing industries">manufacturing</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-183" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-183">&#91;182&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Textile_industry" title="Textile industry">textiles</a>, to <a href="/wiki/Food_industry" title="Food industry">food</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cement_industry" class="mw-redirect" title="Cement industry">cement</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mining_industry" class="mw-redirect" title="Mining industry">mining</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-184" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-184">&#91;183&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Energy_industry" title="Energy industry">energy</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Antea_Cement" title="Antea Cement">Antea Cement</a> plant in <a href="/wiki/Fush%C3%AB-Kruj%C3%AB" title="Fushë-Krujë">Fushë-Krujë</a> is considered as one of the largest industrial greenfield investments in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-185" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-185">&#91;184&#93;</a></sup> Albanian oil and gas is represents of the most promising albeit strictly regulated sectors of its economy. Albania has the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_proven_oil_reserves" title="List of countries by proven oil reserves">second largest oil deposits</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Balkan_peninsula" class="mw-redirect" title="Balkan peninsula">Balkan peninsula</a> after <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a>, and the largest <a href="/wiki/Patos-Marinza_Oil_Field" title="Patos-Marinza Oil Field">oil reserves</a><sup id="cite_ref-186" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-186">&#91;185&#93;</a></sup> in Europe. The <a href="/wiki/Albpetrol" title="Albpetrol">Albpetrol</a> company is owned by the Albanian state and monitors the state petroleum agreements in the country. The textile industry has seen an extensive expansion by approaching companies from the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union (EU)</a> in Albania. According to the <a href="/wiki/Institute_of_Statistics_(Albania)" title="Institute of Statistics (Albania)">Institute of Statistics (INSTAT)</a> as of 2016<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Albania&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup>, the textile production marked an annual growth of 5.3% and an annual turnover of around 1.5 billion euros.<sup id="cite_ref-187" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-187">&#91;186&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Albania is a significant minerals producer and is ranked among the world's leading <a href="/wiki/Chromium" title="Chromium">chromium</a> producers and exporters.<sup id="cite_ref-188" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-188">&#91;187&#93;</a></sup> The nation is also a notable producer of <a href="/wiki/Copper" title="Copper">copper</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nickel" title="Nickel">nickel</a> and <a href="/wiki/Coal" title="Coal">coal</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-189" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-189">&#91;188&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Batra_mine" title="Batra mine">Batra mine</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bulqiz%C3%AB_mine" title="Bulqizë mine">Bulqizë mine</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Thekna_mine" title="Thekna mine">Thekna mine</a> are among the most recognised Albanian mines that are still in operation.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Tertiary_sector">Tertiary sector</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Banking_in_Albania" title="Banking in Albania">Banking</a>, <a href="/wiki/Telecommunications_in_Albania" title="Telecommunications in Albania">Telecommunications</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Tourism_in_Albania" title="Tourism in Albania">Tourism in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg/220px-Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg/330px-Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg/440px-Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="686" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Ksamil_Albania_._Albanian_Riviera.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Islands_of_Ksamil" title="Islands of Ksamil">Islands of Ksamil</a> in the south of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ionian_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Ionian Sea Coast">Albanian Ionian Sea Coast</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Tertiary_sector" class="mw-redirect" title="Tertiary sector">tertiary sector</a> represents the fastest growing sector of the country's economy. 36% of the population work in the service sector which contributes to 65% of the country's <a href="/wiki/Gross_domestic_product" title="Gross domestic product">GDP</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DSSA_190-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DSSA-190">&#91;189&#93;</a></sup> Ever since the end of the 20th century, the <a href="/wiki/Banking_industry" class="mw-redirect" title="Banking industry">banking industry</a> is a major component of the tertiary sector and remains in good conditions overall due to <a href="/wiki/Privatization" title="Privatization">privatization</a> and the commendable <a href="/wiki/Monetary_policy" title="Monetary policy">monetary policy</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-191">&#91;190&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-DSSA_190-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DSSA-190">&#91;189&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Previously one of the most <a href="/wiki/Isolationism" title="Isolationism">isolated</a> and controlled countries in the world, <a href="/wiki/Telecommunication_industry" class="mw-redirect" title="Telecommunication industry">telecommunication industry</a> represents nowadays another major contributor to the sector. It developed largely through privatization and subsequent investment by both domestic and foreign investors.<sup id="cite_ref-DSSA_190-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DSSA-190">&#91;189&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Eagle_Mobile" class="mw-redirect" title="Eagle Mobile">Eagle</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vodafone_Albania" title="Vodafone Albania">Vodafone</a> and <a href="/wiki/Telekom_Albania" title="Telekom Albania">Telekom Albania</a> are the leading <a href="/wiki/Telecommunications_service_provider" title="Telecommunications service provider">telecommunications service providers</a> in the country.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Tourism" title="Tourism">Tourism</a> is recognised as an industry of national importance and has been steadily increasing since the beginnings of the 21st century.<sup id="cite_ref-192" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-192">&#91;191&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-193" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-193">&#91;192&#93;</a></sup> It directly accounted for 8.4% of GDP in 2016 though including indirect contributions pushes the proportion to 26%.<sup id="cite_ref-194" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-194">&#91;193&#93;</a></sup> In the same year, the country received approximately 4.74&#160;million visitors mostly from across Europe and the <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a> as well.<sup id="cite_ref-195" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-195">&#91;194&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lake_Koman_Albania_2016.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Lake_Koman_Albania_2016.jpg/220px-Lake_Koman_Albania_2016.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Lake_Koman_Albania_2016.jpg/330px-Lake_Koman_Albania_2016.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Lake_Koman_Albania_2016.jpg/440px-Lake_Koman_Albania_2016.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4288" data-file-height="2848" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Lake_Koman_Albania_2016.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The narrow gorges and high rocks of <a href="/wiki/Lake_Koman" title="Lake Koman">Lake of Koman</a>, within the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a>, remind sometimes of the Scandinavian <a href="/wiki/Fjord" title="Fjord">fjords</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The increase of foreign visitors has been dramatic. Albania had only 500,000 visitors in 2005, while in 2012 had an estimated 4.2&#160;million, an increase of 740 percent in only 7 years. In 2015, tourism in summer increased by 25 percent in contrast the previous year according to the country's tourism agency.<sup id="cite_ref-196" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-196">&#91;195&#93;</a></sup> In 2011, <a href="/wiki/Lonely_Planet" title="Lonely Planet">Lonely Planet</a> named as a top travel destination,<sup id="cite_ref-Lonely_Planet&#39;s_top_10_197-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lonely_Planet&#39;s_top_10-197">&#91;196&#93;</a></sup><sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability" title="Wikipedia:Verifiability"><span title="How could a 2011 article talk about 2015? anyway link needs updating (November 2017)">failed verification</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> while <a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a> placed Albania as number 4 global touristic destination in 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-198" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-198">&#91;197&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The bulk of the tourist industry is concentrated along the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic" class="mw-redirect" title="Adriatic">Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ionian_Sea" title="Ionian Sea">Ionian Sea</a> in the west of the country. However, the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Riviera" title="Albanian Riviera">Albanian Riviera</a> in the southwest has the most scenic and pristine beaches, and is often called the pearl of the Albanian coast. Its coastline has a considerable length of 446 kilometres (277 miles).<sup id="cite_ref-199" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-199">&#91;198&#93;</a></sup> The coast has a particular character because it is rich in varieties of virgin beaches, capes, coves, covered bays, lagoons, small gravel beaches, sea caves and many landforms. Some parts of this seaside are very clean ecologically, which represent in this prospective unexplored areas, which are very rare within the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean" class="mw-redirect" title="Mediterranean">Mediterranean</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-200" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-200">&#91;199&#93;</a></sup> Other attractions include the mountainous areas such as the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ceraunian_Mountains" title="Ceraunian Mountains">Ceraunian Mountains</a> and <a href="/wiki/Korab" title="Korab">Korab Mountains</a> but also the historical cities of <a href="/wiki/Berat" title="Berat">Berat</a>, <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gjirokast%C3%ABr" title="Gjirokastër">Gjirokastër</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sarand%C3%AB" title="Sarandë">Sarandë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Shkod%C3%ABr" title="Shkodër">Shkodër</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="Korçë">Korçë</a>.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Transport">Transport</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Transport_in_Albania" title="Transport in Albania">Transport in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Mali_i_Gjallices_nga_Kalimashi.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Mali_i_Gjallices_nga_Kalimashi.jpg/220px-Mali_i_Gjallices_nga_Kalimashi.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="87" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Mali_i_Gjallices_nga_Kalimashi.jpg/330px-Mali_i_Gjallices_nga_Kalimashi.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Mali_i_Gjallices_nga_Kalimashi.jpg/440px-Mali_i_Gjallices_nga_Kalimashi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="7174" data-file-height="2835" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Mali_i_Gjallices_nga_Kalimashi.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/A1_(Albania)" class="mw-redirect" title="A1 (Albania)">A1</a> connects the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> in the southwest with the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Alps" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Alps">Albanian Alps</a> in the northeast.</div></div></div>
<p>Transportation in Albania has undergone significant changes and improvements in the past two decades. Continual improvements to the <a href="/wiki/Public_transport" title="Public transport">public transport</a>, road and rail <a href="/wiki/Infrastructure" title="Infrastructure">infrastructure</a>, water and <a href="/wiki/Air_travel" title="Air travel">air travel</a> have all led to a vast enhancement in transportation.
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Tirana_International_Airport_N%C3%ABn%C3%AB_Tereza" title="Tirana International Airport Nënë Tereza">international airport</a> of <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> serves as the premier gateway to the country and carries almost 2.5 million passengers per year with connections to many destinations in other countries around <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-201" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-201">&#91;200&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-202" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-202">&#91;201&#93;</a></sup> The country plans to progressively increase the number of airports especially in the south with possible locations in <a href="/wiki/Sarand%C3%AB" title="Sarandë">Sarandë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gjirokast%C3%ABr" title="Gjirokastër">Gjirokastër</a> and <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB_International_Airport" title="Vlorë International Airport">Vlorë</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-203" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-203">&#91;202&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Terminal_jashte.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Terminal_jashte.jpg/220px-Terminal_jashte.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Terminal_jashte.jpg/330px-Terminal_jashte.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Terminal_jashte.jpg/440px-Terminal_jashte.jpg 2x" data-file-width="583" data-file-height="389" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Terminal_jashte.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Tirana_International_Airport" class="mw-redirect" title="Tirana International Airport">Tirana International Airport</a> is named in honour of the Albanian nun and missionary <a href="/wiki/Mother_Teresa" title="Mother Teresa">Mother Teresa</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Highways_in_Albania" title="Highways in Albania">highways</a> and <a href="/wiki/Motorways_in_Albania" title="Motorways in Albania">motorways in Albania</a> are properly maintained and often still under construction. The <a href="/wiki/A1_motorway_(Albania)" class="mw-redirect" title="A1 motorway (Albania)">A1</a> represents a major transportation corridor in Albania and the longest motorway of the country. It will prospectively link <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a> on the Adriatic Sea across <a href="/wiki/Pristina" title="Pristina">Pristina</a> in <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a> with the <a href="/wiki/Pan-European_Corridor_X" title="Pan-European Corridor X">Pan-European Corridor X</a> in Serbia.<sup id="cite_ref-SEETO_204-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SEETO-204">&#91;203&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-205" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-205">&#91;204&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/A2_motorway_(Albania)" class="mw-redirect" title="A2 motorway (Albania)">A2</a> is part of the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic%E2%80%93Ionian_motorway" title="Adriatic–Ionian motorway">Adriatic–Ionian Corridor</a> as well as the <a href="/wiki/Pan-European_Corridor_VIII" title="Pan-European Corridor VIII">Pan-European Corridor VIII</a> and connects <a href="/wiki/Fier" title="Fier">Fier</a> with <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB" title="Vlorë">Vlorë</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-SEETO_204-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SEETO-204">&#91;203&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/A3_motorway_(Albania)" class="mw-redirect" title="A3 motorway (Albania)">A3</a> is currently under construction and will connect, after its completion, <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> and <a href="/wiki/Elbasan" title="Elbasan">Elbasan</a> with the Pan-European Corridor VIII. When all three corridors are completed, Albania will have an estimated 759 kilometres (472&#160;mi) of highway linking it with all of its neighboring countries.
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg/220px-Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="78" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg/330px-Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg/440px-Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2048" data-file-height="729" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Panorama_of_Durres_Port.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The highly advantageous location of <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a> makes <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Durr%C3%ABs" title="Port of Durrës">its port</a> the busiest in Albania and among the largest in the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a>.</div></div></div>
<p><a href="/wiki/Port_of_Durr%C3%ABs" title="Port of Durrës">Durrës</a> is the busiest and largest <a href="/wiki/Seaport" class="mw-redirect" title="Seaport">seaport</a> in the country followed by <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Vlor%C3%AB" title="Port of Vlorë">Vlorë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Sh%C3%ABngjin" title="Port of Shëngjin">Shëngjin</a> and <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Sarand%C3%AB" title="Port of Sarandë">Sarandë</a>. As of 2014<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Albania&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup>, it is as one of the largest passenger ports on the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> with annual passenger volume of approximately 1.5 million. The principal ports serve a system of ferries connecting numerous islands and coastal cities in Croatia, Greece and Italy.
</p><p>The rail network is administered by the national railway company <a href="/wiki/Hekurudha_Shqiptare" title="Hekurudha Shqiptare">Hekurudha Shqiptare</a> which was extensively promoted by the dictator <a href="/wiki/Enver_Hoxha" title="Enver Hoxha">Enver Hoxha</a>. There has been a considerable increase in private car ownership and bus usage while rail use decreased since the end of communism. However, a new railway line from Tirana and its airport to Durrës is currently planned. The specific location of this railway, connecting the most populated urban areas in Albania, merely makes it an important economic development project.<sup id="cite_ref-206" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-206">&#91;205&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-207" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-207">&#91;206&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Infrastructure">Infrastructure</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Education">Education</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Education_in_Albania" title="Education in Albania">Education in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg/220px-Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg/330px-Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg/440px-Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2227" data-file-height="1479" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Akademia_e_arteve_Ergys_Veliu_Photography.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/University_of_Arts_(Albania)" title="University of Arts (Albania)">University of Arts</a> is the largest higher education institute dedicated to the study of <a href="/wiki/Arts" class="mw-redirect" title="Arts">arts</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>In the country, <a href="/wiki/Education" title="Education">education</a> is <a href="/wiki/Secular" class="mw-redirect" title="Secular">secular</a>, free, <a href="/wiki/Compulsory_education" title="Compulsory education">compulsory</a> and based on three levels of education which is segmented in <a href="/wiki/Primary_education" title="Primary education">primary</a>, <a href="/wiki/Secondary_education" title="Secondary education">secondary</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tertiary_education" title="Tertiary education">tertiary education</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Official_208-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Official-208">&#91;207&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Epnuffic_209-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Epnuffic-209">&#91;208&#93;</a></sup> The academic year is apportioned into two semesters beginning in September or October and ending in June or July. The use of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a> serves as the <a href="/wiki/Primary_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Primary language">primary language</a> of instruction in all <a href="/wiki/State_school" title="State school">academic institutions</a> across the country.<sup id="cite_ref-Epnuffic_209-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Epnuffic-209">&#91;208&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Compulsory primary education is divided into two levels, <a href="/wiki/Elementary_education" class="mw-redirect" title="Elementary education">elementary</a> and <a href="/wiki/Secondary_education" title="Secondary education">secondary</a> school, from grade one to five and six to nine, respectively.<sup id="cite_ref-Official_208-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Official-208">&#91;207&#93;</a></sup> Pupils are required to attend <a href="/wiki/School" title="School">school</a> from the age of six until they turn 16. Upon successful completion of primary education, all pupils are entitled to attend <a href="/wiki/High_schools" class="mw-redirect" title="High schools">high schools</a> with specializing in any particular field including <a href="/wiki/Arts" class="mw-redirect" title="Arts">arts</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sport" title="Sport">sports</a>, <a href="/wiki/Language" title="Language">languages</a>, <a href="/wiki/Science" title="Science">sciences</a> or <a href="/wiki/Technology" title="Technology">technology</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Official_208-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Official-208">&#91;207&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The country's tertiary education, an optional stage of formal learning following secondary education, has undergone a thorough reformation and restructuring in compliance with the principles of the <a href="/wiki/Bologna_Process" title="Bologna Process">Bologna Process</a>. There is a significant number of private and public <a href="/wiki/Institutions_of_higher_education" class="mw-redirect" title="Institutions of higher education">institutions of higher education</a> well dispersed in the major cities of Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-210" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-210">&#91;209&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Epnuffic_209-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Epnuffic-209">&#91;208&#93;</a></sup> Studies in tertiary education are organized at three successive levels which include the <a href="/wiki/Bachelor%27s_degree" title="Bachelor&#39;s degree">bachelor</a>, <a href="/wiki/Master%27s_degree" title="Master&#39;s degree">master</a> and <a href="/wiki/Doctorate_Degree" class="mw-redirect" title="Doctorate Degree">doctorate</a>.
</p><p>The study of a first <a href="/wiki/Foreign_language" title="Foreign language">foreign language</a> is mandatory and are taught most often at elementary and <a href="/wiki/Bilingual_school" class="mw-redirect" title="Bilingual school">bilingual schools</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-foreign_languages_211-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-foreign_languages-211">&#91;210&#93;</a></sup> The languages taught in schools are <a href="/wiki/English_language" title="English language">English</a>, <a href="/wiki/Italian_language" title="Italian language">Italian</a>, <a href="/wiki/French_language" title="French language">French</a> and <a href="/wiki/German_language" title="German language">German</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-foreign_languages_211-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-foreign_languages-211">&#91;210&#93;</a></sup> The country has a <a href="/wiki/School_life_expectancy" title="School life expectancy">school life expectancy</a> of 16 years and a <a href="/wiki/Literacy_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="Literacy rate">literacy rate</a> of 98.7%, with 99.2% for males and 98.3% for females.<sup id="cite_ref-212" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-212">&#91;211&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-cia_8-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cia-8">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup> 
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Energy">Energy</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Renewable_energy_in_Albania" title="Renewable energy in Albania">Renewable energy</a> and <a href="/wiki/List_of_oil_and_gas_fields_in_Albania" title="List of oil and gas fields in Albania">Oil fields in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bb/Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg/220px-Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="62" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bb/Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg/330px-Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bb/Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg/440px-Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg 2x" data-file-width="10368" data-file-height="2936" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Lake_komani_2016_Albania.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Lake_Koman" title="Lake Koman">Lake Koman</a> was formed as a result of the construction of the <a href="/wiki/Koman_Hydroelectric_Power_Station" title="Koman Hydroelectric Power Station">Koman Hydroelectric Power Station</a> in 1985.</div></div></div>
<p>Albania is mostly dependent on <a href="/wiki/Hydroelectricity" title="Hydroelectricity">hydroelectricity</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-213" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-213">&#91;212&#93;</a></sup> Almost 94.8% of the country's electricity consumption comes from hydroelectrical stations and ranks 7th  in the world by percentage.<sup id="cite_ref-CIAAlbania_214-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CIAAlbania-214">&#91;213&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-215" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-215">&#91;214&#93;</a></sup> There are six hydroelectric power stations, including <a href="/wiki/Fierza_Hydroelectric_Power_Station" class="mw-redirect" title="Fierza Hydroelectric Power Station">Fierza</a>, <a href="/wiki/Koman_Hydroelectric_Power_Station" title="Koman Hydroelectric Power Station">Koman</a>, <a href="/wiki/Skavica_Hydro_Power_Plant" title="Skavica Hydro Power Plant">Skavica</a> and <a href="/wiki/Vau_i_Dej%C3%ABs_Hydroelectric_Power_Station" title="Vau i Dejës Hydroelectric Power Station">Vau i Dejës</a> situated within the <a href="/wiki/Drin_(river)" class="mw-redirect" title="Drin (river)">Drin River</a>. Further, there are two stations under construction, namely <a href="/wiki/Banj%C3%AB_Hydro_Power_Plant" title="Banjë Hydro Power Plant">Banjë</a> and <a href="/wiki/Moglic%C3%AB_Hydro_Power_Plant" title="Moglicë Hydro Power Plant">Moglicë</a> located in the <a href="/wiki/Devoll_(river)" title="Devoll (river)">Devoll River</a>. Both are expected to be completed between 2016 and 2018.
</p><p>Albania has considerably large deposits of <a href="/wiki/Oil" title="Oil">oil</a>. It has the 10th largest oil reserves in <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">europe</a> and the 58th in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-216" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-216">&#91;215&#93;</a></sup> The country's main petroleum deposits are located around the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast</a> and <a href="/wiki/Myzeqe" title="Myzeqe">Myzeqe Plain</a> within the <a href="/wiki/Western_Lowlands" title="Western Lowlands">Western Lowlands</a>, where the country's largest reserve is located. Although, <a href="/wiki/Patos-Marinza_Oil_Field" title="Patos-Marinza Oil Field">Patos-Marinza</a>, also located within the area, is the largest onshore <a href="/wiki/Oil_field" class="mw-redirect" title="Oil field">oil field</a> in Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-217" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-217">&#91;216&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In 2015, 498 kilometres (309&#160;mi) of <a href="/wiki/Natural_gas" title="Natural gas">natural gas</a> pipelines and 249 kilometres (155&#160;mi) of <a href="/wiki/Oil" title="Oil">oil</a> pipelines spanned the country's territory.<sup id="cite_ref-CIAAlbania_214-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CIAAlbania-214">&#91;213&#93;</a></sup> The planned <a href="/wiki/Trans_Adriatic_Pipeline" title="Trans Adriatic Pipeline">Trans Adriatic Pipeline</a>, a major trans <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> gas pipeline, will delivers natural gas from <a href="/wiki/Azerbaijan" title="Azerbaijan">Azerbaijan</a> to Albania and <a href="/wiki/Western_Europe" title="Western Europe">Western Europe</a> through <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a> and will be completed in 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-218" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-218">&#91;217&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Further, Albania and <a href="/wiki/Croatia" title="Croatia">Croatia</a> have discussed the possibility of jointly building a <a href="/wiki/Nuclear_power_plant" title="Nuclear power plant">nuclear power plant</a> at <a href="/wiki/Lake_Shkod%C3%ABr" class="mw-redirect" title="Lake Shkodër">Lake Shkodër</a>, close to the <a href="/wiki/Border_crossings_of_Albania" title="Border crossings of Albania">border</a> with <a href="/wiki/Montenegro" title="Montenegro">Montenegro</a>, a plan that has gathered criticism from Montenegro due to seismicity in the area.<sup id="cite_ref-219" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-219">&#91;218&#93;</a></sup> In 2009, the company <a href="/wiki/Enel" title="Enel">Enel</a> announced plans to build an 800 MW <a href="/wiki/Coal_Fired_Power_Plant" class="mw-redirect" title="Coal Fired Power Plant">coal-fired power plant</a> in the country, to diversify electricity sources.<sup id="cite_ref-diversify_220-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-diversify-220">&#91;219&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Technology_and_media">Technology and media</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Science_and_technology_in_Albania" title="Science and technology in Albania">Science and technology</a> and <a href="/wiki/Media_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Media in Albania">Media in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Skeda-Ahmet-Zogu.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/Skeda-Ahmet-Zogu.jpg/220px-Skeda-Ahmet-Zogu.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="159" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/Skeda-Ahmet-Zogu.jpg/330px-Skeda-Ahmet-Zogu.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/Skeda-Ahmet-Zogu.jpg/440px-Skeda-Ahmet-Zogu.jpg 2x" data-file-width="604" data-file-height="437" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Skeda-Ahmet-Zogu.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>In 1938, <a href="/wiki/Zog_I_of_Albania" title="Zog I of Albania">King Zog</a> and <a href="/wiki/Geraldine_of_Albania" title="Geraldine of Albania">Queen Geraldine</a> launched <a href="/wiki/RTSH" class="mw-redirect" title="RTSH">Radio Televizioni Shqiptar</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>With the political and economic <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">changings</a> in 1993, human resources in <a href="/wiki/Science" title="Science">sciences</a> and <a href="/wiki/Technology" title="Technology">technology</a> have drastically decreased. As of various reports, during 1991 to 2005 approximately 50% of the professors and scientists of the universities and science institutions in the country have left Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-dfid_221-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dfid-221">&#91;220&#93;</a></sup> In 2009, the <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Government of Albania">government</a> approved the National Strategy for Science, Technology and Innovation in Albania covering the period 2009 to 2015.<sup id="cite_ref-222" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-222">&#91;221&#93;</a></sup> It aims to triple public spending on <a href="/wiki/Research_and_development" title="Research and development">research and development</a> to 0.6% of <a href="/wiki/GDP" class="mw-redirect" title="GDP">GDP</a> and augment the share of <a href="/wiki/Gross_domestic_expenditure_on_R%26D" class="mw-redirect" title="Gross domestic expenditure on R&amp;D">GDE</a> from foreign sources, including the framework programmes for research of the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>, to the point where it covers 40% of research spending, among others.
</p><p>Albania has an estimated 257 media outlets, including 66 <a href="/wiki/Radio_station" class="mw-redirect" title="Radio station">radio stations</a> and 67 <a href="/wiki/Television_station" title="Television station">television stations</a>, with 65 national and more than 50 cable television stations. Radio began officially in 1938 with the founding of <a href="/wiki/RTSH" class="mw-redirect" title="RTSH">Radio Televizioni Shqiptar</a>, while television broadcasting began in 1960. 4 regional radio stations serve in the four extremities of the country. The international service broadcasts radio programmes in <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a> including seven other languages through <a href="/wiki/Medium_wave" title="Medium wave">medium wave</a> and <a href="/wiki/Short_wave" class="mw-redirect" title="Short wave">short wave</a>, using the theme from the song "Keputa një gjethe dafine" as its <a href="/wiki/Signature_tune" class="mw-redirect" title="Signature tune">signature tune</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-223" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-223">&#91;222&#93;</a></sup> The international television service through <a href="/wiki/Satellite" title="Satellite">satellite</a> was launched since 1993 and aims at <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a> communities in the neighboring countries and the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_diaspora" title="Albanian diaspora">Albanian diaspora</a>. Nowadays, the country has organized several shows as a part of worldwide series like <i><a href="/wiki/Dancing_with_the_Stars" title="Dancing with the Stars">Dancing with the Stars</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Big_Brother_Albania" title="Big Brother Albania">Big Brother</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Albanians_Got_Talent" title="Albanians Got Talent">Got Talent</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/The_Voice_of_Albania" title="The Voice of Albania">The Voice</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/X_Factor_(Albanian_TV_series)" title="X Factor (Albanian TV series)">X Factor</a></i>.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Health">Health</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Health_in_Albania" title="Health in Albania">Health in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg/220px-Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg/330px-Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg/440px-Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1920" data-file-height="1271" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Olive-oil-1412361_1920.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_cuisine" title="Albanian cuisine">Albanian cuisine</a> from the Mediterranean, which is characterized by the use of <a href="/wiki/Fruit" title="Fruit">fruits</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vegetable" title="Vegetable">vegetables</a> and <a href="/wiki/Olive_oil" title="Olive oil">olive oil</a>, contributes to the good nutrition of the country's population.<sup id="cite_ref-224" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-224">&#91;223&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Albania" title="Constitution of Albania">constitution of Albania</a> guarantees equal, free and <a href="/wiki/Universal_health_care" title="Universal health care">universal health care</a> for all its citizens.<sup id="cite_ref-225" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-225">&#91;224&#93;</a></sup> The health care system of the country is currently organized in three levels, among others <a href="/wiki/Primary_healthcare" title="Primary healthcare">primary</a>, <a href="/wiki/Secondary_care" class="mw-redirect" title="Secondary care">secondary</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tertiary_healthcare" class="mw-redirect" title="Tertiary healthcare">tertiary</a> healthcare, and is in a process of modernisation and development.<sup id="cite_ref-cod_226-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cod-226">&#91;225&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-hospitals_227-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-hospitals-227">&#91;226&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Life_expectancy" title="Life expectancy">life expectancy</a> at birth in Albania is at 77.8 years and ranks <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_life_expectancy" title="List of countries by life expectancy">37th</a> in the world outperforming several <a href="/wiki/Developed_countries" class="mw-redirect" title="Developed countries">developed countries</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-228" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-228">&#91;227&#93;</a></sup> The average <a href="/wiki/Life_expectancy#Healthy_life_expectancy" title="Life expectancy">healthy life expectancy</a> is at 68.8 years and ranks as well 37th in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-229" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-229">&#91;228&#93;</a></sup> The country's <a href="/wiki/Infant_mortality_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="Infant mortality rate">infant mortality rate</a> is estimated at 12 per 1,000 live births in 2015. In 2000, the country had the 55th <a href="/wiki/World_Health_Organization_ranking_of_health_systems_in_2000" title="World Health Organization ranking of health systems in 2000">best healthcare performance</a> in the world, as defined by the <a href="/wiki/World_Health_Organization" title="World Health Organization">World Health Organization</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-230" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-230">&#91;229&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Cardiovascular_disease" title="Cardiovascular disease">Cardiovascular disease</a> remain the principal cause of death in the country accounting 52% of total deaths.<sup id="cite_ref-cod_226-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cod-226">&#91;225&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Accident" title="Accident">Accidents</a>, <a href="/wiki/Injuries" class="mw-redirect" title="Injuries">injuries</a>, <a href="/wiki/Malignant_disease" class="mw-redirect" title="Malignant disease">malignant</a> and <a href="/wiki/Respiratory_disease" title="Respiratory disease">respiratory diseases</a> are other primary causes of death.<sup id="cite_ref-cod_226-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cod-226">&#91;225&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Neuropsychiatric_disorders" class="mw-redirect" title="Neuropsychiatric disorders">Neuropsychiatric disease</a> has also increased due to recent demographic, social and economic changes in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-cod_226-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cod-226">&#91;225&#93;</a></sup>  
</p><p>In 2009, the country had a <a href="/wiki/Fruit" title="Fruit">fruit</a> and <a href="/wiki/Vegetable" title="Vegetable">vegetable</a> supply of 886 grams per capita per day, the fifth highest supply in Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-231" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-231">&#91;230&#93;</a></sup> In comparison to other developed and developing countries, Albania has a relatively low rate of <a href="/wiki/Obesity" title="Obesity">obesity</a> probably thanks to the health benefits of the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_diet" title="Mediterranean diet">Mediterranean diet</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-232" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-232">&#91;231&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-233" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-233">&#91;232&#93;</a></sup> According to <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_Body_Mass_Index_(BMI)#WHO_Data_on_Prevalence_of_Obesity_(BMI_above_30)_(2014)" class="mw-redirect" title="List of countries by Body Mass Index (BMI)">World Health Organisation data from 2016</a>, 21.7% of adults in the country are clinically <a href="/wiki/Obesity" title="Obesity">obese</a>, with a <a href="/wiki/Body_mass_index" title="Body mass index">Body Mass Index</a> (BMI) score of 25 or more.<sup id="cite_ref-234" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-234">&#91;233&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Demography">Demography</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Albania" title="Demographics of Albania">Demographics of Albania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian people">Albanian people</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Albania_demography.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Albania_demography.svg/220px-Albania_demography.svg.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="132" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Albania_demography.svg/330px-Albania_demography.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Albania_demography.svg/440px-Albania_demography.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="750" data-file-height="450" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Albania_demography.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Albania" title="Demographics of Albania">Albanian population</a> development in the last sixty years</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Albania" title="Demographics of Albania">population</a> of Albania, as defined by <a href="/wiki/Institute_of_Statistics_(Albania)" title="Institute of Statistics (Albania)">Institute of Statistics</a>, was estimated in 2016 to be approximately 2,886,026.<sup id="cite_ref-235" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-235">&#91;234&#93;</a></sup> The country's <a href="/wiki/Total_fertility_rate" title="Total fertility rate">total fertility rate</a> of 1.51 children born per woman is one of the <a href="/wiki/List_of_sovereign_states_and_dependent_territories_by_fertility_rate" class="mw-redirect" title="List of sovereign states and dependent territories by fertility rate">lowest in the world</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-CIA_demography_236-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CIA_demography-236">&#91;235&#93;</a></sup> Its <a href="/wiki/List_of_sovereign_states_and_dependent_territories_by_population_density" class="mw-redirect" title="List of sovereign states and dependent territories by population density">population density</a> stands at 259 inhabitants per square kilometre. The overall <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_life_expectancy" title="List of countries by life expectancy">life expectancy</a> at birth is 78.5 years; 75.8 years for males and 81.4 years for females.<sup id="cite_ref-CIA_demography_236-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CIA_demography-236">&#91;235&#93;</a></sup> The country is the <a href="/wiki/Balkans#Demographics" title="Balkans">8th most populous country</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Balkans" title="Balkans">Balkans</a> and ranks as the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_population" title="List of countries and dependencies by population">137th most populous country</a> in the world. The population of the country rose steadily from 2,5 million in 1979 until 1989, when it peaked at 3.1 million.<sup id="cite_ref-237" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-237">&#91;236&#93;</a></sup> It is forecasted that the population should not reach its peak number of 1989 until 2031, depending on the actual <a href="/wiki/Birth_rate" title="Birth rate">birth rate</a> and the level of <a href="/wiki/Net_migration_rate" title="Net migration rate">net migration</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-238" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-238">&#91;237&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The explanation for the recent population decrease is the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">fall of communism in Albania</a>. It was marked by large economic <a href="/wiki/Mass_migration" title="Mass migration">mass emigration</a> from Albania to <a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greece</a>, <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a> and the <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a>. 40 years of <a href="/wiki/Communism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Communism in Albania">isolation</a> from the world, combined with its disastrous economic, social and political situation, had caused this exodus. The <a href="/wiki/Human_migration" title="Human migration">external migration</a> was prohibited outright during the communist era, while <a href="/wiki/Human_migration" title="Human migration">internal migration</a> was quite limited, hence this was a new phenomenon. At least, 900,000 people left Albania during this period, about 600,000 of them settling in Greece.<sup id="cite_ref-239" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-239">&#91;238&#93;</a></sup> The migration affected the country's internal population distribution. It decreased particularly in the north and south, while it increased in the center within the cities of <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (March 2009)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> According to the <a href="/wiki/Institute_of_Statistics_(Albania)" title="Institute of Statistics (Albania)">Institute of Statistics (INSTAT)</a> as of 1&#160;January&#160;2015<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Albania&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup>, the population of Albania is 2,893,005.<sup id="cite_ref-Statistics_240-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Statistics-240">&#91;239&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>About 53.4% of the country's <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Albania" title="Demographics of Albania">population</a> is living in cities. The three largest counties by population account for half of the total population. Almost 30% of the total population is found in <a href="/wiki/Tirana_County" title="Tirana County">Tirana County</a> followed by <a href="/wiki/Fier_County" title="Fier County">Fier County</a> with 11% and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_County" title="Durrës County">Durrës County</a> with 10%.<sup id="cite_ref-241" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-241">&#91;240&#93;</a></sup> Over 1 million people are concentrated in <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, making it the largest urban area in Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-242" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-242">&#91;241&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> is one of largest cities in the <a href="/wiki/Balkan_Peninsula" class="mw-redirect" title="Balkan Peninsula">Balkan Peninsula</a> and ranks 7th with a population about 800,000.<sup id="cite_ref-census15_243-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-census15-243">&#91;242&#93;</a></sup>
The second largest city in the country by population is <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, with a population of 201.110, followed by <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB" title="Vlorë">Vlorë</a> with a population of 141.513.
</p>
<table class="infobox" style="text-align:left; width:97%; margin-right:10px; font-size:90%">

<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Minorities">Minorities</span></h3>
<p>Issues of ethnicity are a delicate topic and subject to debate. Contrary to official statistics that show an over 97 per cent Albanian majority in the country, minority groups (such as <a href="/wiki/Greeks_in_Albania" title="Greeks in Albania">Greeks</a>, <a href="/wiki/Macedonians_in_Albania" title="Macedonians in Albania">Macedonians</a>, <a href="/wiki/Montenegrins_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Montenegrins of Albania">Montenegrins</a>, <a href="/wiki/Roma_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Roma in Albania">Roma</a> and <a href="/wiki/Aromanians_in_Albania" title="Aromanians in Albania">Aromanians</a>) have frequently disputed the official numbers, asserting a higher percentage of the country's population. According to the disputed 2011 census, ethnic affiliation was as follows: <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> 2,312,356 (82.6% of the total), <a href="/wiki/Greeks_in_Albania" title="Greeks in Albania">Greeks</a> 24,243 (0.9%), <a href="/wiki/Macedonians_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Macedonians of Albania">Macedonians</a> 5,512 (0.2%), <a href="/wiki/Montenegrins_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Montenegrins of Albania">Montenegrins</a> 366 (0.01%), <a href="/wiki/Aromanians" title="Aromanians">Aromanians</a> 8,266 (0.30%), <a href="/wiki/Romani_people" title="Romani people">Romani</a> 8,301 (0.3%), <a href="/wiki/Balkan_Egyptians" class="mw-redirect" title="Balkan Egyptians">Balkan Egyptians</a> 3,368 (0.1%), other ethnicities 2,644 (0.1%), no declared ethnicity 390,938 (14.0%), and not relevant 44,144 (1.6%).<sup id="cite_ref-Population_and_Housing_Census_2011_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Population_and_Housing_Census_2011-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup> On the quality of the specific data the Advisory Committee on the <a href="/wiki/Framework_Convention_for_the_Protection_of_National_Minorities" title="Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities">Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities</a> stated that "the results of the census should be viewed with the utmost caution and calls on the authorities not to rely exclusively on the data on nationality collected during the census in determining its policy on the protection of national minorities.".<sup id="cite_ref-245" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-245">&#91;244&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Albania recognizes nine national or cultural minorities: <a href="/wiki/Greeks" title="Greeks">Greek</a>, <a href="/wiki/Macedonians_(ethnic_group)" title="Macedonians (ethnic group)">Macedonian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vlachs" title="Vlachs">Wallachian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Montenegrins" title="Montenegrins">Montenegrin</a>, <a href="/wiki/Serbs" title="Serbs">Serb</a>, <a href="/wiki/Romani_people" title="Romani people">Roma</a>, <a href="/wiki/Egyptians_(Balkans)" class="mw-redirect" title="Egyptians (Balkans)">Egyptian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bosnians" title="Bosnians">Bosnian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bulgarians" title="Bulgarians">Bulgarian</a> peoples.<sup id="cite_ref-246" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-246">&#91;245&#93;</a></sup> Other Albanian minorities are <a href="/wiki/Gorani_people" title="Gorani people">Gorani</a>, <a href="/wiki/Aromanians" title="Aromanians">Aromanians</a> and <a href="/wiki/Jew" class="mw-redirect" title="Jew">Jews</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-247" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-247">&#91;246&#93;</a></sup> Regarding the Greeks, "it is difficult to know how many Greeks there are in Albania". The estimates vary between 60,000 and 300,000 ethnic Greeks in Albania. According to Ian Jeffries, most of Western sources put the number at around 200,000. The 300,000 mark is supported by Greek government as well.<sup id="cite_ref-RFE/RL_Research_Report:_Weekly_Analyses_from_the_RFE/RL_Research_Institute_248-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RFE/RL_Research_Report:_Weekly_Analyses_from_the_RFE/RL_Research_Institute-248">&#91;247&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BideleuxJeffries2006_249-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BideleuxJeffries2006-249">&#91;248&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ramet1998_250-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ramet1998-250">&#91;249&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Jeffries2002_251-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jeffries2002-251">&#91;250&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Publications2008_252-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Publications2008-252">&#91;251&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/CIA_World_Factbook" class="mw-redirect" title="CIA World Factbook">CIA World Factbook</a> estimates the Greek minority at 0.9%<sup id="cite_ref-253" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-253">&#91;252&#93;</a></sup> of the total population. The US State Department uses 1.17% for Greeks and 0.23% for other minorities.<sup id="cite_ref-254" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-254">&#91;253&#93;</a></sup> The latter questions the validity of the census data about the Greek minority, due to the fact that measurements have been affected by boycott.<sup id="cite_ref-255" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-255">&#91;254&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Macedonian and some Greek minority groups have sharply criticized Article 20 of the Census law, according to which a $1,000 fine will be imposed on anyone who will declare an ethnicity other than what is stated on his or her birth certificate. This is claimed to be an attempt to intimidate minorities into declaring Albanian ethnicity, according to them the Albanian government has stated that it will jail anyone who does not participate in the census or refuse to declare his or her ethnicity.<sup id="cite_ref-256" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-256">&#91;255&#93;</a></sup> Genc Pollo, the minister in charge has declared that: "Albanian citizens will be able to freely express their ethnic and religious affiliation and mother tongue. However, they are not forced to answer these sensitive questions".<sup id="cite_ref-257" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-257">&#91;256&#93;</a></sup> The amendments criticized do not include jailing or forced declaration of ethnicity or religion; only a fine is envisioned which can be overthrown by court.<sup id="cite_ref-258" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-258">&#91;257&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-259" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-259">&#91;258&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Greek representatives form part of the Albanian parliament and the government has invited Albanian Greeks to register, as the only way to improve their status.<sup id="cite_ref-EUDO_260-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-EUDO-260">&#91;259&#93;</a></sup> On the other hand, nationalists, various organizations and political parties in Albania have expressed their concern that the census might artificially increase the numbers of the Greek minority, which might be then exploited by Greece to threaten Albania's territorial integrity.<sup id="cite_ref-EUDO_260-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-EUDO-260">&#91;259&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Maria_Karathanos,_Constantine_Callaghan_261-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Maria_Karathanos,_Constantine_Callaghan-261">&#91;260&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-262" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-262">&#91;261&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BalkanChronicle_263-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BalkanChronicle-263">&#91;262&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-264" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-264">&#91;263&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-265" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-265">&#91;264&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-266" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-266">&#91;265&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r889293853/mw-parser-output/.tmulti">.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbinner{display:flex;flex-direction:column}.mw-parser-output .tmulti <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Language">Language</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a> and <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_Albania" title="Languages of Albania">Languages of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:202px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Dialect_map_albania.png" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Dialect_map_albania.png/200px-Dialect_map_albania.png" decoding="async" width="200" height="362" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Dialect_map_albania.png/300px-Dialect_map_albania.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Dialect_map_albania.png/400px-Dialect_map_albania.png 2x" data-file-width="447" data-file-height="808" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Dialect_map_albania.png" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The dialects of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a>.</div></div></div>
<p><a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a> is the official language of the Republic of Albania. Its standard spoken and written form is revised and merged from the two main dialects, <a href="/wiki/Gheg" class="mw-redirect" title="Gheg">Gheg</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tosk_Albanian" title="Tosk Albanian">Tosk</a>, though it is notably based more on the Tosk dialect. The <a href="/wiki/Shkumbin" title="Shkumbin">Shkumbin</a> river is the rough dividing line between the two dialects. Also a <a href="/wiki/Greeks_in_Albania#Language" title="Greeks in Albania">dialect of Greek</a> that preserves features now lost in standard <a href="/wiki/Modern_Greek" title="Modern Greek">modern Greek</a> is spoken in areas inhabited by the <a href="/wiki/Greek_minority_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Greek minority in Albania">Greek minority</a>. Other languages spoken by ethnic minorities in Albania include <a href="/wiki/Aromanian_language" title="Aromanian language">Aromanian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Serbian_language" title="Serbian language">Serbian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Macedonian_language" title="Macedonian language">Macedonian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bosnian_language" title="Bosnian language">Bosnian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bulgarian_language" title="Bulgarian language">Bulgarian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gora_dialect" title="Gora dialect">Gorani</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Romani_language" title="Romani language">Roma</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-267" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-267">&#91;266&#93;</a></sup> Macedonian is official in the Pustec Municipality in East Albania. According to the 2011 population census, 2,765,610 or 98.767% of the population declared <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a> as their mother tongue (<i>mother tongue is defined as the first or main language spoken at home during childhood</i>).<sup id="cite_ref-Population_and_Housing_Census_2011_2-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Population_and_Housing_Census_2011-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Greek_language" title="Greek language">Greek</a> is the second most-spoken language in the country, with 0.5 to 3% of the population speaking it as first language,<sup id="cite_ref-268" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-268">&#91;267&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-SecondMostSpokenLanguage_269-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SecondMostSpokenLanguage-269">&#91;268&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-kathimerini_270-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kathimerini-270">&#91;269&#93;</a></sup> and with two-thirds of mainly Albanian families having at least one member that speaks Greek, most having learned it in the post communist era (1992–present) due to private schools or migration to Greece.<sup id="cite_ref-kathimerini_270-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kathimerini-270">&#91;269&#93;</a></sup> Outside of the small designated "minority area" in the south the teaching of Greek was banned during the communist era.<sup id="cite_ref-271" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-271">&#91;270&#93;</a></sup> As of 2003 Greek is offered at over 100 private tutoring centers all over Albania and at a private school in Tirana, the first of its kind outside Greece.<sup id="cite_ref-kathimerini_270-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kathimerini-270">&#91;269&#93;</a></sup> <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r889293853/mw-parser-output/.tmulti"/></p><div class="thumb tmulti tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:204px;max-width:204px"><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:202px;max-width:202px"><div class="thumbimage"><a href="/wiki/File:Pustec_Multilingual_Road_Signs.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Pustec_Multilingual_Road_Signs.jpg/200px-Pustec_Multilingual_Road_Signs.jpg" decoding="async" width="200" height="133" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Pustec_Multilingual_Road_Signs.jpg/300px-Pustec_Multilingual_Road_Signs.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5b/Pustec_Multilingual_Road_Signs.jpg/400px-Pustec_Multilingual_Road_Signs.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3000" data-file-height="2000" /></a></div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:202px;max-width:202px"><div class="thumbimage"><a href="/wiki/File:Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg/200px-Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg" decoding="async" width="200" height="133" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg/300px-Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg/400px-Street_Sign_Goranxi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1500" data-file-height="1000" /></a></div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="thumbcaption" style="text-align:left;background-color:transparent">One road sign in Albanian and a minority language (Macedonian) and one in Albanian and a foreign language
