for tourists (English) in Pustec <small>(<b>left</b>)</small> Road sign in Albanian and a minority language (Greek) in Goranxi <small>(<b>right</b>)</small></div></div></div></div><p>In recent years, the shrinking number of pupils in schools dedicated to the Greek minority has caused problems for teachers.<sup id="cite_ref-272" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-272">&#91;271&#93;</a></sup> The Greek language is spoken by an important percentage in the southern part of the country, due to cultural and economic links with adjacent Greece.<sup id="cite_ref-273" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-273">&#91;272&#93;</a></sup> In a 2017 study carried out by Instat, the Albanian government statistical agency, 39.9% of the 25–64 years old is able to use at least one foreign language, with English first at 40.0%, followed by Italian with 27.8% and Greek with 22.9%.<sup id="cite_ref-274" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-274">&#91;273&#93;</a></sup> Among young people aged 25 or less, English, German and Turkish have seen a rising interest after 2000. Italian and French have had a stable interest, while Greek has lost most of the interest. The trends are linked with cultural and economic factors.<sup id="cite_ref-Shkurtaj2017_275-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Shkurtaj2017-275">&#91;274&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The young people have shown a growing interest in German language in recent years. Some of them go to Germany for studying or various experiences. Albania and Germany have agreements for cooperating in helping young people of the two countries know both cultures better.<sup id="cite_ref-276" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-276">&#91;275&#93;</a></sup> Due to a sharp rise in economic relations with Turkey, interest in learning Turkish, in particular among young people, has been growing on a yearly basis. Young people, attracted by economic importance of Turkish investments and common values between the two nations, gain from cultural and academic collaboration of universities.<sup id="cite_ref-277" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-277">&#91;276&#93;</a></sup> In 2011 Turkish-owned <a href="/wiki/Epoka_University" title="Epoka University">Epoka University</a>, where Turkish along with English and French is taught, was chosen the best foreign-owned university in Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-278" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-278">&#91;277&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Religion">Religion</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Religion_in_Albania" title="Religion in Albania">Religion in Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Great_Mosque_of_Durres_2016_Albania.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Great_Mosque_of_Durres_2016_Albania.jpg/220px-Great_Mosque_of_Durres_2016_Albania.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Great_Mosque_of_Durres_2016_Albania.jpg/330px-Great_Mosque_of_Durres_2016_Albania.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Great_Mosque_of_Durres_2016_Albania.jpg/440px-Great_Mosque_of_Durres_2016_Albania.jpg 2x" data-file-width="850" data-file-height="567" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Great_Mosque_of_Durres_2016_Albania.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Great_Mosque_of_Durr%C3%ABs" title="Great Mosque of Durrës">Great Mosque</a> of <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>. <a href="/wiki/Islam" title="Islam">Islam</a> is the majority faith and arrived mostly during the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_period" class="mw-redirect" title="Ottoman period">Ottoman period</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Albania is a <a href="/wiki/Secular_state" title="Secular state">secular state</a> without an <a href="/wiki/Official_religion" class="mw-redirect" title="Official religion">official religion</a>, with the <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_religion" title="Freedom of religion">freedom of religion</a> being a <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Albania" title="Constitution of Albania">constitutional</a> right.<sup id="cite_ref-279" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-279">&#91;278&#93;</a></sup> 
The 2011 census, for the first time since 1930, included an optional open-ended question on religion; the census recorded a majority of <a href="/wiki/Muslim" class="mw-redirect" title="Muslim">Muslims</a> (58.79%), which include Sunni (56.70%) and <a href="/wiki/Bektashi_Order" title="Bektashi Order">Bektashi</a> Muslims (2.09%).<sup id="cite_ref-280" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-280">&#91;279&#93;</a></sup><sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="The COE paper cited mentions no percentages of Sunni, Muslim, or Bektashi populations (June 2019)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> <a href="/wiki/Christians" title="Christians">Christians</a>, making up 16.92% of the population, include <a href="/wiki/Catholic_Church" title="Catholic Church">Catholics</a> (10.03%), <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox_Church" title="Eastern Orthodox Church">Orthodox</a> (6.75%) and <a href="/wiki/Evangelicalism" title="Evangelicalism">evangelical</a> <a href="/wiki/Protestants" class="mw-redirect" title="Protestants">Protestants</a> (0.14%).<sup id="cite_ref-Religion_281-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Religion-281">&#91;280&#93;</a></sup>
<a href="/wiki/Atheists" class="mw-redirect" title="Atheists">Atheists</a> accounted for 2.5% of the population and 5.49% were non-affiliated believers, while 13.79% preferred not to answer.<sup id="cite_ref-Religion_281-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Religion-281">&#91;280&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The preliminary results of the 2011 census seemed to give widely different results, with 70% of respondents refusing to declare belief in any of the listed faiths.<sup id="cite_ref-282" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-282">&#91;281&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-283" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-283">&#91;282&#93;</a></sup> The Albanian Orthodox Church officially refused to recognize the results, claiming that 24% of the total population adhered to its faith.<sup id="cite_ref-284" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-284">&#91;283&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-285" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-285">&#91;284&#93;</a></sup> Some Muslim Community officials expressed unhappiness with the data claiming that many Muslims were not counted and that the number of adherents numbered some 70% of the Albanian population.<sup id="cite_ref-286" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-286">&#91;285&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Jazexhi22_287-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jazexhi22-287">&#91;286&#93;</a></sup> The Albanian Catholic Bishops Conference also cast doubts on the census, complaining that many of its believers were not contacted.<sup id="cite_ref-288" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-288">&#91;287&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_Albania" title="Islam in Albania">Muslim Albanians</a> are spread throughout the country. <a href="/wiki/Orthodoxy_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Orthodoxy in Albania">Orthodox</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bektashi" class="mw-redirect" title="Bektashi">Bektashis</a> are mostly found in the south, whereas <a href="/wiki/Catholicism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Catholicism in Albania">Catholics</a> mainly live in the north.<sup id="cite_ref-International_Religious_Freedom_Report_2007_289-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-International_Religious_Freedom_Report_2007-289">&#91;288&#93;</a></sup> In 2008, there were 694 <a href="/wiki/Catholic" class="mw-redirect" title="Catholic">Catholic</a> <a href="/wiki/Church_(building)" title="Church (building)">churches</a> and 425 <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox_Church" title="Eastern Orthodox Church">orthodox</a> <a href="/wiki/Church_(building)" title="Church (building)">churches</a>, 568 <a href="/wiki/Mosque" title="Mosque">mosques</a> and 70 <a href="/wiki/Bektashi_Order" title="Bektashi Order">bektashi</a> <a href="/wiki/Khanqah" title="Khanqah">tekkes</a> in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-290" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-290">&#91;289&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-291" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-291">&#91;290&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Orthodox_Church_Tirana_2016_albania.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Orthodox_Church_Tirana_2016_albania.jpg/220px-Orthodox_Church_Tirana_2016_albania.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Orthodox_Church_Tirana_2016_albania.jpg/330px-Orthodox_Church_Tirana_2016_albania.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Orthodox_Church_Tirana_2016_albania.jpg/440px-Orthodox_Church_Tirana_2016_albania.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4032" data-file-height="3024" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Orthodox_Church_Tirana_2016_albania.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Resurrection_Cathedral,_Tirana" title="Resurrection Cathedral, Tirana">Resurrection Cathedral</a> of <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> is the third largest Orthodox church in <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a>. <a href="/wiki/Eastern_orthodoxy" class="mw-redirect" title="Eastern orthodoxy">Eastern orthodoxy</a> was first introduced during the <a href="/wiki/Roman_period" class="mw-redirect" title="Roman period">Roman period</a>.</div></div></div>
<p><a href="/wiki/Religious_tolerance" class="mw-redirect" title="Religious tolerance">Religious tolerance</a> is one of the most important values of the tradition of the <a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a>. It is widely accepted that Albanians generally value a peaceful coexistence among the believers of different religious communities in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-292" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-292">&#91;291&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-293" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-293">&#91;292&#93;</a></sup> During an <a href="/wiki/Official_visit" class="mw-redirect" title="Official visit">official visit</a> in <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pope_Francis" title="Pope Francis">Pope Francis</a> hailed Albania as model of religious harmony, due to the long tradition of religious coexistence and tolerance.<sup id="cite_ref-294" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-294">&#91;293&#93;</a></sup> The country is ranked among the least religious countries in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-295" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-295">&#91;294&#93;</a></sup> Furthermore, <a href="/wiki/Religion" title="Religion">religion</a> plays an important role in the lives of only 39% of the country's population.<sup id="cite_ref-296" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-296">&#91;295&#93;</a></sup> In the <a href="/wiki/WIN/GIA" title="WIN/GIA">WIN/Gallup International</a> Report of 2016, 56% of the Albanian people considered themselves religious, 30% considered themselves non-religious, while 9% defined themselves as convinced atheists; 80% believed in God and 40% believed in life after death. However, 40% believed in hell, while 42% believed in heaven.<sup id="cite_ref-297" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-297">&#91;296&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During <a href="/wiki/Classical_antiquity" title="Classical antiquity">classical times</a>, there are thought to have been about seventy Christian families in <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, as early as the time of the <a href="/wiki/Apostle" title="Apostle">Apostles</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-298" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-298">&#91;297&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Archdiocese_of_Tiran%C3%AB-Durr%C3%ABs" title="Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Tiranë-Durrës">Archbishopric of Durrës</a> was purportedly founded by <a href="/wiki/Paul_the_Apostle" title="Paul the Apostle">Paul the Apostle</a>, while preaching in <a href="/wiki/Illyria" title="Illyria">Illyria</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ancient_epirus" class="mw-redirect" title="Ancient epirus">Epirus</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-ChHistory_299-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ChHistory-299">&#91;298&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-300" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-300">&#91;299&#93;</a></sup> 
Meanwhile, in <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">medieval times</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian people">Albanian people</a> first appeared within historical records from the <a href="/wiki/Byzantine" class="mw-redirect" title="Byzantine">Byzantines</a>. At this point, they were mostly <a href="/wiki/Christianized" class="mw-redirect" title="Christianized">Christianized</a>. <a href="/wiki/Islam" title="Islam">Islam</a> arrived for the first time in the late 9th century to the region, when <a href="/wiki/Arabs" title="Arabs">Arabs</a> raided parts of the eastern banks of the <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic Sea</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-301" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-301">&#91;300&#93;</a></sup> It later emerged as the majority religion, during the centuries of <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Period</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Merdjanova673940_302-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Merdjanova673940-302">&#91;301&#93;</a></sup> though a significant Christian minority remained.
</p><p>
During <a href="/wiki/Modern_history" title="Modern history">modern times</a>, the Albanian republican, monarchic and later communist regimes followed a systematic policy of separating religion from official functions and cultural life. The country has never had an <a href="/wiki/Official_religion" class="mw-redirect" title="Official religion">official religion</a> either as a republic or as a kingdom. </p><div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Kisha_e_Manastirit_Te_Rubikut_03.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Kisha_e_Manastirit_Te_Rubikut_03.jpg/220px-Kisha_e_Manastirit_Te_Rubikut_03.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Kisha_e_Manastirit_Te_Rubikut_03.jpg/330px-Kisha_e_Manastirit_Te_Rubikut_03.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Kisha_e_Manastirit_Te_Rubikut_03.jpg/440px-Kisha_e_Manastirit_Te_Rubikut_03.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5184" data-file-height="3456" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Kisha_e_Manastirit_Te_Rubikut_03.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Rubik_Monastery_Church" title="Rubik Monastery Church">Monastery of Rubik</a>.</div></div></div><p> In the 20th century, the clergy of all faiths was weakened under the monarchy and ultimately eradicated during the 1950s and 1960s, under the state policy of obliterating all organized religion from the territories of Albania. The <a href="/wiki/Communism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Communism in Albania">communist regime</a> persecuted and suppressed religious observance and institutions and entirely <a href="/wiki/Anti-religious" class="mw-redirect" title="Anti-religious">banned religion</a>. The country was then officially declared to be the world's first <a href="/wiki/Atheist_state" class="mw-redirect" title="Atheist state">atheist state</a>. Although, the country's <a href="/wiki/Religious_freedom" class="mw-redirect" title="Religious freedom">religious freedom</a> has returned, since the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">end of communism</a>.
</p><p>Islam survived communist era persecution and reemerged in the modern era as a practiced religion in Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-Merdjanova673940_302-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Merdjanova673940-302">&#91;301&#93;</a></sup> Some smaller Christian sects in Albania include <a href="/wiki/Evangelicalism" title="Evangelicalism">Evangelicals</a> and several <a href="/wiki/Protestantism" title="Protestantism">Protestant</a> communities including <a href="/wiki/Seventh-day_Adventist_Church" title="Seventh-day Adventist Church">Seventh-day Adventist Church</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_Church_of_Jesus_Christ_of_Latter-day_Saints" title="The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints">Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints</a> and <a href="/wiki/Jehovah%27s_Witnesses" title="Jehovah&#39;s Witnesses">Jehovah's Witnesses</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-303" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-303">&#91;302&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-304" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-304">&#91;303&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-305" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-305">&#91;304&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-306" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-306">&#91;305&#93;</a></sup> The first recorded Protestant of Albania was Said Toptani, who traveled around <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a> and returned to <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> in 1853, where he preached <a href="/wiki/Protestantism" title="Protestantism">Protestantism</a>. Due to that, he was arrested and imprisoned by the Ottoman authorities in 1864. First <a href="/wiki/Evangelical_Protestants" class="mw-redirect" title="Evangelical Protestants">evangelical Protestants</a> appeared in the 19th century and the Evangelical Alliance was founded in 1892. Nowadays, it has 160 member congregations from different Protestant denominations.
</p><p>Albania was the only country in <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a> where the <a href="/wiki/Jewish" class="mw-redirect" title="Jewish">Jewish</a> population increased significantly during <a href="/wiki/The_Holocaust" title="The Holocaust">the Holocaust</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-307">&#91;306&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-308" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-308">&#91;307&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-309" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-309">&#91;308&#93;</a></sup> Following the mass emigration to <a href="/wiki/Israel" title="Israel">Israel</a>, since the fall of communism, only 200 Albanian <a href="/wiki/Judaism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Judaism in Albania">Jews</a> are left in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-310" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-310">&#91;309&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-311" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-311">&#91;310&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Culture">Culture</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Culture_of_Albania" title="Culture of Albania">Culture of Albania</a></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Symbols">Symbols</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/National_symbols_of_Albania" title="National symbols of Albania">National symbols of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Mak.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Mak.jpg/220px-Mak.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Mak.jpg/330px-Mak.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Mak.jpg/440px-Mak.jpg 2x" data-file-width="500" data-file-height="334" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Mak.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/National_flower" class="mw-redirect" title="National flower">national flower</a> of Albania is the <a href="/wiki/Red_poppy" class="mw-redirect" title="Red poppy">red poppy</a> and is found everywhere throughout the landscapes of the country.</div></div></div>
<p>Albania shares many symbols associated with its history, culture and belief. These include the colours red and black, animals such as the <a href="/wiki/Golden_eagle" title="Golden eagle">golden eagle</a> living across the country, costumes such as the <a href="/wiki/Fustanella" title="Fustanella">fustanella</a>, <a href="/wiki/Qeleshe" title="Qeleshe">plis</a> and <a href="/wiki/Opinga" title="Opinga">opinga</a> which are worn to special events and celebrations, plants such as the <a href="/wiki/Olive" title="Olive">olive</a> and <a href="/wiki/Papaver_rhoeas" title="Papaver rhoeas">red poppy</a> growing as well across the country.
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Flag_of_Albania" title="Flag of Albania">flag of Albania</a> is a red flag with a black <a href="/wiki/Double-headed_eagle" title="Double-headed eagle">double-headed eagle</a> in the centre.<sup id="cite_ref-Flamuri_312-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Flamuri-312">&#91;311&#93;</a></sup> The red colour symbolizes the bravery, strength and valour of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian people">Albanian people</a> and the black colour appears as a symbol of freedom and heroism.<sup id="cite_ref-Flamuri_312-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Flamuri-312">&#91;311&#93;</a></sup> The eagle has been used by Albanians since the <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">Middle Ages</a> including the establishment of the <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Arb%C3%ABr" class="mw-redirect" title="Principality of Arbër">Principality of Arbër</a> and by numerous noble ruling families such as the <a href="/wiki/Kastrioti_family" class="mw-redirect" title="Kastrioti family">Kastrioti</a>, <a href="/wiki/Muzaka_family" title="Muzaka family">Muzaka</a>, <a href="/wiki/Thopia_family" title="Thopia family">Thopia</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dukagjini_family" title="Dukagjini family">Dukagjini</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-313" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-313">&#91;312&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Gjergj_Kastrioti_Sk%C3%ABnderbeu" class="mw-redirect" title="Gjergj Kastrioti Skënderbeu">Gjergj Kastrioti Skënderbeu</a>, who fought and began a rebellion against the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> which halted Ottoman advance into <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a> for nearly 25 years, placed the double-headed eagle on his flag and seal.<sup id="cite_ref-314" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-314">&#91;313&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-315" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-315">&#91;314&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The country's national motto, <a href="/wiki/Ti_Shqip%C3%ABri,_m%C3%AB_jep_nder,_m%C3%AB_jep_emrin_Shqip%C3%ABtar" title="Ti Shqipëri, më jep nder, më jep emrin Shqipëtar">Ti Shqipëri, më jep nder, më jep emrin Shqipëtar</a>, finds its origins in the early <a href="/wiki/Rilindja_Komb%C3%ABtare" class="mw-redirect" title="Rilindja Kombëtare">19th century</a>. The first to express this motto was <a href="/wiki/Naim_Frash%C3%ABri" title="Naim Frashëri">Naim Frashëri</a> in his poem Ti Shqipëri më jep nder.<sup id="cite_ref-316" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-316">&#91;315&#93;</a></sup> This poem is notable as refers to the values and ambitions of the Albanian people to remain separate from and independent of, those neighbouring countries around it, which have tried to dominate it.
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Crossed_hands_(gesture)" title="Crossed hands (gesture)">duart e kryqëzuara</a>, also referred to as the eagle gesture, is a gesture performed particularly by the Albanian people around the world in order to visually illustrate the double-headed eagle, the symbol of Albania.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cuisine">Cuisine</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_cuisine" title="Albanian cuisine">Albanian cuisine</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:4Gambas.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/4Gambas.jpg/220px-4Gambas.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/4Gambas.jpg/330px-4Gambas.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/4Gambas.jpg/440px-4Gambas.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3888" data-file-height="2592" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:4Gambas.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Scampi" title="Scampi">Scampis</a> are one of the favoured dishes among the Albanians on the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Albanian Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ionian_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Ionian Sea Coast">Ionian Coasts</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>In the course of the centuries, <a href="/wiki/Albanian_cuisine" title="Albanian cuisine">Albanian cuisine</a> has been widely influenced by the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_culture" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian culture">culture</a>, <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Albania" title="Geography of Albania">geography</a> and <a href="/wiki/History_of_Albania" title="History of Albania">history</a> of Albania and therefore different parts of the country have a specific regional cuisine. The cooking traditions vary especially between the north and the south owing to differing <a href="/wiki/Topography" title="Topography">topography</a> and <a href="/wiki/Climate" title="Climate">climate</a> that contribute to the excellent growth conditions for a wide array of <a href="/wiki/Herb" title="Herb">herbs</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fruit" title="Fruit">fruits</a> and <a href="/wiki/Vegetable" title="Vegetable">vegetables</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-317" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-317">&#91;316&#93;</a></sup> 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Albanians" title="Albanians">Albanians</a> produces and uses many varieties of <a href="/wiki/Fruit" title="Fruit">fruits</a> such as <a href="/wiki/Lemon_(fruit)" class="mw-redirect" title="Lemon (fruit)">lemons</a>, <a href="/wiki/Orange_(fruit)" title="Orange (fruit)">oranges</a>, <a href="/wiki/Figs_(fruit)" class="mw-redirect" title="Figs (fruit)">figs</a> and most notably <a href="/wiki/Olive_(fruit)" class="mw-redirect" title="Olive (fruit)">olives</a> which are perhaps the most important element of Albanian cooking. <a href="/wiki/Spice" title="Spice">Spices</a> and other <a href="/wiki/Herb" title="Herb">herbs</a> such as <a href="/wiki/Basil_(herb)" class="mw-redirect" title="Basil (herb)">basil</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lavender" class="mw-redirect" title="Lavender">lavender</a>, <a href="/wiki/Spearmint" title="Spearmint">mint</a>, <a href="/wiki/Oregano" title="Oregano">oregano</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rosemary" title="Rosemary">rosemary</a> and <a href="/wiki/Thyme" title="Thyme">thyme</a> are widely used, as are <a href="/wiki/Vegetable" title="Vegetable">vegetables</a> such as <a href="/wiki/Garlic" title="Garlic">garlics</a>, <a href="/wiki/Onion" title="Onion">onions</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bell_pepper" title="Bell pepper">peppers</a>, <a href="/wiki/Potato" title="Potato">potatoes</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tomato" title="Tomato">tomatoes</a> as well as <a href="/wiki/Legume" title="Legume">legumes</a> of all types.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg/220px-Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="211" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg/330px-Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg/440px-Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3456" data-file-height="3314" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Albanian_cuisine_-_Pite_dhe_Speca.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Roasted <a href="/wiki/Capsicum" title="Capsicum">peppers</a> served with <a href="/wiki/Pite_(food)" class="mw-redirect" title="Pite (food)">Pite</a>, a traditional and prominent layered Albanian pie.</div></div></div>
<p>While having a coastline along the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Adriatic_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Adriatic Sea Coast">Adriatic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Ionian_Sea_Coast" title="Albanian Ionian Sea Coast">Ionian Sea</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">fish</a>, <a href="/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">crustaceans</a> and <a href="/wiki/Seafood" title="Seafood">seafood</a> are a popular and an integral part of the Albanian diet. Otherwise <a href="/wiki/Lamb_(food)" class="mw-redirect" title="Lamb (food)">lamb</a> is the traditional <a href="/wiki/Meat" title="Meat">meat</a> for different <a href="/wiki/Holiday" title="Holiday">holidays</a> and <a href="/wiki/Religious_festival" title="Religious festival">religious festivals</a> for both <a href="/wiki/Christians" title="Christians">Christians</a> and <a href="/wiki/Muslim" class="mw-redirect" title="Muslim">Muslims</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Poultry" title="Poultry">poultry</a>, <a href="/wiki/Beef" title="Beef">beef</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Pork" title="Pork">pork</a> are also in plentiful supply.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Tav%C3%AB_Kosi" title="Tavë Kosi">Tavë Kosi</a> is a national dish in Albania and consists of garlicky lamb and rice baked under a thick, tart veil of <a href="/wiki/Yogurt" title="Yogurt">yogurt</a>. <a href="/wiki/F%C3%ABrges%C3%AB_of_Tirana_with_Peppers" class="mw-redirect" title="Fërgesë of Tirana with Peppers">Fërgesë</a> is another national dish in the country and is made up with peppers, tomatoes and <a href="/wiki/Cottage_cheese" title="Cottage cheese">cottage cheese</a>. Another beloved dish is Pite which is generally a filled and baked pastry with a filling of a mixture of <a href="/wiki/Spinach" title="Spinach">spinach</a> and <a href="/wiki/Curd" title="Curd">gjizë</a> or <a href="/wiki/Ground_meat" title="Ground meat">mish</a> as it is known in Albania.
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe,_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG/220px-Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG/330px-Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG/440px-Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe%2C_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG 2x" data-file-width="4000" data-file-height="3000" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Buk%C3%AB_kollomoqe,_buk%C3%AB_misri.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Cornbread" title="Cornbread">Bukë Misri</a> is a staple on the Albanian table.</div></div></div>
<p>Petulla, a traditionally fried dough, is as well a popular speciality and is served with <a href="/wiki/Powdered_sugar" title="Powdered sugar">powdered sugar</a> or <a href="/wiki/Feta_cheese" class="mw-redirect" title="Feta cheese">feta cheese</a> and different sorts of <a href="/wiki/Fruit_preserves" title="Fruit preserves">fruit jams</a>. Also popular is <a href="/wiki/Flia" title="Flia">Flia</a> consisting of multiple crepe-like layers brushed with cream and served with sour cream. Krofne, similar to <a href="/wiki/Berliner_(doughnut)" title="Berliner (doughnut)">Berliner</a>, are filled with jam, or chocolate and often eaten during the cold winter months.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Coffee" title="Coffee">Coffee</a> is very much a part of the people's lifestyle in Albania. Different variations of coffee is best enjoyed within the family or friends but also outside at cafés or bars. A small country in size, Albania ranked first with the most coffee houses per capita in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-318" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-318">&#91;317&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Tea" title="Tea">Tea</a> is enjoyed both at home or outside at cafés, bars or restaurants. <a href="/wiki/Sideritis" title="Sideritis">Çaj Mali</a> is enormously beloved and is part of a daily routine for most of the Albanians. It is cultivated across Southern Albania and noted for its medicinal properties. <a href="/wiki/Black_tea" title="Black tea">Black tea</a> with a slice of lemon and sugar, milk or honey is also a popular type of tea.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Albanian_wine" title="Albanian wine">Wine</a> drinking is popular throughout the Albanians. The country has a long and ancient history of wine production, as it belongs to the <a href="/wiki/Old_World_wine" title="Old World wine">old world of wine producing countries</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-319" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-319">&#91;318&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-320" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-320">&#91;319&#93;</a></sup> Its wine is characterized for its sweet taste and traditionally indigenous varieties.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Arts">Arts</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_art" title="Albanian art">Albanian art</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_architecture" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian architecture">architecture</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg/220px-Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg/330px-Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg/440px-Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3872" data-file-height="2592" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Amphitheatre_of_Butrint_2009.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Butrint" title="Butrint">Butrint</a> has been included in the <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> list of <a href="/wiki/World_Heritage_Site" title="World Heritage Site">World Heritage Sites</a> since 1992.</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_art" title="Albanian art">artistic history</a> of Albania has been particularly influenced by a multitude of ancient and medieval <a href="/wiki/Civilization" title="Civilization">people</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tradition" title="Tradition">traditions</a> and <a href="/wiki/Religion" title="Religion">religions</a>. It covers a broad spectrum with mediums and disciplines that include <a href="/wiki/Painting" title="Painting">painting</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pottery" title="Pottery">pottery</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sculpture" title="Sculpture">sculpture</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ceramic" title="Ceramic">ceramics</a> and <a href="/wiki/Architecture" title="Architecture">architecture</a> all of them exemplifying a great variety in style and shape, in different regions and period.
</p><p>The rise of the <a href="/wiki/Byzantine_Empire" title="Byzantine Empire">Byzantine</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">Middle Ages</a> was accompanied by a corresponding growth in <a href="/wiki/Christian_art" title="Christian art">Christian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Islamic_art" title="Islamic art">Islamic art</a> in the lands of Albania which are apparent in examples of architecture and mosaics throughout the country.<sup id="cite_ref-321" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-321">&#91;320&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-www.albanianart.net_index_al_322-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-www.albanianart.net_index_al-322">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup> Centuries later, the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Renaissance" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian Renaissance">Albanian Renaissance</a> proved crucial to the emancipation of the modern Albanian culture and saw unprecedented developments in all fields of literature and art whereas artists sought to return to the ideals of <a href="/wiki/Impressionism" title="Impressionism">Impressionism</a> and <a href="/wiki/Romanticism_(art)" class="mw-redirect" title="Romanticism (art)">Romanticism</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-323" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-323">&#91;322&#93;</a></sup> However, <a href="/wiki/Onufri" title="Onufri">Onufri</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kol%C3%AB_Idromeno" title="Kolë Idromeno">Kolë Idromeno</a>, <a href="/wiki/David_Selenica" title="David Selenica">David Selenica</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kostandin_Shpataraku" title="Kostandin Shpataraku">Kostandin Shpataraku</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Zografi_Brothers" title="Zografi Brothers">Zografi Brothers</a> are the most eminent representatives of Albanian art.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg/220px-Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="211" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg/330px-Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg/440px-Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2800" data-file-height="2690" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Codex_Beratinus_0011b.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Codices_of_Berat" class="mw-redirect" title="Codices of Berat">Codices of Berat</a> are eminently important for the global community and the development of ancient <a href="/wiki/Biblical" class="mw-redirect" title="Biblical">biblical</a>, <a href="/wiki/Liturgical" class="mw-redirect" title="Liturgical">liturgical</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hagiography" title="Hagiography">hagiographical</a> literature.<sup id="cite_ref-324" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-324">&#91;323&#93;</a></sup> In 2005, it was inscribed on the <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Memory_of_the_World_Register" class="mw-redirect" title="Memory of the World Register">Memory of the World Register</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Architecture_of_Albania" title="Architecture of Albania">architecture of Albania</a> reflects the legacy of various civilizations tracing back to the <a href="/wiki/Classical_antiquity" title="Classical antiquity">classical antiquity</a>. Major cities in Albania have evolved from within the castle to include dwellings, religious and commercial structures, with constant redesigning of town squares and evolution of building techniques. Nowadays, the cities and towns reflect a whole spectrum of various <a href="/wiki/Architectural_style" title="Architectural style">architectural styles</a>. In the 20th century, many historical as well as <a href="/wiki/Sacred_architecture" title="Sacred architecture">sacred</a> buildings bearing the ancient influence were demolished during the <a href="/wiki/Communism_in_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Communism in Albania">communist era</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-325" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-325">&#91;324&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Ancient_architecture" class="mw-redirect" title="Ancient architecture">Ancient architecture</a> is found throughout Albania and most visible in <a href="/wiki/Byllis" title="Byllis">Byllis</a>, <a href="/wiki/Amantia" title="Amantia">Amantia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Phoenice" title="Phoenice">Phoenice</a>, <a href="/wiki/Apollonia_(Illyria)" title="Apollonia (Illyria)">Apollonia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Butrint" title="Butrint">Butrint</a>, <a href="/wiki/Antigonia_(Chaonia)" title="Antigonia (Chaonia)">Antigonia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rozafa_Castle" title="Rozafa Castle">Shkodër</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_Amphitheatre" class="mw-redirect" title="Durrës Amphitheatre">Durrës</a>. Considering the long period of rule of the <a href="/wiki/Byzantine_Empire" title="Byzantine Empire">Byzantine Empire</a>, they introduced castles, citadels, churches and monasteries with spectacular wealth of visible <a href="/wiki/Mural" title="Mural">murals</a> and <a href="/wiki/Fresco" title="Fresco">frescos</a>. Perhaps the best known examples can be found in the southern Albanian cities and surroundings of <a href="/wiki/Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="Korçë">Korçë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Berat" title="Berat">Berat</a>, <a href="/wiki/Voskopoj%C3%AB" class="mw-redirect" title="Voskopojë">Voskopojë</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gjirokast%C3%ABr" title="Gjirokastër">Gjirokastër</a>. Involving the introduction of <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_architecture" title="Ottoman architecture">Ottoman architecture</a> there was a development of mosques and other Islamic buildings, particularly seen in Berat and Gjirokastër.
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg/220px-Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg/330px-Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg/440px-Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="1067" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Castle_of_Bashtov%C3%AB.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Fortress_of_Bashtov%C3%AB" title="Fortress of Bashtovë">Fortress of Bashtovë</a> is on the <a href="/wiki/List_of_World_Heritage_Sites_in_Albania#Tentative_list" title="List of World Heritage Sites in Albania">tentative list</a> for inscribing it as a <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> <a href="/wiki/World_Heritage_Site" title="World Heritage Site">World Heritage Site</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-326" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-326">&#91;325&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>A productive period of <a href="/wiki/Historicism_(art)" title="Historicism (art)">Historicism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Art_Nouveau" title="Art Nouveau">Art Nouveau</a> and <a href="/wiki/Neoclassicism" title="Neoclassicism">Neoclassicism</a> merged into the 19th century, best exemplified in <a href="/wiki/Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="Korçë">Korçë</a>. The 20th century brought new architectural styles such as the modern <a href="/wiki/Italianate_architecture" title="Italianate architecture">Italian style</a>, which is present in <a href="/wiki/Tirana" title="Tirana">Tirana</a> such as the <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg_Square" title="Skanderbeg Square">Skanderbeg Square</a> and Ministries. It is also present in Shkodër, <a href="/wiki/Vlor%C3%AB" title="Vlorë">Vlorë</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sarand%C3%AB" title="Sarandë">Sarandë</a> and <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>. Moreover, other towns received their present-day Albania-unique appearance through various cultural or economic influences.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Socialist_classicism" class="mw-redirect" title="Socialist classicism">Socialist classicism</a> arrived during the <a href="/wiki/Peoples_Republic_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Peoples Republic of Albania">communist era</a> in Albania after the <a href="/wiki/Second_World_War" class="mw-redirect" title="Second World War">Second World War</a>. At this period many socialist-styled complexes, wide roads and factories were constructed, while town squares were redesigned and numerous of historic and important buildings demolished. Notable examples of that style include the <a href="/wiki/Mother_Teresa_Square_(Tirana)" title="Mother Teresa Square (Tirana)">Mother Teresa Square</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pyramid_of_Tirana" title="Pyramid of Tirana">Pyramid of Tirana</a>, <a href="/wiki/Palace_of_Congresses" title="Palace of Congresses">Palace of Congresses</a> and so on.
</p><p>Three Albanian archaeological sites are included in the list of <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> <a href="/wiki/World_Heritage_Site" title="World Heritage Site">World Heritage Sites</a>. These include the ancient remains of Butrint, the medieval <a href="/wiki/Historic_Centres_of_Berat_and_Gjirokast%C3%ABr" title="Historic Centres of Berat and Gjirokastër">Historic Centres of Berat and Gjirokastër</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Ohrid_Lake" class="mw-redirect" title="Ohrid Lake">Natural and Cultural Heritage of the Ohrid region</a> site shared with <a href="/wiki/North_Macedonia" title="North Macedonia">North Macedonia</a> since 2019.<sup id="cite_ref-327" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-327">&#91;326&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-328" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-328">&#91;327&#93;</a></sup> Furthermore, the royal <a href="/wiki/Royal_Tombs_of_Selca_e_Poshtme" title="Royal Tombs of Selca e Poshtme">Illyrian tombs</a>, the remains of <a href="/wiki/Apollonia_(Illyria)" title="Apollonia (Illyria)">Apollonia</a>, the ancient <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_Amphitheatre" class="mw-redirect" title="Durrës Amphitheatre">Amphitheatre</a> of Durrës and the <a href="/wiki/Fortress_of_Bashtov%C3%AB" title="Fortress of Bashtovë">Fortress of Bashtovë</a> has been included on the tentative list of Albania.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Music">Music</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Music_of_Albania" title="Music of Albania">Albanian music</a> and <a href="/wiki/Traditional_Albanian_clothing" class="mw-redirect" title="Traditional Albanian clothing">traditional clothing</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG/220px-A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG/330px-A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG/440px-A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2048" data-file-height="1536" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:A_traditional_male_folk_group_from_Skrapar.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_iso-polyphony" title="Albanian iso-polyphony">Albanian iso-polyphony</a> is <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Masterpieces_of_the_Oral_and_Intangible_Heritage_of_Humanity" title="Masterpieces of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity">Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-329" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-329">&#91;328&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>The Albanian <a href="/wiki/Albanian_music" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian music">folk music</a> is a prominent section of the national identity and continues to play a major part in <a href="/wiki/Albanian_music" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian music">Albanian music</a>. Although, it can be divided into two stylistic groups, as performed by the northern <a href="/wiki/Gheg_Albanian" title="Gheg Albanian">Ghegs</a> and southern <a href="/wiki/Lab%C3%ABria" title="Labëria">Labs</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tosk_Albanian" title="Tosk Albanian">Tosks</a>. The northern and southern traditions are contrasted by the rugged tone of the north and the relaxed form of the south.
</p><p>Many of the songs are about events from <a href="/wiki/History_of_Albania" title="History of Albania">history</a> and <a href="/wiki/Culture_of_Albania" title="Culture of Albania">culture</a>, including the traditional themes about honour, hospitality, treachery and revenge. The first compilation of Albanian folk music was made by two <a href="/wiki/Himara" title="Himara">Himariot</a> musicians <a href="/wiki/Ne%C3%A7o_Muko" title="Neço Muko">Neço Muka</a> and Koço Çakali in <a href="/wiki/Paris" title="Paris">Paris</a>, during their interpretations with the song <a href="/wiki/Tefta_Tashko-Ko%C3%A7o" title="Tefta Tashko-Koço">Diva Tefta Tashko Koço</a>. Several <a href="/wiki/Phonograph_record" title="Phonograph record">gramophone</a> compilations were recorded in those years by this genial trio of artists which eventually led to the recognition of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_iso-polyphony" title="Albanian iso-polyphony">Himariot Isopolyphonic Music</a> as an <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> <a href="/wiki/UNESCO_Intangible_Cultural_Heritage_Lists" title="UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists">World Cultural Heritage</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-330" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-330">&#91;329&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_(c._1835).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg/220px-Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="137" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg/330px-Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg/440px-Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_%28c._1835%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="771" data-file-height="481" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Les_Danseurs_Albanais_by_Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps_(c._1835).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Alexandre-Gabriel_Decamps" title="Alexandre-Gabriel Decamps">Albanian dancers</a> wearing <a href="/wiki/Fustanella" title="Fustanella">Fustanellas</a>, the <a href="/wiki/National_costume_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="National costume of Albania">national costume</a> of Albania</div></div></div>
<p>The contemporary music artists <a href="/wiki/Rita_Ora" title="Rita Ora">Rita Ora</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bebe_Rexha" title="Bebe Rexha">Bebe Rexha</a>, <a href="/wiki/Era_Istrefi" title="Era Istrefi">Era Istrefi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dua_Lipa" title="Dua Lipa">Dua Lipa</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ava_Max" title="Ava Max">Ava Max</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bleona" title="Bleona">Bleona</a>, <a href="/wiki/Elvana_Gjata" title="Elvana Gjata">Elvana Gjata</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ermonela_Jaho" title="Ermonela Jaho">Ermonela Jaho</a> and <a href="/wiki/Inva_Mula" title="Inva Mula">Inva Mula</a> have achieved international recognition for their music.<sup id="cite_ref-331" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-331">&#91;330&#93;</a></sup> Sporano <a href="/wiki/Ermonela_Jaho" title="Ermonela Jaho">Ermonela Jaho</a> has been described by <a href="/wiki/The_Economist" title="The Economist">The Economist</a> as the World's most acclaimed Soprano.<sup id="cite_ref-332" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-332">&#91;331&#93;</a></sup> One widely recognized musician from <a href="/wiki/Elbasan" title="Elbasan">Elbasan</a> is <a href="/wiki/Saimir_Pirgu" title="Saimir Pirgu">Saimir Pirgu</a>, an Albanian international opera singer. He was nominated for the 2017 <a href="/wiki/Grammy_Award" title="Grammy Award">Grammy Award</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-333" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-333">&#91;332&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Every cultural and geographical region of Albania has its own specific variety of costume that vary in style, material, color, shape, detail and form.<sup id="cite_ref-334" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-334">&#91;333&#93;</a></sup> Presently, the <a href="/wiki/National_costume_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="National costume of Albania">national costumes</a> are most often worn with connection to special events and celebrations, mostly at ethnic festivals, religious holidays, weddings and by dancing groups as well. Some conservative old men and women mainly from the high northern as well as southern regions and wear traditional clothing in their daily lives. The clothing was made mainly of products from the local <a href="/wiki/Agriculture" title="Agriculture">agriculture</a> and <a href="/wiki/Livestock" title="Livestock">livestock</a> such as leather, wool, linen, hemp fiber and silk. Nowadays, the traditional textiles are still embroidered in very collaborate ancient patterns.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Literature">Literature</span></h3>
<table class="box-More_citations_needed_section plainlinks metadata ambox ambox-content ambox-Refimprove" role="presentation"><tbody><tr><td class="mbox-image"><div style="width:52px"><a href="/wiki/File:Question_book-new.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/50px-Question_book-new.svg.png" decoding="async" width="50" height="39" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/75px-Question_book-new.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/100px-Question_book-new.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="512" data-file-height="399" /></a></div></td><td class="mbox-text"><div class="mbox-text-span">This section <b>needs additional citations for <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability" title="Wikipedia:Verifiability">verification</a></b>.<span class="hide-when-compact"> Please help <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Albania&amp;action=edit">improve this article</a> by <a href="/wiki/Help:Introduction_to_referencing_with_Wiki_Markup/1" title="Help:Introduction to referencing with Wiki Markup/1">adding citations to reliable sources</a>. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.<br /><small><span class="plainlinks"><i>Find sources:</i>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?as_eq=wikipedia&amp;q=%22Albania%22">"Albania"</a>&#160;–&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbm=nws&amp;q=%22Albania%22+-wikipedia">news</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?&amp;q=%22Albania%22+site:news.google.com/newspapers&amp;source=newspapers">newspapers</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbs=bks:1&amp;q=%22Albania%22+-wikipedia">books</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22Albania%22">scholar</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=%22Albania%22&amp;acc=on&amp;wc=on">JSTOR</a></span></small></span>  <small class="date-container"><i>(<span class="date">October 2018</span>)</i></small><small class="hide-when-compact"><i> (<a href="/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal" title="Help:Maintenance template removal">Learn how and when to remove this template message</a>)</i></small></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_literature" title="Albanian literature">literature</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Meshari.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Meshari.jpg/220px-Meshari.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="149" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Meshari.jpg/330px-Meshari.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/23/Meshari.jpg 2x" data-file-width="400" data-file-height="271" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Meshari.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>An excerpt from the <a href="/wiki/Meshari" title="Meshari">Meshari</a> <i>(The Missal)</i> written by <a href="/wiki/Gjon_Buzuku" title="Gjon Buzuku">Gjon Buzuku</a>. <small>(1555)</small></div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a> comprises its own branch of the <a href="/wiki/Indo-European_languages" title="Indo-European languages">Indo-European language</a> family. The language is considered an <a href="/wiki/Language_isolate" title="Language isolate">isolate</a> within the <a href="/wiki/Indo-European_languages" title="Indo-European languages">Indo-European</a>. The only other languages that are the sole surviving member of a branch of <a href="/wiki/Indo-European_languages" title="Indo-European languages">Indo-European</a> are Armenian and Greek. It was proved to be an <a href="/wiki/Indo-European_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Indo-European language">Indo-European language</a> in 1854 by the German <a href="/wiki/Comparative_linguistics" title="Comparative linguistics">philologist</a> <a href="/wiki/Franz_Bopp" title="Franz Bopp">Franz Bopp</a>. Albanian is often held to be related to the <a href="/wiki/Illyrian_languages" title="Illyrian languages">Illyrian languages</a>, a language spoken in the Balkans during <a href="/wiki/Classical_antiquity" title="Classical antiquity">classical times</a>. Scholars argue that Albanian derives from <a href="/wiki/Illyrian_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Illyrian language">Illyrian</a><sup id="cite_ref-335" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-335">&#91;334&#93;</a></sup> while some others<sup id="cite_ref-336" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-336">&#91;335&#93;</a></sup> claim that it derives from <a href="/wiki/Dacian_language" title="Dacian language">Daco</a>-<a href="/wiki/Thracian_language" title="Thracian language">Thracian</a>. (Illyrian and Daco-Thracian, however, might have been closely related languages; see <a href="/wiki/Thraco-Illyrian" title="Thraco-Illyrian">Thraco-Illyrian</a>.)
</p><p>The cultural renaissance was first of all expressed through the development of the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian language</a> in the area of church texts and publications, mainly of the Catholic region in the northern of Albania, but also of the <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox_Church" title="Eastern Orthodox Church">Orthodox</a> in the south. The Protestant reforms invigorated hopes for the development of the local language and literary tradition, when cleric <a href="/wiki/Gjon_Buzuku" title="Gjon Buzuku">Gjon Buzuku</a> brought into the Albanian language the <a href="/wiki/Catholic_liturgy" title="Catholic liturgy">Catholic liturgy</a>, trying to do for the Albanian language, what <a href="/wiki/Martin_Luther" title="Martin Luther">Martin Luther</a> did for the <a href="/wiki/German_language" title="German language">German language</a>. <a href="/wiki/Meshari" title="Meshari">Meshari</a> (<i>The Missal</i>) written by <a href="/wiki/Gjon_Buzuku" title="Gjon Buzuku">Gjon Buzuku</a> was published in 1555 and is considered as one of the first literary work of written Albanian during the Middle Ages. The refined level of the language and the stabilised orthography must be the result of an earlier tradition of written Albanian, a tradition that is not well understood. However, there is some fragmented evidence, pre-dating Buzuku, which indicates that Albanian was written from at least the 14th century.
The earliest evidence dates from 1332&#160;AD with a Latin report from the French Dominican Guillelmus Adae, <a href="/wiki/Archbishop" title="Archbishop">Archbishop</a> of <a href="/wiki/Antivari" class="mw-redirect" title="Antivari">Antivari</a>, who wrote that Albanians used Latin letters in their books although their language was quite different from Latin. Other significant examples include: a <a href="/wiki/Formula_e_pag%C3%ABzimit" title="Formula e pagëzimit">baptism formula</a> (<i>Unte paghesont premenit Atit et Birit et spertit senit</i>) from 1462, written in Albanian within a Latin text by the Bishop of <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pal_Engj%C3%ABlli" title="Pal Engjëlli">Pal Engjëlli</a>; a glossary of Albanian words of 1497 by Arnold von Harff, a German who had travelled through Albania, and a 15th-century fragment of the Bible from the <a href="/wiki/Gospel_of_Matthew" title="Gospel of Matthew">Gospel of Matthew</a>, also in Albanian, but written in Greek letters.
</p>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r889293853/mw-parser-output/.tmulti"/><div class="thumb tmulti tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;max-width:222px"><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:102px;max-width:102px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:140px;overflow:hidden"><a href="/wiki/File:NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg/100px-NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg" decoding="async" width="100" height="140" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg/150px-NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg/200px-NaumVeqilharxhi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="689" data-file-height="967" /></a></div><div class="thumbcaption"><a href="/wiki/Naum_Veqilharxhi" title="Naum Veqilharxhi">Naum Veqilharxhi</a> lawyer and scholar <small>(1797–1854)</small></div></div><div class="tsingle" style="width:116px;max-width:116px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:140px;overflow:hidden"><a href="/wiki/File:Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg/114px-Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg" decoding="async" width="114" height="140" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg/171px-Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg/228px-Parashqevi_Qiriazi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="598" data-file-height="734" /></a></div><div class="thumbcaption"><a href="/wiki/Parashqevi_Qiriazi" title="Parashqevi Qiriazi">Parashqevi Qiriazi</a> teacher and feminist <small>(1880–1970)</small></div></div></div></div></div>
<p>Albanian writings from these centuries must not have been religious texts only, but historical chronicles too. They are mentioned by the humanist <a href="/wiki/Marin_Barleti" title="Marin Barleti">Marin Barleti</a>, who in his book <a href="/wiki/Siege_of_Shkodra_(1478)#The_Book" class="mw-redirect" title="Siege of Shkodra (1478)">Siege of Shkodër</a> (<i>Rrethimi i Shkodrës</i>) from 1504, confirms that he leafed through such chronicles written in the language of the people (<i>in vernacula lingua</i>) as well as his famous biography of <a href="/wiki/Skanderbeg" title="Skanderbeg">Skanderbeg</a> <a href="/wiki/Marin_Barleti" title="Marin Barleti">Historia de vita et gestis Scanderbegi Epirotarum principis</a> (<i>History of Skanderbeg</i>) from 1508. The <i>History of Skanderbeg</i> is still the foundation of Skanderbeg studies and is considered an Albanian cultural treasure, vital to the formation of Albanian national self-consciousness.
</p><p>During the 16th and the 17th centuries, the <a href="/wiki/Catechism" title="Catechism">catechism</a> (<i>E mbësuame krishterë</i>) (Christian Teachings) from 1592 written by <a href="/wiki/Lek%C3%AB_Matr%C3%ABnga" class="mw-redirect" title="Lekë Matrënga">Lekë Matrënga</a>, (<i>Doktrina e krishterë</i>) (The Christian Doctrine) from 1618 and (<i>Rituale romanum</i>) 1621 by <a href="/wiki/Pjet%C3%ABr_Budi" title="Pjetër Budi">Pjetër Budi</a>, the first writer of original Albanian <a href="/wiki/Prose" title="Prose">prose</a> and poetry, an <a href="/wiki/Remorse" title="Remorse">apology</a> for George Castriot (1636) by <a href="/wiki/Frang_Bardhi" title="Frang Bardhi">Frang Bardhi</a>, who also published a dictionary and <a href="/wiki/Folklore" title="Folklore">folklore</a> creations, the theological-philosophical treaty <i><a href="/wiki/Cuneus_Prophetarum" title="Cuneus Prophetarum">Cuneus Prophetarum</a></i> (The Band of Prophets) (1685) by <a href="/wiki/Pjet%C3%ABr_Bogdani" title="Pjetër Bogdani">Pjetër Bogdani</a>, the most universal personality of Albanian <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">Middle Ages</a>, were published in <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a>. The most famous Albanian writer in the 20th and 21st century is probably <a href="/wiki/Ismail_Kadare" title="Ismail Kadare">Ismail Kadare</a>. He has been mentioned as a possible recipient of the <a href="/wiki/Nobel_Prize" title="Nobel Prize">Nobel Prize</a> in Literature several times.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cinema">Cinema</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Cinema_of_Albania" title="Cinema of Albania">Cinema of Albania</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Eliza_Dushku_(3756552915).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f0/Eliza_Dushku_%283756552915%29.jpg/220px-Eliza_Dushku_%283756552915%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f0/Eliza_Dushku_%283756552915%29.jpg/330px-Eliza_Dushku_%283756552915%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f0/Eliza_Dushku_%283756552915%29.jpg/440px-Eliza_Dushku_%283756552915%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4272" data-file-height="2848" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Eliza_Dushku_(3756552915).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Albanian_Americans" title="Albanian Americans">Albanian-American</a> actress <a href="/wiki/Eliza_Dushku" title="Eliza Dushku">Eliza Dushku</a> produced the documentary <a href="/wiki/Dear_Albania" title="Dear Albania">Dear Albania</a><sup id="cite_ref-337" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-337">&#91;336&#93;</a></sup> with a crew from <a href="/wiki/Travel_Channel" title="Travel Channel">Travel Channel</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lonely_Planet" title="Lonely Planet">Lonely Planet</a>, promoting tourism in Albania.</div></div></div>
<p><a href="/wiki/Cinema_of_Albania" title="Cinema of Albania">Cinematography</a> became popular in the 20th century, when foreign films and documentaries were shown in the cities of <a href="/wiki/Shkod%C3%ABr" title="Shkodër">Shkodër</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="Korçë">Korçë</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-338" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-338">&#91;337&#93;</a></sup> The first public showing to occur in Albania was a little-known title, Paddy the Reliable a comical story.
</p><p>The first Albanian films were mostly <a href="/wiki/Documentaries" class="mw-redirect" title="Documentaries">documentaries</a>; the first was about the <a href="/wiki/Monastir_Congress" class="mw-redirect" title="Monastir Congress">Monastir Congress</a> that sanctioned the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_alphabet" title="Albanian alphabet">Albanian alphabet</a> in 1908. During communism, the Albanian Film Institute that later became known as <a href="/wiki/Kinostudio_Shqip%C3%ABria_e_Re" class="mw-redirect" title="Kinostudio Shqipëria e Re">Kinostudio Shqipëria e Re</a> was founded with Soviet assistance, focusing mostly on propaganda of wartime struggles. After 1945, the <a href="/wiki/Communist_state" title="Communist state">communist government</a> founded the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_National_Center_of_Cinematography" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian National Center of Cinematography">Kinostudio Shqipëria e Re</a> in 1952. This was followed by the first Albanian <a href="/wiki/Epic_film" title="Epic film">epic film</a>, the <a href="/wiki/The_Great_Warrior_Skanderbeg" title="The Great Warrior Skanderbeg">Great Warrior Skanderbeg</a>, a cooperation with <a href="/wiki/Soviet_Union" title="Soviet Union">Soviet</a> artists chronicling the life and fight of the Albanian national hero <a href="/wiki/Gjergj_Kastriot_Skanderbeg" class="mw-redirect" title="Gjergj Kastriot Skanderbeg">Skanderbeg</a>. In addition the film was awarded the International Prize at the <a href="/wiki/1954_Cannes_Film_Festival" title="1954 Cannes Film Festival">1954 Cannes Film Festival</a>.
</p><p>By 1990, about 200 movies had been produced, and Albania had over 450 theaters. With the economic transition after the collapse of communism in the 1990s, the Kinostudio was broken up and privatised. A new <a href="/wiki/Albanian_National_Center_of_Cinematography" class="mw-redirect" title="Albanian National Center of Cinematography">National Center of Cinematography</a> was established, while cities built modern cinema theatres showing mostly American movies. The <a href="/wiki/Tirana_International_Film_Festival" title="Tirana International Film Festival">Tirana International Film Festival</a> was established in 2003 and has become the premier and largest film festival in the country as well as in the Balkans. <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs" title="Durrës">Durrës</a> hosts the <a href="/wiki/International_Film_Summerfest_of_Durr%C3%ABs" title="International Film Summerfest of Durrës">International Film Summerfest of Durrës</a>, the second largest international film festival in the country which takes place every year in late August or early September in <a href="/wiki/Durr%C3%ABs_Amphitheatre" class="mw-redirect" title="Durrës Amphitheatre">Durrës Amphitheatre</a>.
</p><p>Notable <a href="/wiki/List_of_Albanian_film_directors" title="List of Albanian film directors">Albanian film directors</a> include <a href="/wiki/Andamion_Murataj" title="Andamion Murataj">Andamion Murataj</a>, <a href="/wiki/Besim_Sahat%C3%A7iu" title="Besim Sahatçiu">Besim Sahatçiu</a>, <a href="/wiki/Xhanfize_Keko" title="Xhanfize Keko">Xhanfize Keko</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dhimit%C3%ABr_Anagnosti" title="Dhimitër Anagnosti">Dhimitër Anagnosti</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kujtim_%C3%87ashku" title="Kujtim Çashku">Kujtim Çashku</a>, <a href="/wiki/Luljeta_Hoxha" title="Luljeta Hoxha">Luljeta Hoxha</a>, <a href="/wiki/Saim_Kokona" title="Saim Kokona">Saim Kokona</a>, <a href="/wiki/Saimir_Kumbaro" title="Saimir Kumbaro">Saimir Kumbaro</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kristaq_Mitro" title="Kristaq Mitro">Kristaq Mitro</a>, <a href="/wiki/Leon_Qafzezi" title="Leon Qafzezi">Leon Qafzezi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gjergj_Xhuvani" title="Gjergj Xhuvani">Gjergj Xhuvani</a>. Famous actors in Albania include <a href="/wiki/Nik_Xhelilaj" title="Nik Xhelilaj">Nik Xhelilaj</a>, <a href="/wiki/Klement_Tinaj" title="Klement Tinaj">Klement Tinaj</a>, <a href="/wiki/Masiela_Lusha" title="Masiela Lusha">Masiela Lusha</a>, <a href="/wiki/Blerim_Destani" title="Blerim Destani">Blerim Destani</a>, <a href="/wiki/Aleksand%C3%ABr_Moisiu" title="Aleksandër Moisiu">Aleksandër Moisiu</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tinka_Kurti" title="Tinka Kurti">Tinka Kurti</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pjet%C3%ABr_Malota" title="Pjetër Malota">Pjetër Malota</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sand%C3%ABr_Prosi" title="Sandër Prosi">Sandër Prosi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Margarita_Xhepa" title="Margarita Xhepa">Margarita Xhepa</a>.
</p><p>There are internationally renowned actors in the Albanian diaspora, such as the <a href="/wiki/Albanian_Americans" title="Albanian Americans">Albanian-Americans</a> <a href="/wiki/Eliza_Dushku" title="Eliza Dushku">Eliza Dushku</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jim_Belushi" title="Jim Belushi">Jim</a> and <a href="/wiki/John_Belushi" title="John Belushi">John Belushi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kosovo_Albanians" title="Kosovo Albanians">Kosovo-Albanians</a> <a href="/wiki/Bekim_Fehmiu" title="Bekim Fehmiu">Bekim Fehmiu</a> and <a href="/wiki/Arta_Dobroshi" title="Arta Dobroshi">Arta Dobroshi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanians_in_Turkey" title="Albanians in Turkey">Turkish-Albanian</a> <a href="/wiki/Barish_Arduch" class="mw-redirect" title="Barish Arduch">Barish Arduç</a>.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Sports">Sports</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Albania_at_the_Olympics" title="Albania at the Olympics">Albania at the Olympics</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albania_at_the_Mediterranean_Games" title="Albania at the Mediterranean Games">Albania at the Mediterranean Games</a></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r889293853/mw-parser-output/.tmulti"/><div class="thumb tmulti tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;max-width:222px"><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:112px;max-width:112px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:164px;overflow:hidden"><a href="/wiki/File:FBBP01_-_FCN_-_20151028_-_Coupe_de_la_Ligue_-_Lorik_Cana.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c3/FBBP01_-_FCN_-_20151028_-_Coupe_de_la_Ligue_-_Lorik_Cana.jpg/110px-FBBP01_-_FCN_-_20151028_-_Coupe_de_la_Ligue_-_Lorik_Cana.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c3/FBBP01_-_FCN_-_20151028_-_Coupe_de_la_Ligue_-_Lorik_Cana.jpg/165px-FBBP01_-_FCN_-_20151028_-_Coupe_de_la_Ligue_-_Lorik_Cana.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c3/FBBP01_-_FCN_-_20151028_-_Coupe_de_la_Ligue_-_Lorik_Cana.jpg/220px-FBBP01_-_FCN_-_20151028_-_Coupe_de_la_Ligue_-_Lorik_Cana.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1420" data-file-height="2128" /></a></div></div><div class="tsingle" style="width:106px;max-width:106px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:164px;overflow:hidden"><a href="/wiki/File:Loro_borici.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/5/54/Loro_borici.jpg/104px-Loro_borici.jpg" decoding="async" width="104" height="165" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/5/54/Loro_borici.jpg/156px-Loro_borici.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/5/54/Loro_borici.jpg/208px-Loro_borici.jpg 2x" data-file-width="743" data-file-height="1177" /></a></div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="thumbcaption" style="text-align:left;background-color:transparent"><a href="/wiki/Lorik_Cana" title="Lorik Cana">Lorik Cana</a> is Albania's most capped player of all time. He captained the French <a href="/wiki/Olympique_de_Marseille" title="Olympique de Marseille">Olympique de Marseille</a>, as well as the <a href="/wiki/Albania_national_football_team" title="Albania national football team">Albanian national team</a>. <small>(<b>left</b>)</small> <a href="/wiki/Loro_Bori%C3%A7i" title="Loro Boriçi">Lorenzo Boriçi</a> captained Albania in winning the <a href="/wiki/1946_Balkan_Cup" title="1946 Balkan Cup">1946 Balkan Cup</a>. <small>(<b>right</b>)</small></div></div></div></div>
<p>Albania participated at the <a href="/wiki/1972_Summer_Olympics" title="1972 Summer Olympics">Olympic Games in 1972</a> for the first time. The country made their Winter Olympic Games debut in <a href="/wiki/Winter_Olympics_2006" class="mw-redirect" title="Winter Olympics 2006">2006</a>. Albania missed the next four games, two of them due to the 1980 and 1984 boycotts, but returned for the 1992 games in <a href="/wiki/1992_Olympic_Winter_Games" class="mw-redirect" title="1992 Olympic Winter Games">Barcelona</a>. Since then, Albania have participated in all games. Albania normally competes in events that include swimming, athletics, weightlifting, shooting and wrestling. The country have been represented by the <a href="/wiki/National_Olympic_Committee_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="National Olympic Committee of Albania">National Olympic Committee of Albania</a> since 1972. The nation has participated at the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Games" title="Mediterranean Games">Mediterranean Games</a> since the games of <a href="/wiki/1987_Mediterranean_Games" title="1987 Mediterranean Games">1987</a> in Syria. The Albanian athletes have won a total of 43 (8 gold, 17 silver and 18 bronze) medals from <a href="/wiki/1987_Mediterranean_Games" title="1987 Mediterranean Games">1987</a> to <a href="/wiki/2013_Mediterranean_Games" title="2013 Mediterranean Games">2013</a>.
</p><p>Popular sports in Albania include <a href="/wiki/Football_in_Albania" title="Football in Albania">Football</a>, Weightlifting, <a href="/wiki/Albania_national_basketball_team" title="Albania national basketball team">Basketball</a>, Volleyball, Tennis, Swimming, <a href="/wiki/Rugby_union" title="Rugby union">Rugby</a>, and Gymnastics. Football is by far the most popular sport in Albania. It is governed by the <a href="/wiki/Football_Association_of_Albania" class="mw-redirect" title="Football Association of Albania">Football Association of Albania</a> (<a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a>: <i lang="sq">Federata Shqiptare e Futbollit</i>, F.SH.F.), which was created in 1930 and has membership in <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> and <a href="/wiki/UEFA" title="UEFA">UEFA</a>. Football arrived in Albania early in the 20th century when the inhabitants of the northern city of <a href="/wiki/Shkod%C3%ABr" title="Shkodër">Shkodër</a> were surprised to see a strange game being played by students at a Christian mission.
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Albania_national_football_team" title="Albania national football team">Albania national football team</a>, ranking 51st in the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Rankings" title="FIFA World Rankings">World</a> in 2017 (highest 22nd on 22 August 2015) have won the <a href="/wiki/1946_Balkan_Cup" title="1946 Balkan Cup">1946 Balkan Cup</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Rothmans_International_Tournament_2000" class="mw-redirect" title="Rothmans International Tournament 2000">Malta Rothmans International Tournament 2000</a>, but had never participated in any major <a href="/wiki/UEFA" title="UEFA">UEFA</a> or <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> tournament, until <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">UEFA Euro 2016</a>, Albania's first ever appearance at the continental tournament and at a major men's football tournament.
