Albania scored their first ever goal in a major tournament and secured their first ever win in European Championship when they beat <a href="/wiki/Romania_national_football_team" title="Romania national football team">Romania</a> by 1–0 in a <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">UEFA Euro 2016</a> match on 19 June 2016.<sup id="cite_ref-339" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-339">&#91;338&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-340" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-340">&#91;339&#93;</a></sup> The most successful football clubs in the country are <a href="/wiki/KF_Sk%C3%ABnderbeu_Kor%C3%A7%C3%AB" title="KF Skënderbeu Korçë">Skënderbeu</a>, <a href="/wiki/KF_Tirana" title="KF Tirana">KF Tirana</a>, <a href="/wiki/FK_Dinamo_Tirana" title="FK Dinamo Tirana">Dinamo Tirana</a>, <a href="/wiki/FK_Partizani_Tirana" title="FK Partizani Tirana">Partizani</a> and <a href="/wiki/KF_Vllaznia_Shkod%C3%ABr" title="KF Vllaznia Shkodër">Vllaznia</a>.
</p><p>Weightlifting is one of the most successful individual sport for the Albanians, with the national team winning medals at the <a href="/wiki/European_Weightlifting_Championships" title="European Weightlifting Championships">European Weightlifting Championships</a> and the rest international competitions. Albanian weightlifters have won a total of 16 medals at the <a href="/wiki/European_Weightlifting_Championships" title="European Weightlifting Championships">European Championships</a> with 1 of them being gold, 7 silver and 8 bronze. In the <a href="/wiki/World_Weightlifting_Championships" title="World Weightlifting Championships">World Weightlifting Championships</a>, the Albanian weightlifting team has won in <a href="/wiki/1972_World_Weightlifting_Championships" title="1972 World Weightlifting Championships">1972</a> a gold in <a href="/wiki/2002_World_Weightlifting_Championships" title="2002 World Weightlifting Championships">2002</a> a silver and in <a href="/wiki/2011_World_Weightlifting_Championships" title="2011 World Weightlifting Championships">2011</a> a bronze medal.
</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Diaspora">Diaspora</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Albanian_diaspora" title="Albanian diaspora">Albanian diaspora</a> and <a href="/wiki/Category:Albanian_diaspora" title="Category:Albanian diaspora">Albanian communities</a></div>
<p>Historically, the Albanian people have established several communities in many regions throughout <a href="/wiki/Southern_Europe" title="Southern Europe">Southern Europe</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Albanian_diaspora" title="Albanian diaspora">Albanian diaspora</a> has been formed since the late <a href="/wiki/Middle_Ages" title="Middle Ages">Middle Ages</a>, when they emigrated to places such as <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>, especially in <a href="/wiki/Sicily" title="Sicily">Sicily</a> and <a href="/wiki/Calabria" title="Calabria">Calabria</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greece</a> to escape either various socio-political difficulties or the <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Empire" title="Ottoman Empire">Ottoman conquest</a> of Albania.<sup id="cite_ref-341" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-341">&#91;340&#93;</a></sup> Following the <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_communism_in_Albania" title="Fall of communism in Albania">fall of communism</a>, large numbers of Albanians have migrated to countries such as <a href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia">Australia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Canada" title="Canada">Canada</a>, <a href="/wiki/France" title="France">France</a>, <a href="/wiki/Germany" title="Germany">Germany</a>, <a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greece</a>, <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scandinavia" title="Scandinavia">Scandinavia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Switzerland" title="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>, <a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> and the <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a>. Albanian <a href="/wiki/Minority_group" title="Minority group">minorities</a> are present in the neighboring territories such as the west of <a href="/wiki/North_Macedonia" title="North Macedonia">North Macedonia</a>, the east of <a href="/wiki/Montenegro" title="Montenegro">Montenegro</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a> in its entirety and southern <a href="/wiki/Serbia" title="Serbia">Serbia</a>. In <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Kosovo</a>, Albanians make up the largest ethnic group in the country. Altogether, the number of ethnic Albanian living abroad its territory is estimated to be higher than the total population inside the territory of Albania.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2>
<div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-status-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-status_7-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-status_7-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"> Kosovo is the subject of a territorial dispute between the <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Republic of Kosovo</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Serbia" title="Serbia">Republic of Serbia</a>. The Republic of Kosovo <a href="/wiki/2008_Kosovo_declaration_of_independence" title="2008 Kosovo declaration of independence">unilaterally declared independence</a> on 17 February 2008, but <a href="/wiki/Kosovo%E2%80%93Serbia_relations" title="Kosovo–Serbia relations">Serbia continues to claim</a> it as part of its <a href="/wiki/Autonomous_Province_of_Kosovo_and_Metohija" title="Autonomous Province of Kosovo and Metohija">own sovereign territory</a>. The two governments <a href="/wiki/Belgrade%E2%80%93Pristina_negotiations" title="Belgrade–Pristina negotiations">began to normalise relations</a> in 2013, as part of the <a href="/wiki/Brussels_Agreement_(2013)" title="Brussels Agreement (2013)">2013 Brussels Agreement</a>. Kosovo has been recognized as an independent state by <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">112</a> out of 193 <a href="/wiki/Member_states_of_the_United_Nations" title="Member states of the United Nations">United Nations member states</a>, while <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">12</a> states have recognized Kosovo only to later withdraw their recognition.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2>
<div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;">

<li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20171014102732/http://www.instat.gov.al/al/themes/popullsia/publications/books/2017/popullsia-e-shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB,-1-janar-2017.aspx">"404"</a>. <li id="cite_note-Lloshi-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Lloshi_22-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Lloshi, Xhevat (1999). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books/about/Handbuch_der_S%C3%BCdosteuropa_Linguistik.html?id=Phyvk2tPaYQC&amp;redir_esc=y">"Albanian"</a>. Wiesbaden: Otto Harrassowitz Verlag. p.&#160;277. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9783447039390" title="Special:BookSources/9783447039390"><bdi>9783447039390</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Albanian&amp;rft.btitle=Handbuch+der+S%C3%BCdosteuropa-Linguistik&amp;rft.place=Wiesbaden&amp;rft.pages=277&amp;rft.pub=Otto+Harrassowitz+Verlag&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.isbn=9783447039390&amp;rft.aulast=Lloshi&amp;rft.aufirst=Xhevat&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%2Fabout%2FHandbuch_der_S%25C3%25BCdosteuropa_Linguistik.html%3Fid%3DPhyvk2tPaYQC%26redir_esc%3Dy&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-23">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Kristo Frasheri. <i>History of Albania (A Brief Overview)</i>. Tirana, 1964.</span>

<li id="cite_note-24"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-24">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web">Lloshi, Xhevat. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110709114947/http://mirror.undp.org/albania/download/pdf/albanian.pdf">"The Albanian Language"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <li id="cite_note-Prendi-25"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Prendi_25-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Prendi_25-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">F. Prendi, "The Prehistory of Albania", <i>The Cambridge Ancient History</i>, 2nd edn., vol. 3, part 1: <i><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=vXljf8JqmkoC&amp;pg=PA187">The Prehistory of the Balkans; and the Middle East and the Aegean World, Tenth to Eighth Centuries B.C.</a></i>, ed. <li id="cite_note-26"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-26">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Hammond, N. G. L. (1974). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=MUkbAAAAYAAJ&amp;q=%22At+Sesklo+there+are+links+with+Mati%2C+Pazhok%2C+and+Leucas+in+bronze+tweezers%2C+one-edged+bronze+knives+with+a+snout%2C+and+hair-rings+of+gold+wire+in+sets+of+three.+In+short%2C+if+our+inferences+from+the+tumulus-burials+are+correct%2C+some+Kurgan+peoples+reached+places+in+the+territory+of+south-western+Macedonia%2C+central+and+southern+Albania+and+Leucas+around+the+middle+of+the+third+millennium.++From+there+two+streams+entered+Greece%2C+mainly+in+the+MH+period%2C+one+by+sea+and+the+other+by+land+.+The+Indo-European+language+which+they+spoke+was+the+ancestor+not+of+Illyrian+but+of+Greek%2C+and+within+this+%27Ur-Greek%27+it+is+probable+that+the+seeds+of+the+Ionic+dialect+were+carried+into+Attica+and+the+Peloponnese+and+the+seeds+of+the+Aeolic+dialect+into+Thessaly+and+farther+south.%22#search_anchor"><i>Grave circles in Albania and Macedonia</i></a>. <i>Bronze Age Migrations in the Aegean: Archaeological and Linguistic Problems in Greek Prehistory</i>. <b>4</b>. British Association for Mycenaean Studies. pp.&#160;189–198. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7156-0580-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-7156-0580-6"><bdi>978-0-7156-0580-6</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">16 March</span> 2011</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Grave+circles+in+Albania+and+Macedonia&amp;rft.pages=189-198&amp;rft.pub=British+Association+for+Mycenaean+Studies&amp;rft.date=1974&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-7156-0580-6&amp;rft.aulast=Hammond&amp;rft.aufirst=N.+G.+L.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2F%3Fid%3DMUkbAAAAYAAJ%26q%3D%2522At%2BSesklo%2Bthere%2Bare%2Blinks%2Bwith%2BMati%252C%2BPazhok%252C%2Band%2BLeucas%2Bin%2Bbronze%2Btweezers%252C%2Bone-edged%2Bbronze%2Bknives%2Bwith%2Ba%2Bsnout%252C%2Band%2Bhair-rings%2Bof%2Bgold%2Bwire%2Bin%2Bsets%2Bof%2Bthree.%2BIn%2Bshort%252C%2Bif%2Bour%2Binferences%2Bfrom%2Bthe%2Btumulus-burials%2Bare%2Bcorrect%252C%2Bsome%2BKurgan%2Bpeoples%2Breached%2Bplaces%2Bin%2Bthe%2Bterritory%2Bof%2Bsouth-western%2BMacedonia%252C%2Bcentral%2Band%2Bsouthern%2BAlbania%2Band%2BLeucas%2Baround%2Bthe%2Bmiddle%2Bof%2Bthe%2Bthird%2Bmillennium.%2B%2BFrom%2Bthere%2Btwo%2Bstreams%2Bentered%2BGreece%252C%2Bmainly%2Bin%2Bthe%2BMH%2Bperiod%252C%2Bone%2Bby%2Bsea%2Band%2Bthe%2Bother%2Bby%2Bland%2B.%2BThe%2BIndo-European%2Blanguage%2Bwhich%2Bthey%2Bspoke%2Bwas%2Bthe%2Bancestor%2Bnot%2Bof%2BIllyrian%2Bbut%2Bof%2BGreek%252C%2Band%2Bwithin%2Bthis%2B%2527Ur-Greek%2527%2Bit%2Bis%2Bprobable%2Bthat%2Bthe%2Bseeds%2Bof%2Bthe%2BIonic%2Bdialect%2Bwere%2Bcarried%2Binto%2BAttica%2Band%2Bthe%2BPeloponnese%2Band%2Bthe%2Bseeds%2Bof%2Bthe%2BAeolic%2Bdialect%2Binto%2BThessaly%2Band%2Bfarther%2Bsouth.%2522%23search_anchor&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-27"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-27">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Nicholas Geoffrey Lemprière Hammond, Guy Thompson Griffith <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=PnEJAQAAIAAJ&amp;q=%22+The+centre+which+repeatedly+gave+off+this+style+of+design+seems+to+have+been+Albania.+As+we+have+concluded+on+other+grounds+that+this+area+was+a+reservoir+of+Greek-+speaking+%22">A History of Macedonia: Historical geography and prehistory</a>. Clarendon Press, 1972, p. 290</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Hammond1993-28"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Hammond1993_28-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Nicholas Geoffrey Lemprière Hammond. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=eW0iAQAAIAAJ&amp;q=%22The+leading+dans+of+both+groups+buried+their+dead+under+a+circular+tumulus+of+soil+in+the+second+millennium+BC+The+main+reservoir+of+the+Greek+speakers+was+central+Albania+and+Epirus%2C+and+it+was+from+there+that+the+founders+of+Mycenaean+civilization+came+to+Mycenae%2C+c.+1600+BC%2C+and+burried+their+nobles+in+Grave+Circle+B.+Further+waves+of+immigrants+passing+through+and+from+Epirus+people+the+Greek+peninsula+and+islands+the+last+wave%2C+called+Dorians%2C+settling+from+1100+onwards.+The+lands+they+left+in+central+Albania+were+occupied+during+the+so-called+Dark+Age+%28U10-800BC%29+by+Illyrians%2C+whose+main+habitat+was+in+the+area+now+called+Bosnia%2C%22">Studies: Further studies on various topics</a>. A.M. Hakkert, 1993, p. 231: "The leading dans of both groups buried their dead under a circular tumulus of soil in the second millennium BC The main reservoir of the Greek speakers was central Albania and Epirus, and it was from there that the founders of Mycenaean civilization came to Mycenae, c. 1600 BC, and buried their nobles in Grave Circle B. Further waves of immigrants passing through and from Epirus people the Greek peninsula and islands the last wave, called Dorians, settling from 1100 onwards. The lands they left in central Albania were occupied during the so-called Dark Age (U10-800BC) by Illyrians, whose main habitat was in the area now called Bosnia,"</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-29"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-29">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFRoismanWorthington2010" class="citation">Roisman, Joseph; Worthington, Ian (2010), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=lkYFVJ3U-BIC"><i>A Companion to Ancient Macedonia</i></a>, John Wiley and Sons, <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4051-7936-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4051-7936-2"><bdi>978-1-4051-7936-2</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=A+Companion+to+Ancient+Macedonia&amp;rft.pub=John+Wiley+and+Sons&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4051-7936-2&amp;rft.aulast=Roisman&amp;rft.aufirst=Joseph&amp;rft.au=Worthington%2C+Ian&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DlkYFVJ3U-BIC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Boardman629-30"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Boardman629_30-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">John Boardman. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=vXljf8JqmkoC&amp;pg=PA629#v=onepage&amp;q=%22tribes%20which%20held%20the%20Zeta%20valley%2C%20and%20as%20such%20they%20may%20have%20been%20the%20immediate%20neighbours%20of%20Greek-speaking%20tribes%20in%20the%20Bronze%20Age%22">The prehistory of the Balkans and the Middle East and the Aegean world</a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-31"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-31">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Wilkes John. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=4Nv6SPRKqs8C&amp;q=%22astride%20the%20modern%20frontier%20between%20Albania%20and%20Yugoslav%20Montenegro%22">The Illyrians</a>. <li id="cite_note-32"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-32">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Illyrians (The Peoples of Europe) by John Wilkes, 1996, <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/><a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-631-19807-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-631-19807-9">978-0-631-19807-9</a>, page 92, "Appian's description of the Illyrian territories records a southern boundary with Chaonia and Thesprotia, where ancient Epirus began south of river Aoous (Vjose)"  <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=4Nv6SPRKqs8C&amp;lpg=PP1&amp;pg=PR20">also map</a></span>

<li id="cite_note-BideleuxJeffries2007-42"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-BideleuxJeffries2007_42-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Bideleux, Robert; Jeffries, Ian (24 January 2007). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=G6iBAgAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA25"><i>Balkans: A Post-Communist History</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-referenceworks.brillonline-60"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-referenceworks.brillonline_60-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-referenceworks.brillonline_60-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-referenceworks.brillonline_60-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Clayer, Nathalie (2012). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://referenceworks.brillonline.com/entries/encyclopaedia-of-islam-3/albania-COM_23054">"Albania"</a> in <i>Encyclopaedia of Islam</i>, Gudrun Krämer, Denis Matringe, Rokovet, John Nawas, Everett Rowson (eds.). Brill Online.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-61"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-61">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a href="/wiki/Observator_Cultural" title="Observator Cultural">Observator Cultural</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.observatorcultural.ro/articol/dor-de-dunare-si-alte-nostalgii-cosmopolite-2/">"Dor de Dunăre şi alte nostalgii cosmopolite"</a>. <i>observatorcultural.ro</i> (in Romanian).</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=observatorcultural.ro&amp;rft.atitle=Dor+de+Dun%C4%83re+%C5%9Fi+alte+nostalgii+cosmopolite&amp;rft.au=Observator+Cultural&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.observatorcultural.ro%2Farticol%2Fdor-de-dunare-si-alte-nostalgii-cosmopolite-2%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-62"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-62">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFKopecekErsoyGorniKechriotis2006" class="citation">Kopecek, Michal; Ersoy, Ahmed; Gorni, Maciej; Kechriotis, Vangelis; Manchev, Boyan; Trencsenyi, Balazs; Turda, Marius (2006), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=k5Vsjg508EYC&amp;pg=PA349"><i>Discourses of collective identity in Central and Southeast Europe (1770–1945)</i></a>, <b>1</b>, Budapest, Hungary: Central European University Press, p.&#160;348, <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-963-7326-52-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-963-7326-52-3"><bdi>978-963-7326-52-3</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">18 January</span> 2011</span>, <q>The position of the League in the beginning was based on religious solidarity. It was even called <i>Komiteti i Myslimanëve të Vërtetë</i> (The Committee of the Real Muslims)&#160;... decisions are taken and supported mostly by landlords and people closely connected with Ottoman administration and religious authorities..</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Discourses+of+collective+identity+in+Central+and+Southeast+Europe+%281770%E2%80%931945%29&amp;rft.place=Budapest%2C+Hungary&amp;rft.pages=348&amp;rft.pub=Central+European+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=978-963-7326-52-3&amp;rft.aulast=Kopecek&amp;rft.aufirst=Michal&amp;rft.au=Ersoy%2C+Ahmed&amp;rft.au=Gorni%2C+Maciej&amp;rft.au=Kechriotis%2C+Vangelis&amp;rft.au=Manchev%2C+Boyan&amp;rft.au=Trencsenyi%2C+Balazs&amp;rft.au=Turda%2C+Marius&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dk5Vsjg508EYC%26pg%3DPA349&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-72"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-72">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web">Zaharia, Perikli (24 March 2003). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110616151647/http://www.cecl.gr/RigasNetwork/databank/REPORTS/r23/ZAHARIA.html">"The post – 1989 constitutional course of south east Europe"</a>. <li id="cite_note-73"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-73">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFSeton-WatsonJ._Dover_WilsonAlfred_E._ZimmernArthur_Greenwood2004" class="citation">Seton-Watson, R.W.; J. Dover Wilson; Alfred E. Zimmern; Arthur Greenwood (10 January 2004) [1915], <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20121113042806/http://www.gutenberg.org/files/10668/10668.txt">"III Germany"</a>, <i>The War and Democracy</i> (1st ed.), London: MacMillan, archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.gutenberg.org/files/10668/10668.txt">the original</a> on 13 November 2012, <q>Prince William of Wied, the first Prince of Albania</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=III+Germany&amp;rft.btitle=The+War+and+Democracy&amp;rft.place=London&amp;rft.edition=1st&amp;rft.pub=MacMillan&amp;rft.date=2004-01-10&amp;rft.aulast=Seton-Watson&amp;rft.aufirst=R.W.&amp;rft.au=J.+Dover+Wilson&amp;rft.au=Alfred+E.+Zimmern&amp;rft.au=Arthur+Greenwood&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.gutenberg.org%2Ffiles%2F10668%2F10668.txt&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-74"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-74">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a href="/wiki/Robert_Elsie" title="Robert Elsie">Elsie, Robert</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110717003848/http://www.albanianphotography.net/en/dmm.html">"Albania under prince Wied"</a>. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.albanianphotography.net/en/dmm.html">the original</a> on 17 July 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">25 January</span> 2011</span>. <q>pro-Ottoman forces&#160;... were opposed to the increasing Western influence&#160;... In November 1913, these forces,&#160;... had offered the vacant Albanian throne to General Izzet Pasha&#160;... War Minister who was of Albanian origin.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Albania+under+prince+Wied&amp;rft.aulast=Elsie&amp;rft.aufirst=Robert&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.albanianphotography.net%2Fen%2Fdmm.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-75"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-75">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFJelavich1999" class="citation">Jelavich, Barbara (1999) [1983], <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=Hd-or3qtqrsC&amp;pg=PA100"><i>History of the Balkans: Twentieth century</i></a>, <b>2</b>, Cambridge, United Kingdom: The Press Syndicate of University of Cambridge, p.&#160;103, <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-27459-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-521-27459-3"><bdi>978-0-521-27459-3</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">25 January</span> 2011</span>, <q>peasants..willing listeners to Ottoman propaganda&#160;... attached the new regime as a tool of the beys and Christian powers</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=History+of+the+Balkans%3A+Twentieth+century&amp;rft.place=Cambridge%2C+United+Kingdom&amp;rft.pages=103&amp;rft.pub=The+Press+Syndicate+of+University+of+Cambridge&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-521-27459-3&amp;rft.aulast=Jelavich&amp;rft.aufirst=Barbara&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2F%3Fid%3DHd-or3qtqrsC%26pg%3DPA100&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-76"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-76">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Bowden, William (2003). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=IjsbAAAAYAAJ&amp;q=%22+Autonomous+Republic+of+Northern+Epirus.%22"><i>Epirus Vetus&#160;: the archaeology of a late antique province</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-77"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-77">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">ed, Gregory C. <li id="cite_note-115"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-115">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/99">"Natural and Cultural Heritage of the Ohrid region"</a>. <i>whc.unesco.org</i>. pp.&#160;UNESCO. <q>Situated on the shores of Lake Ohrid, the town of Ohrid is one of the oldest human settlements in Europe; Lake Ohrid is a superlative natural phenomenon, providing refuge for numerous endemic and relict freshwater species of flora and fauna dating from the tertiary period. As a deep and ancient lake of tectonic origin, Lake Ohrid has existed continuously for approximately two to three million years.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=whc.unesco.org&amp;rft.atitle=Natural+and+Cultural+Heritage+of+the+Ohrid+region&amp;rft.pages=UNESCO&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwhc.unesco.org%2Fen%2Flist%2F99&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-123"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-123">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation journal">Hughes, Philip D. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">27 August</span> 2010</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Arctic%2C+Antarctic%2C+and+Alpine+Research&amp;rft.atitle=Twenty-first+Century+Glaciers+and+Climate+in+the+Prokletije+Mountains%2C+Albania+Journal+Arctic%2C+Antarctic%2C+and+Alpine+Research+Publisher+Institute+of+Arctic+and+Alpine+Research%2C+University+of+Colorado+ISSN+1523-0430+%28Print%29+1938%E2%80%934246+%28Online%29+Issue+Volume+41%2C+Number+4+%2F+November+2009+DOI+10.1657%2F1938-4246-41.4.455+Pages+455%E2%80%93459+Online+Date%3A+30+November+2009&amp;rft.volume=41&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.pages=455-459&amp;rft.date=2009-11-30&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1657%2F1938-4246-41.4.455&amp;rft.aulast=Hughes&amp;rft.aufirst=Philip+D.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Finstaar.metapress.com%2Fcontent%2F273213h3t4370272%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-124"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-124">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.cepf.net/sites/default/files/mediterranean-basin-2017-ecosystem-profile-english_0.pdf">"Mediterranean Basin Biodiversity Hotspot"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>cepf.net</i>. <li id="cite_note-132"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-132">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.worldatlas.com/articles/the-national-parks-of-albania-protecting-the-natural-treasures-of-the-country.html">"The National Parks Of Albania The fifteen national parks in Albania encompass an area of 210,668.48 hectares which accounts for about 3.65% of the overall territory of the country"</a>. <i>worldatlas.com</i>. <q>The territory of Albania can be divided into four ecoregions: Dinaric Alpine (mixed forests in the far north). Balcanic (mixed forest in the north-east). Pindus mountain (mixed forests covering the central and southeast mountains). Illyrian deciduous (forest covering the rest of the country).</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=worldatlas.com&amp;rft.atitle=The+National+Parks+Of+Albania+The+fifteen+national+parks+in+Albania+encompass+an+area+of+210%2C668.48+hectares+which+accounts+for+about+3.65%25+of+the+overall+territory+of+the+country.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.worldatlas.com%2Farticles%2Fthe-national-parks-of-albania-protecting-the-natural-treasures-of-the-country.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-Stevenson2011-180"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Stevenson2011_180-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Tom Stevenson (2011). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=8S7IkQEACAAJ"><i>The Sotheby's Wine Encyclopedia</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-199"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-199">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book"><i>Sustainable Development of Sea-Corridors and Coastal Waters: The TEN ECOPORT project in South East Europe</i> (Chrysostomos Stylios, Tania Floqi, Jordan Marinski, Leonardo Damiani ed.). <li id="cite_note-RFE/RL_Research_Report:_Weekly_Analyses_from_the_RFE/RL_Research_Institute-248"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-RFE/RL_Research_Report:_Weekly_Analyses_from_the_RFE/RL_Research_Institute_248-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=RxgkAQAAIAAJ"><i>RFE/RL Research Report: Weekly Analyses from the RFE/RL Research Institute</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-BideleuxJeffries2006-249"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-BideleuxJeffries2006_249-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Robert Bideleux; Ian Jeffries (15 November 2006). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=5jrHOKsU9pEC&amp;pg=PA49"><i>The Balkans: A Post-Communist History</i></a>. Routledge. p.&#160;49. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-203-96911-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-203-96911-3"><bdi>978-0-203-96911-3</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">6 September</span> 2013</span>. <q>The Albanian government claimed that there were only 60,000, based on the biased 1989 census, whereas the Greek government claimed that there were upwards of 300,000. Most Western estimates were around the 200,000 mark&#160;...</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Balkans%3A+A+Post-Communist+History&amp;rft.pages=49&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2006-11-15&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-203-96911-3&amp;rft.au=Robert+Bideleux&amp;rft.au=Ian+Jeffries&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D5jrHOKsU9pEC%26pg%3DPA49&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-Ramet1998-250"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Ramet1998_250-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Sabrina P. Ramet (1998). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=ZvMi6paTOlcC&amp;pg=PA222"><i>Nihil Obstat: Religion, Politics, and Social Change in East-Central Europe and Russia</i></a>. Duke University Press. p.&#160;222. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8223-2070-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8223-2070-8"><bdi>978-0-8223-2070-8</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">6 September</span> 2013</span>. <q>that between 250,000 and 300,000 Orthodox Greeks reside in Albania</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Nihil+Obstat%3A+Religion%2C+Politics%2C+and+Social+Change+in+East-Central+Europe+and+Russia&amp;rft.pages=222&amp;rft.pub=Duke+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1998&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8223-2070-8&amp;rft.au=Sabrina+P.+Ramet&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DZvMi6paTOlcC%26pg%3DPA222&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Jeffries2002-251"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Jeffries2002_251-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Ian Jeffries (2002). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=L7PBtDujYt0C&amp;pg=PA69"><i>Eastern Europe at the Turn of the Twenty-first Century: A Guide to the Economies in Transition</i></a>. Routledge. p.&#160;69. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-415-23671-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-415-23671-3"><bdi>978-0-415-23671-3</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">6 September</span> 2013</span>. <q>It is difficult to know how many ethnic Greeks there are in Albania. The Greek government, it is typically claimed, says that there are around 300,000 ethnic Greeks in Albania, but most Western estimates are around the 200,000 mark.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Eastern+Europe+at+the+Turn+of+the+Twenty-first+Century%3A+A+Guide+to+the+Economies+in+Transition&amp;rft.pages=69&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2002&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-415-23671-3&amp;rft.au=Ian+Jeffries&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DL7PBtDujYt0C%26pg%3DPA69&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Publications2008-252"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Publications2008_252-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Europa Publications (24 June 2008). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Oabsu05rJNoC"><i>The Europa World Year Book 2008</i></a>. Taylor &amp; Francis. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-85743-452-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-85743-452-1"><bdi>978-1-85743-452-1</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">22 December</span> 2012</span>. <q>&#160;and Greece formally annulled claims to North Epirus (southern Albania), where there is a sizeable Greek minority.&#160;... strained by concerns relating to the treatment of ethnic Greeks residing in Albania (numbering an estimated 300,000)&#160;...</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Europa+World+Year+Book+2008&amp;rft.pub=Taylor+%26+Francis&amp;rft.date=2008-06-24&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-85743-452-1&amp;rft.au=Europa+Publications&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DOabsu05rJNoC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-kathimerini-270"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-kathimerini_270-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kathimerini_270-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kathimerini_270-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.kathimerini.gr/138922/article/epikairothta/politikh/h-ellhnikh-glwssa-ginetai-ka8omiloymenh-sthn-alvania">"The Greek language is widely spoken in Albania (H Ελληνική γλώσσα γίνεται καθομιλουμένη στην Αλβανία)"</a>. Kathimerini<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">12 June</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Greek+language+is+widely+spoken+in+Albania+%28H+%CE%95%CE%BB%CE%BB%CE%B7%CE%BD%CE%B9%CE%BA%CE%AE+%CE%B3%CE%BB%CF%8E%CF%83%CF%83%CE%B1+%CE%B3%CE%AF%CE%BD%CE%B5%CF%84%CE%B1%CE%B9+%CE%BA%CE%B1%CE%B8%CE%BF%CE%BC%CE%B9%CE%BB%CE%BF%CF%85%CE%BC%CE%AD%CE%BD%CE%B7+%CF%83%CF%84%CE%B7%CE%BD+%CE%91%CE%BB%CE%B2%CE%B1%CE%BD%CE%AF%CE%B1%29&amp;rft.pub=Kathimerini&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.kathimerini.gr%2F138922%2Farticle%2Fepikairothta%2Fpolitikh%2Fh-ellhnikh-glwssa-ginetai-ka8omiloymenh-sthn-alvania&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-273"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-273">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Nitsiakos, Vasilēs G. <li id="cite_note-Shkurtaj2017-275"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Shkurtaj2017_275-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Gjovalin Shkurtaj (2017). <i>Urgjenca gjuhësore: -huazime të zëvendësueshme me fjalë shqipe-&#160;: (fjalorth)</i>. Naimi. pp.&#160;15–16. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9789928234049" title="Special:BookSources/9789928234049"><bdi>9789928234049</bdi></a>. <q>Sic u permend me lart, per shkak te shkaqeve kulturore dhe ekonomike, trendet e mesimit te gjuheve nga te rinjte (grupmosha deri ne 25 vjec) ndryshojne. Keto trende jane percaktues i nje sere fenomeneve shoqerore, sic do te shohim me tej. Keshtu nga viti 2000 e ketej, gjuha angleze, gjermane dhe ajo turke kane pasur nje rritje te interest. Gjuha italiane, por edhe ajo franceze kane pasur nje stabilitet, pra as rritje dhe as ulje te interesit te pergjithshem nga ana e grupmoshes te siperpermendur. Vihet re se gjuha greke ka pesuar nje renie te forte te interesit. Ne fakt, shumica e interesit ka rene per kete gjuhe. Arsyet per kete gjuhe specifike do ti trajtojme me tej ne kapitulin e trete.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Urgjenca+gjuh%C3%ABsore%3A+-huazime+t%C3%AB+z%C3%ABvend%C3%ABsueshme+me+fjal%C3%AB+shqipe-+%3A+%28fjalorth%29&amp;rft.pages=15-16&amp;rft.pub=Naimi&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft.isbn=9789928234049&amp;rft.au=Gjovalin+Shkurtaj&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-285"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-285">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160701165316/http://shqiptarja.com/home/1/kisha-ortodokse-censusi-fshehu-17-te-besimtareve-137234.html">"Kisha Ortodokse: Censusi fshehu 17% të besimtarëve"</a>. Shqiptarja.com. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.shqiptarja.com/home/1/kisha-ortodokse-censusi-fshehu-17-te-besimtareve-137234.html">the original</a> on 1 July 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Jazexhi22-287"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Jazexhi22_287-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFJazexhi2013" class="citation book">Jazexhi, Olsi (2013). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=ia5AAQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA351&amp;lpg=PA351&amp;q=albania">"Albania"</a>. Leiden: Brill. pp.&#160;21–36. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9789004255869" title="Special:BookSources/9789004255869"><bdi>9789004255869</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Albania&amp;rft.btitle=Yearbook+of+Muslims+in+Europe%3A+Volume+5&amp;rft.place=Leiden&amp;rft.pages=21-36&amp;rft.pub=Brill&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.isbn=9789004255869&amp;rft.aulast=Jazexhi&amp;rft.aufirst=Olsi&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2F%3Fid%3Dia5AAQAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA351%26lpg%3DPA351%26q%3Dalbania&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/> "Some officials from the Muslim community of Albania have expressed their unhappiness with the census result, claiming that according to their calculations the percentage of the Muslims was 70%. They have also claimed that many members of the Muslim Community were not counted in the census."</span>

<li id="cite_note-301"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-301">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Jørgen Nielsen; Samim Akgönül; Ahmet Alibašić; Egdunas Racius (2013). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=ia5AAQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA351&amp;lpg=PA351&amp;q=albania">"Albania"</a>. <i>Yearbook of Muslims in Europe</i>. <b>5</b>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-Merdjanova673940-302"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Merdjanova673940_302-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Merdjanova673940_302-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFMerdjanova2013" class="citation book">Merdjanova, Ina (2013). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=6eYRDAAAQBAJ&amp;printsec=frontcover&amp;q=Islam%20Albania%20Ottoman"><i>Rediscovering the Umma: Muslims in the Balkans between nationalism and transnationalism</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-334"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-334">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFLeyla_Belkaid2013" class="citation">Leyla Belkaid (2013), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/?id=lazWAQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA15&amp;q=moons%2C%20stars%2C%20and%20snakes">"Albania"</a>,  in Jill Condra (ed.), <i>Encyclopedia of National Dress: Traditional Clothing Around the World</i>, <b>I</b>, ABC-CLIO, p.&#160;16, <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780313376368" title="Special:BookSources/9780313376368"><bdi>9780313376368</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Albania&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclopedia+of+National+Dress%3A+Traditional+Clothing+Around+the+World&amp;rft.pages=16&amp;rft.pub=ABC-CLIO&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.isbn=9780313376368&amp;rft.au=Leyla+Belkaid&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2F%3Fid%3DlazWAQAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA15%26q%3Dmoons%252C%2520stars%252C%2520and%2520snakes&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-335"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-335">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Encyclopedia of Indo-European Culture By J. P. Mallory, Douglas Q. Adams Edition: illustrated Published by Taylor &amp; Francis, 1997 <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/><a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-884964-98-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-884964-98-5">978-1-884964-98-5</a>, <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/><a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-884964-98-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-884964-98-5">978-1-884964-98-5</a> (<i>"Although there are some lexical items that appear to be shared between Romanian (and by extension Dacian) and Albanian, by far the strongest connections can be argued between Albanian and Illyrian."</i> page 11)
Concise Encyclopedia of Languages of the World By Keith Brown, Sarah Ogilvie Contributor Keith Brown, Sarah Ogilvie Edition: illustrated Published by Elsevier, 2008 <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/><a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-08-087774-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-08-087774-7">978-0-08-087774-7</a>, <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/><a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-08-087774-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-08-087774-7">978-0-08-087774-7</a> (<i>"Albanian constitutes a single branch of the Indo-European family of languages. It is often held to be related to Illyrian, a poorly attested language spoken in the Western Balkans in classical times"</i> page 22)</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-336"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-336">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20080203035926/http://linguistlist.org/forms/langs/LLDescription.cfm?code=txh">"The Thracian language"</a>. The Linguist List. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://linguistlist.org/forms/langs/LLDescription.cfm?code=txh">the original</a> on 3 February 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">27 January</span> 2008</span>. <q>An ancient language of Southern Balkans, belonging to the Satem group of Indo-European. This language is the most likely ancestor of modern Albanian (which is also a Satem language), though the evidence is scanty. 1st Millennium BC&#160;– 500&#160;AD.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Thracian+language&amp;rft.pub=The+Linguist+List&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Flinguistlist.org%2Fforms%2Flangs%2FLLDescription.cfm%3Fcode%3Dtxh&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-337"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-337">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news">Dushku, Eliza (2 September 2011). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.com/eliza-dushku/albania-travel-_b_946341.html">"Why You Must Visit Albania"</a>. <i>The Huffington Post</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">11 March</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Huffington+Post&amp;rft.atitle=Why+You+Must+Visit+Albania&amp;rft.date=2011-09-02&amp;rft.aulast=Dushku&amp;rft.aufirst=Eliza&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.huffingtonpost.com%2Feliza-dushku%2Falbania-travel-_b_946341.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-338"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-338">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.aqshf.gov.al/">"AQSHF"</a>. <i>www.aqshf.gov.al</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=www.aqshf.gov.al&amp;rft.atitle=AQSHF&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.aqshf.gov.al%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></span>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Further_reading">Further reading</span></h2>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886047268">.mw-parser-output .refbegin{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul{list-style-type:none;margin-left:0}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>ul>li,.mw-parser-output .refbegin-hanging-indents>dl>dd{margin-left:0;padding-left:3.2em;text-indent:-3.2em;list-style:none}.mw-parser-output .refbegin-100{font-size:100%}</style><div class="refbegin" style=""> 
<ul><li><i>History of the Party of Labor of Albania</i>. Tirana: Institute of Marxist–Leninist Studies, 1971. 691 p.</li>
<li><cite class="citation book">Abrahams, Fred (2015). <i>Modern Albania: From Dictatorship to Democracy in Europe</i>. NYU Press. p.&#160;384. <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8147-0511-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8147-0511-7"><bdi>978-0-8147-0511-7</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Modern+Albania%3A+From+Dictatorship+to+Democracy+in+Europe&amp;rft.pages=384&amp;rft.pub=NYU+Press&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8147-0511-7&amp;rft.aulast=Abrahams&amp;rft.aufirst=Fred&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAlbania" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r886058088"/></li></ul>

</div></td><td class="navbox-image" rowspan="4" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px"><div><a href="/wiki/File:Balkan_topo_en.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Balkan topo en.jpg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Balkan_topo_en.jpg/100px-Balkan_topo_en.jpg" decoding="async" width="100" height="91" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Balkan_topo_en.jpg/150px-Balkan_topo_en.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Balkan_topo_en.jpg/200px-Balkan_topo_en.jpg 2x" data-file-width="840" data-file-height="767" /></a></div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Significantly located</th><td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px;background:transparent;"><div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Serbia" title="Serbia">Serbia</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greece</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Croatia" title="Croatia">Croatia</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Mostly outside of the peninsula</th><td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px;background:#f6f6f6;"><div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Slovenia" title="Slovenia">Slovenia</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Turkey" title="Turkey">Turkey</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">See also</th><td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px;background:transparent;"><div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Southeast_Europe" title="Southeast Europe">Southeast Europe</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Balkanization" title="Balkanization">Balkanization</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3"><div><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/2008_Kosovo_declaration_of_independence" title="2008 Kosovo declaration of independence">Declared independence</a> from Serbia on 17 February 2008 and is <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">recognised by&#160;112</a> <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_Nations_member_states" class="mw-redirect" title="List of United Nations member states">United Nations member states</a>,  while 10 states have recognized Kosovo only to later withdraw their recognition..</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<ul><li><span style="font-size:90%;"><a href="/wiki/Countries_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Countries of the United Kingdom">country of the United Kingdom</a> subject to the <a href="/wiki/Good_Friday_Agreement" title="Good Friday Agreement">British-Irish Agreement</a></span></li></ul></li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table><div></div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;"><div><div class="plainlist"><ul><li><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li><li><sup>2</sup> Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.</li></ul></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<div role="navigation" class="navbox" aria-labelledby="Enlargement_and_partners_of_the_European_Union" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="navbox-title" colspan="2"><div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:European_Union_candidates" title="Template:European Union candidates"><abbr title="View this template" style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;-moz-box-shadow:none;-webkit-box-shadow:none;box-shadow:none; <ul><li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Flag_of_Montenegro.svg/23px-Flag_of_Montenegro.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Flag_of_Montenegro.svg/35px-Flag_of_Montenegro.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Flag_of_Montenegro.svg/46px-Flag_of_Montenegro.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="640" data-file-height="320" />&#160;</span><a href="/wiki/Montenegro" title="Montenegro">Montenegro</a> <span style="font-size:85%;">(<a href="/wiki/Accession_of_Montenegro_to_the_European_Union" title="Accession of Montenegro to the European Union">status</a>)</span></li>
<li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/ff/Flag_of_Serbia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Serbia.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/ff/Flag_of_Serbia.svg/35px-Flag_of_Serbia.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/ff/Flag_of_Serbia.svg/45px-Flag_of_Serbia.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="945" data-file-height="630" />&#160;</span><a href="/wiki/Serbia" title="Serbia">Serbia</a> <span style="font-size:85%;">(<a href="/wiki/Accession_of_Serbia_to_the_European_Union" title="Accession of Serbia to the European Union">status</a>)</span></li>

<li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Flag_of_Tunisia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Tunisia.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Flag_of_Tunisia.svg/35px-Flag_of_Tunisia.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Flag_of_Tunisia.svg/45px-Flag_of_Tunisia.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800" />&#160;</span><a href="/wiki/Tunisia" title="Tunisia">Tunisia</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table><div></div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div>
